Mrs. Sokly A. and her husband, Mr. Chhum Choun, are farmers who work very hard to support their family living. With the farm they own a small piece of land to cultivate rice. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Sokly A. will use the loan who asked from AMK to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborer. This couple has two children, who are attending in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 51 años, es una madre D. familia muy jovial, vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Hace más D. 15 años se dedica en L. venta D. periódico, revista y algunos dulces. Cada mañana al llegar a su kiosco ordena los productos que tiene, D. manera que sea más vistoso posible  para su fácil venta. Su punto D. venta es en L. periferia del mercado junto a L. avenida principal D. L. ciudad, donD. sus compradores son los chóferes D. buses y personas que transitan cerca D. ahí. Se siente muy complacida por su negocio; ya que dice distraerse mucho conversando con sus clientes. En adelante,  piensa en terminar D. construir  su casa para el bienestar D. sus hijos y  diversificar su negocio. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente, asimismo con sus compañeras D. su grupo es muy atenta y se lleva con todas ellas. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará revistas D. todos los rubros, y D. ese modo tener variedad D. revistas en su kiosco.
texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old and the mother of a very happy family. She lives with her husband and their two children. For more than 15 years she has maD. a living selling newspapers, magazines and some candies. Every morning she arrives at her kiosk and sets up her items to make them as visible as possible to ensure an easy sale. Her newsstand is on the outskirts of the market along the city's main avenue, where her customers are bus drivers and people who pass through there. Victoria is very pleased with her business and says she really enjoys conversing with her clients. In the future, she plans to finish construction on her home to improve her children's well-being, and to also diversify her business. This is her 10th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. Along with her fellow group members she is very attentive and gets along with all of them. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase magazines for all kinds of trades and in this way add more variety of magazines to her kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on a wider variety of magazines

loans.name: Djemila

texts.en:
Madame Djemila M. sells pots, pans, and other cooking utensils at the Agoe Market in Lome, Togo. She has been engaged in this activity since about 2004. This is a lucrative business because of how useful and in demand such products are. 

Madame M. has requested a loan in the amount of 500,000 CFA in order to purchase cooking utensils as well as plastic bins and basins to sell at her stall. 

She is married to a customs officer and they have three children.

loans.use: To purchase utensils and plastic items to sell

loans.name: Benno Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité BENNO est formé de 18 membres. Il a vu le jour la veille du financement du Banc Villageois le 04/12/2007. Ce sont des femmes qui ont organisé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NOP SA JËKËR 

Madame FATOU N., debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo, avec une pochette jaune à la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. 

Elle est couturière en même temps restauratrice, elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. 

Son crédit lui permettra d'une part d'acheter des tissus qu'elle coud et revend dans son quartier. Et d'autre part, acheter des provisions pour faire des prestations en restauration

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la gestion financière de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benno solidarity group is made up of 18 members. It was established the day before the financing of the Banc Villageois on 4th December 2007. The women who set up this group are friends and neighbors. The group is part of the Banc Villageois in Nop sa Jëkër. Mrs. Fatou N., who is standing on the right of the photo with a yellow bag in her hand, is responsible for the group. She is 36 years old, married and mother to four children, who are in her care. She is a seamstress and at the same time owns a restaurant; she has been carrying out these activities for more than five years. Her loan will allow her to buy fabric which she sews and resells in her neighborhood. It will also allow her to buy provisions for her restauration service. Her objective is to support her husband in the financial management of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her sewing and restauration businesses

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline B. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 19 years old. Caroline is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Caroline owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling frozen foods in the local community members. Caroline has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Caroline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Caroline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Caroline from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años, es una madre de familia amable y cordial, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en casa de su madre. Recorriendo las calles de su distrito, Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa a sus amistades, familiares y algunas vecinas que viven cerca de su casa. La gran ventaja que tiene es que ella tiene buen gusto por seleccionar la ropa que vende y que son del gusto de la mayoría de los  clientes, motivo por el cual las prendas terminan por venderse rápido. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo,  aunque eso implica que tenga que caminar mucho ya que cuanto más vende, es más las ganancias que recibe. Con el tiempo desea poner una boutique, donde pueda exhibir en vitrinas la mercadería que posee y poder captar más clientes. Es si 25avo crédito con MFP y está feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá todo el dinero  en su negocio. En su grupo comunal, es muy querida por la solidaridad que demuestra. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará polos, buzos y demás ropa, para abastecer el pedido a sus clientas.
texts.en: Rosa, 50, is a friendly, courteous woman.  She lives in her mother's house with her husband and 5 children.  Rosa sells clothing for a living.  Her customers are her friends, her family and neighbors in the surrounding streets.  Her great advantage is her unerring taste.  She buys the kind of clothing that her customers want and, consequently, she can easily sell the clothing on to her customers.  She likes the work very much even though she spends a lot of time going door to door.  She doesn't mind because knows that the harder she works, the more she'll earn.  She would like to set up her own shop where she can display her merchandise and bring in customers.  This is Rosa's 25th MFP loan and she's very happy to get it.  She will invest the loan in her business.  She is very well regarded in her community group because she fully supports the other members.  The money from this loan will buy shirts, sweaters and other clothing that Rosa will stock for her customers.

loans.use: Buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 27  años de edad,  es soltero de profesión abogado, vive  con sus hermanos.
Jesús empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su vecino como mécanico de automóvil, para poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios, su padre es de profesión albañil y su madre es peluquera ambos trabajan en la Argentina para ayudarle a sus demás hermanos.
Jesús es un joven muy sacrificado quién siempre tuvo que trabajar para cubrir los gastos de su estudio y tambien ayudarles a sus hermanos menores.
Trabaja en un estudio jurídico con tres de sus compañeros de promoción, cuentan con muy buena clientela formada.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de una notebook ya que le será muy útil en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Jesús is 27 years old. He is single and a lawyer. He lives with his siblings. Jesús started to work when he was very young as a mechanic with his neighbor in order to cover his educatino expenses. His father is a bricklayer and his mother is a hairdresser. Both of them work in Argentina in order to help him and his siblings.  

Jesús is a very hardworking young man who has always had to work to pay for his studies and also to help his younger siblings. He works in a law office with three people he graduated with and they have good clientele. He needs the loan to buy a Notebook which will be very useful in his job.

loans.use: To buy a Notebook

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pov S. is a 39 year old married woman, and she is the group leader that was selected by its four members.  They are located in Samraong K'aer village in Kandal province.  Each member of this village will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Pov S. is a potato seller who is able to earn a small profit to support her family.  Since her business is going well she wants to expand it.  Thus she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more potatoes to enlarge her current business.  Her husband, Mr. Khim Nhor, 41 years old, works as a construction worker.

This couple have three children:  One is a medicine seller and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to enlarge her current business.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden E. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 52 years old. Eden is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Eden owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fruit especially "lanzones" in the local community. Eden has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fruit to sell. Eden is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Eden from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo A. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 60 years old. Rodrigo is married. To make a living, Rodrigo owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products, including fish like milk fish and sardines, in the local community. Rodrigo is just starting this business.

In 2010, Rodrigo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rodrigo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto, de 18 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador, que vive en compañía de su tío Armando, de 46 años, con quien vive en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced. El trabajo al que se dedica, Humberto, es la venta de electrodomésticos, y demás equipos tecnológicos en una reconocida empresa del país, ya tiene 3 meses trabajando en está empresa, y según menciona está orgulloso de poder poner en práctica sus técnicas de venta. Ya que según menciona, desde que era adolescente más o menos, hace 5 años, se dedica a la siembra de café y plátanos; los cuales heredó de su abuela Dora, de 71 años de edad; donde todos los fines de semana, cultiva y abona sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que producen en su mayoría café, los que gracias a su capacidad de poder de negociación,  vende en un cooperativa muy reconocida de exportación. Está es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y espera logar sus objetivos con la ayuda de su banco comunal, conformado por personas integras y honestas. Con el crédito que solicita, planea comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de café, y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en la contrata de peones para que le ayude en el mantenimiento de café.
texts.en:
Humberto, 18, is a single, hard working man living with his uncle, Armando, 46, in a rented house located in the city of La Merced.  Humberto sells home appliances and other technological devices in a firm that is well known nationwide.  He has been working for this firm for 3 months and he mentions that he’s proud to put his sales techniques to use.  He states that since he’s been an adolescent, five years more or less, he has farmed coffee and bananas that he inherited from his grandmother, Dora, 71.  Every weekend he cultivates and applies manure to his three hectares of farmland that produce mostly coffee which, thanks to his gifts for negotiation, he sells to a well known export cooperative.

This is the first time he’s gotten a loan from MFP and hopes to reach his goals with help from his communal bank which is composed of upstanding, honest people.

He will use the requested loan to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among his coffee plants and if there is enough money will invest in hiring laborers to help him care for the coffee.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and to hire laborers to care for the coffee crops.

loans.name: Rita Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Rita V. es socia del banco comunal Divino niño Jesús, vive por la ciudadela Simón Bolívar  en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad más importante del País, es de clima frió, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente es amable y calida.

La Señora. Rita tiene 38 años, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rita se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años, vende solo los fines de semana desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche.

Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a utilizar para el incremento de su negocio, comprando productos que le hacen falta. Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Rita V. is a member of the “Divino Niño Jesús” communal bank. She lives near the Simón Bolívar neighborhood in the city of Cuenca, which is the third most important city in the country. The climate is cool, the cuisine is quite varied, and it enchants both locals and foreigners. The people are friendly and welcoming. 

Rita is 38 years old. She is divorced and has 2 children who are 16 and 5 years old. Her first son studies in a high school in the city. She does not have her own house and lives in a rented house.

Rita sells fast food. She has been in this business for 3 years. She sells only on the weekends, from 3:00 in the afternoon until 7:00 at night. 

She is in her fourth loan with the communal bank. She will use the loan to grow her business by buying products that she needs. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora Rosmery V. B. tiene  años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler vivienda que esta ubicada en Tarija. Rosmery es madre soltera de un hijo, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su hijo. Rosmery se dedica desde hace mas de 7 años a trabajar en una empresa muy reconocida en esta ciudad la cual se dedica a la venta de comida rapida que es pollo a  la broster  la empresa se llama Crocan Pollo,  Rosmery quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su hijo, pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprarse un horno industrial para poder vender pollo a la broaster, 
Como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el credito sera destinado para la compra de dicho horno que es necesario para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Rosmery  nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra de mas maquinas industriales.
texts.en:
Rosmery V. B. lives in a rented home in Tarija.  She has a son and is a single mother. Because of life’s circumstances, she’s had to work in order to get ahead with her son.  For the past seven years, she’s worked for a well-known company, Crocan Pollo, selling fast food, broasted chicken.  Rosemary would like to have a better income in order to get ahead with her son, and she tells us that she would like to buy a commercial oven to be able to sell broasted chicken.

Since she already has some experience in this field, she will use the money to buy said oven which she needs in order to begin this venture.  Rosemary says that she would like to improve her living conditions, and so the next loan she requests will be for other commercial equipment.

loans.use: Commercial oven

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a beautician. She is a married lady with two children who go to school.  She has been running her salon for seven years.  She has seen a lot of growth in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  She has employed one person in her business.  She hopes to open other outlets for her business in the future.  She needs 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a hair dryer and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase art supplies

loans.name: Husein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 50 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في تنجيد المفروشات له في عمله 35سنة يحب عمله ويريد التجدد والتطور يريد تأمين عيش كريم له ولعائلته هو نشيط وله خبرة كبيرة في عمله يحلم بالتوسع والتطور يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة لدعم المصلحة من خشب وماكنة خياطة وغيره
texts.en: Husein is 50 years old, and married with a son. He works in furniture upholstery and has 35 years experience in this. He loves his business and wants to develop and renew it. He wants to secure a comfortable life for himself and his family. He is energetic and has a lot of experience in his work. He hopes to expand and develop his business. With this loan he wants to purchase new goods such as wood and a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase new goods such as wood and a sewing machine for his furniture upholstery business.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a young woman from Jabalia refugee camp; she has recently married. Iman took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home appliances such as an iron and a heater. She also wants to use part of the loan amount to fix the windows.

Iman's husband Abdul Qader appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman as are most Gaza Strip inhabitants.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances and fix her windows.

loans.name: Daniel Njoroge

texts.en:
Daniel has operated a business in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last eight years. He is 35 years old, married to Esther Wambui, and they have four children. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid all of his previous loan of Kshs 90,000 well and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy a new motorcycle. 

In future, Daniel hopes to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Nesiamon

texts.en:
Nesiamon S. O. is 31 years old. She is married and the mother of two school-going children. She is a mixed farmer who works her own piece of land. She has been in this business for the last seven years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.
Nesiamon learned about Kiva partner, KADET, through an awareness campaign done by KADET staff in her area of residence. She has been a good client with KADET and has repaid her loans well. This will be her fourth loan, which she plans to use to buy potatoes for planting, chemicals for spraying the farm and also sheep for fattening. With the profits she hopes to make from this loan, she intends to plant potatoes in a bigger piece of land and educate her children. Her future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land for commercial farming. She is a diligent woman who only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for planting, chemicals, and sheep for fattening

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 33 años de edad;  la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la ayuda brindada a su conyugue, su pareja es artista, el pinta cuadros en lienzo y bastidores rústicos, ella le apoya en todo lo que pueda y en la venta final de estos cuadros, la socia y su conyugue tienen desde hace 3 meses un espacio en internet en el cual exponen sus cuadros y mediante estos ellos pueden ofrecerlos; la socia ahora no tiene la dirección exacta de este sitio pero nos indica que esta a nombre de “ Simeon G.”; la socia desea poder tener una galería de los cuadros de su pareja para poder exponerlos y tener más diversidad para ofrecer al público, la socia desea el crédito para ayudar a su conyugue a comprar  los materiales para los lienzos y las pinturas para la elaboración de mayor numero de cuadros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de cuadros.

La socia  se encuentra feliz y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus respectivas cuotas en el tiempo programado en reunión y cumplir de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called "VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO".  This bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the province and state of Cuzco.  

The member is 33 years old.  She lives with her common law husband and has a two year old son.  She alternates between housework with helping her partner, who is an artist.  He paints on canvas with rustic frames. She helps him as much as she can, and helps sell his work.  For the past three months they have shown his work for sale online.  She does not have the exact address of the site, but says it is in the name of "Simeon G.." Nelida would like to have a gallery for her partner's work to be able to show them and have more diverse offerings for the public. She is requesting this loan to help him purchase canvas and paint to create more work.  

The associate is happy and promises to comply with the payment plan during the allotted time and to pay in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase materials to create painings.

loans.name: Jojie Dianne

texts.en:
Jojie Dianne is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 20 years old. Jojie Dianne is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Jojie Dianne owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Jojie Dianne has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In the picture are Jojie Dianne and her daughter.

In 2009, Jojie Dianne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jojie Dianne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jojie Dianne is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jojie Dianne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Rose Milenja

texts.en:
Rose is 48 years  old, married with 4 children. hse comes from Huruma Nairobi Kenya.
She has been in the fish business for 15 years and she is doing well. She needs to build a strong kiosk
where she will be selling her fish and will introduce vegetables too. Rose gets her customers from the estate
and from walk-ins.

Rose wants to open a butchery for fish in 5 years and her dream is to raise her family well.
Rose is a dedicated and determined person.

loans.use: To build a kiosk for her fish business and to add the sale of vegetables.

loans.name: Osman Adilson

texts.es:
Osman, es agricultor, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre y dos hermanos de 18 y 10 años de edad, él desde joven está dedicado a sembrar maíz, también trabaja de jornalero.
Actualmente está iniciando las labores de una nueva siembra, para lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sembrar la milpa.
Su objetivo es seguir trabajando para el sustento de su familia, ya que sus cultivos son parte del consumo familia y también comercializa para generar ganancias.
texts.en:
Osman, 23, is a farmer.  He is single and lives with his mother and his two sisters who are 18- and 10-years old, respectively.  He has worked, from the time he was a boy, at maize farming.  It's his main source of living, but he also works as a day laborer.
Osman is planning his next crop and he's applying for a loan that he will use to buy fertilizer and manure for his fields.  
His goal is to continue working so that he can go on supporting his family.  He grows maize not only to generate an income, but also because the family consumes part of what he grows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for a maize farming business.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel, a 27-year-old married father of one child who attends school, has a mixed farm in the town of Kitale that produces vegetables, onions and tomatoes. He earns additional income from his businesses of selling milk and operating his butchery shop in the same location.

Gabriel is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kes in order to purchase an additional stock of poultry. The extra income arising from this loan will help him improve his family's livelihood. Although he faces the challenges of diseases, insufficient poultry feeds and insufficient capital to expand his farming activities, he hopes that his poultry farm will have expanded in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of poultry.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
Ayde es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos aún estudiando.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
Desde hace seis años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de  venta de truchas (criadero de truchas), también se dedica a la producción y venta de alimentos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/.1200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de  seis sacos de alimentos para las truchas como nalchet, purina y otros.  Cada ocho meses los vende en Pomata.  En el negocio  de venta de comida le ayuda su mamá y su esposo se encarga del criadero de truchas.
Su sueño es tener una buena casa y darles estudios a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, los ahorros, la utilidad que genera el ahorro y el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Ayde is a member of the Communal Bank “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medallion) which is located in the District of Pomata, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children in school. Ayde has a high school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for six years. Her previous loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling farm-raised trout. She also prepares and sells food.

With this new loan of 1200 PEN, Ayde will invest in the purchase of six sacks of feed for her trout such as Nalchet, Purina, and other brands. Every eight months, she sells trout in Pomata. Her mother helps with her food business while her husband is in charge of raising the trout.

Her dreams include having a nice house and providing for her children’s education so that they can become professionals. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the convenience of the loan, the savings, the interest generated from the savings, and the available loans against the internal account.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of fish feed for her trout farm.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana sells cooked rice, salt and fried fish at Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Nana has been in this business for 10 years. She helps her spouse to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to acquire rice to cook and fish to fry for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to acquire rice to cook and fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is from Maligaya Echague. She is 41 years old, married and lives with three family members.

For the past five years Felma has been the owner of a furniture shop. She makes and sells chairs, tables, cabinets, beds and doors made of wood.

Felma has decided to apply for a 8,000 PHP loan to buy wood, varnish and nails for her furniture business. She is aiming to make more in profits so as to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish and nails for her furniture business.

loans.name: Silvia Fabiola

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es socia del banco comunal Las Colinas del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es policía.
Hace poco que trabaja con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta de ropas y sandalias y lo hace de forma ambulatoria, sus dos hijos todavía son pequeños y tiene también que atenderlos.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 ½ de sandalias, 6 polos, 6 blusas, 6 shores, 3 vestidos, 2 docenas de ropas interiores.
Con su trabajo puede ayudar a su esposo, porque el sueldo que tiene no es mucho y apenas les alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades básicas del hogar.
Más adelante espera contar  con una pequeña tienda de ropas y no tener que estar de un lado a otro, espera que Manuela Ramos le siga apoyando en su proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia is a member of the "Las Colinas" communal bank, in the Yarinacocha District in the Department of Ucayali.  She is 35 years old and married with two children.  Her husband is a policeman.

She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for a short time.  She works selling clothes and sandals, which she does as a street vendor.  Her two children are still young, and she still needs to look after them.

With this new loan of 1,700 New Soles, she will buy: 1.5 units of sandals, 6 units of polo shirts, 6 units of blouses, 6 units of shorts,and 2 dozen sets of underwear.

With her work, she is able to help her husband out, because the salary he earns isn't much, and barely stretches to cover their basic household needs.

She hopes later on to have a small clothing store, and not to have to go from one place to another.  She hopes that Manuela Ramos will continue to support her in her life goal.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma tiene 57 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, esta separada D. su esposo y vive en casa D. su hija junto a sus dos nietos. El trabajo D. Norma consiste en la venta D. sabanas, cubrecamas, fundas para almohadas, edredones. Ella realiza sus actividades en su casa por las mañanas, por las tardes sale a buscar a sus clientes, entre ellos están sus amigos, vecinos y algunos familiares. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad ya por casi un año, y le gusta lo que hace, pues le genera las ganancias suficientes para ella y para darles algo a sus niestos. Por otro lado, la desventaja D. este trabajo es que hay ocasiones en que los clientes no terminan D. pagar el producto elegido. Este será el tercer préstamo que tiene, y por tanto esta a la espera D. su apoyo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más artículos para abastecer su negocio, entre ellos sabanas, cubrecamas, edredones, fundas para almohadas.
texts.en: Norma is 57. She is a very happy and hard-working woman. She is separated from her husband and lives in her daughter's house with her two grandchildren. Norma sells sheets, bedspreads, pillow cases, and comforters. She makes her sales in her home in the mornings. In the afternoons she goes out to look for customers, among whom are her friends, neighbours and some family members. She has done this work for almost one year, and she likes what she does. It generates her sufficient income and she is able to give a little to her grandchildren. On the other hand, the disadvantage of this work is that there are times when her customers do not fulfill all of their payments. This will be her third loan, and she hopes for your support. With the requested funds, she will purchase more articles to stock her business, including: sheets, bedspreads, comforters, and pillowcases.

loans.use: to purchase sheets.

loans.name: Mopepe Ya Sika Plus Group

texts.en:
Marie is the leader of the community bank named “Mopepe ya Sika Plus” which means "new wind" in English. This group is made up of twenty-eight members firmly united to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Marie’s main business is selling cassava and corn flour in her area, located to the west of Kinshasa. Since 2000, she has been in the micro-business world. She has acquired solid experience in this area, works hard, and has good management skills, which will help her achieve her dream of one day becoming a food-trade woman. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business which earns her $30 per week. 

Marie is happy to be among DRC HOPE’s clients. She will increase her stock of products with her next loan by buying some sacks of cassava and corn flour and reselling them for a profit. At fifty-three years old, Marie is married and has eight children between eighteen and thirty-three years old. One of them goes to school.

loans.use: to reinforce the working capital by purchasing some sacks of cassava and corn flour and reselling them at a profit.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene 45 años está casada con el señor Manuel desde hace 19 años, de dicho matrimonio nacieron cinco hijos que aun depende ellos, Dulce de 18 años está estudiando la preparatoria, Rogelio de 16 años también se encuentra en la preparatoria, Lidia de 14 años está en la secundaria, Janet de 12 años está en la primaria, el más pequeño de 6 años Aron esta en primero de primaria.
La señora Juana y el señor Manuel son comerciantes desde hace 18 años ellos vende bolsas de platico, de rafia y mandiles venden en las plazas de los municipios más cercas de su comunidad venden camina nado a lo ellos le llaman ranchando, ella vende sábados domingos y lunes y su esposo todos los días.
Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para invertir en su negocio ya que le hacen falta varáis cosas las cantidades no las puede dar ya que depende del precio de cada artículo y falta ver si le conviene comprar por mayoreo u menudeo.
Su problema es que el placero no los deja vender y quizás cuando las ventas bajan y sacan ni para el pasaje sin embargo no es motivo para no tener metas ellos quieren que sus hijos terminen de estudiar y poner un local bien arreglado ya sea en la comunidad o en otro lugar.
“Gracias a FRAC y KIVA por el préstamo porque con su ayuda yo podre salir adelante”
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana is 45 and has been married to Manuel for 19 years.  They have five children who are still in their care, Dulce, 18, who is in high school, Rogelio, 16, also in high school, Lidia, 14, who is in junior high school, Janet, 12, in elementary, and the youngest, Aron, 6, in elementary.

Juana and Manuel are merchants and have been in business for 18 years selling plastic bags, raffia and leather aprons in the municipal plazas closest to their community.   They are street vendors and Juana works Saturday, Sunday and Monday and her husband everyday.  

She is requesting a loan to invest in the business since they are in need of several things.  She cannot specifiy quantities becaught it depends on the price of each item and whether it is purchased wholesale or retail.

The problems they run into are when plaza business owners make sales difficult or when sales are slow and they cannot even earn enough to cover their transportation.  But this does not mean that they do not have a goal which is for their children to finish their education.  They also want to set up a stand somewhere in the community or elsewhere.

"Thank you to FRAC and KIVA for this loan which will help me get ahead."

loans.use: To buy leather aprons and bags.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nenita is 44 years old.

Nenita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nenita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more corn to sell in her stall.

Nenita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more corn to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 48 year-old Fatu.  She is married to a driver and has a 32-year-old child. In 2006, Fatu established her cooking utensil business after dropping out of school due to the lack of financial support from her parents. Women were not encouraged to further their education at that time, so her alternative was to start doing business. She started trading in local produce and was able to save 40,000 SLL which she used to purchase household utensils to sell from home.  Within the year, she rented a stall in town and last year she was able to rent a shop to display her stock in larger quantity.  Fatu works 11-hour days seven days a week and earns about 1,000,000 SLL each month. Her major business challenges are transportation costs and foreign exchange. 

Fatu is requesting a 4,000,000 SLL loan to purchase pans, flasks, drinking buckets, stoves, food containers, and iron charcoal. She has successfully repaid a previous loan. Fatu hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, she plans to build a house and a store outlet to have her own business premises. Fatu thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, stoves, and home products to sell

loans.name: Twisungane Rgt Group

texts.fr:
Fabien fait partie du groupe Twisungane Rgt. Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec un enfant de 9 mois. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Fabien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des semences sélectionnées du riz.  Dans les prochaines années, Fabien voudrait agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Avec les profits, Fabien prévoit de soigner son enfant.
texts.en:
Fabien belongs to the group Twisungane Rgt. He is 28 years old and married, and he has a 9-month-old child. Fabien has a 6th grade education. He is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his first one with the micro-finance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers for rice farming. 

His strategy for business growth is to use select rice seeds. In the next few years, he would like to expand his rice fields. With the profits, Fabien plans on taking care of his child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for rice farming

loans.name: Zein Al Abidine

texts.en:
Zien Al Abidine is a 35-year-old married man and father of three children. He has worked in construction for 16 years, specializing in electrical work. He is a man of good reputation and has developed his business through good communication with people and contractors.
Zein Al Abidine is requesting his first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to replace his tools, such as the compressor, and many other electrical tools that are helpful in decreasing working time. He hopes he can expand his business and open a special construction services business with professional employees to reply to customers' needs.

loans.use: to replace his construction tools and machines.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a single parent and has two dependents. Ama sells cloth in Besease. She has been into this business since 12 years ago. She is responsible for the upkeep of her children. 

Ama will use her loan to purchase more cloth for sale. Ama plans to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth for sale.

loans.name: Epifania Elvira

texts.es: Epifania es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso, tiene 53 años, y es dueña de una Marisqueria, ella no tiene hijos,  la única familia que tiene son los que trabajan con ella, es socia de Finca desde hace 5 años. Epifania se siente muy bien en Finca, porque es mas que una institución que da préstamos, para ella es como estar en casa, por la buena atención y la hermandad que hay en su banco, prendió mucho en Finca y sabe que cuando tiene alguna emergencia puede venir a Finca y le ayudan, las capitaciones le encantan, gracias a sus ahorros se compró un carro y ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en una mampara para su marisquería, y también dispensadora de cremolada.
texts.en: Epifania is a member of the communal bank Glorioso.  She is 53 years old and owns a seafood restaurant.  She has no children and her only family are the people who work with her.  She has been involved with Finca for five years.  Epifania is content with Finca because it is more to her than a lending institution.  For her, it is more like being at home because of the attentiveness and friendship in her communal bank.  She has learned a lot from the institution and knows that in any emergency she can count on Finca.  She enjoys the training and, thanks to her savings, has been able to buy a car.  The new loan will be used to buy a partition for her seasfood restaurant and a crushed ice drink dispenser.

loans.use: To buy a partition for her business and a crushed ice drink dispenser.

loans.name: Rosmery Susan

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Rosmery; Continua con su negocio de compra y venta de artesanía como chompas, guantes, chalinas, y hace unos meses ella realiza muñecas de trapo, llamitas, osos con lana de alpaca, la socia esta exportando a paises como Inglaterra, España y desea seguir creciendo la socia tiene su pagina web y mediante este medio ha publicado sus trabajos y le compran los clientes que desean adquirir uno de sus trabajos, la socia tambien trabaja con su conyugue y amiga en la fabricación de busos, pantalones entre otros. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir en la compra de materiales para la confeccion y elaboracion de las muñecas de trapo y de los ositos y llamas, a la socia tambien le gustaria invertir el credito en la compra d euna maquina recubridora.
texts.en:
The member is Rosmery.  She continues to buy and sell handmade sweaters, gloves, and scarves.  A few months ago she also began making ​​rag dolls, toy llamas, and teddy bears with alpaca wool.  She is exporting her products to countries like England and Spain and would like to continue growing her business.  Rosmery has a website through which she advertises her products and through which clients can purchase her goods.  

Rosmery also works with her spouse and friend in the manufacture of pullovers, pants and more.  She wants to invest in the purchase of materials for making rag dolls, teddy bears and toy llamas.  She would also like to invest in a specialized sewing machine for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy materials for the manufacture of rag dolls, teddy bears and llamas on a specialized sewing machine.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in the Prey Chor district. She generates her income through selling groceries from a booth near her house. She is a mother of six children and only her last-born child is a single man who is now working in a neighboring country (Thailand) and sends part of his salary home to support the family. At present, Som owns just a few plots of farmland, which provide insufficient food for the whole year. As usual, she buys a stock of rice from local farmers in advance during the season to secure the family in the future. Thus, she is taking out a loan from HKL to purchase a stock of rice. Her business goal is to own a small store and sell groceries in a local market of the province.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice.

loans.name: Melisa Mariel

texts.es: Melisa de treinta años de edad vive con sus padres y sus dos  hijas. Ella posee una venta de ropa, camisas, blusas, pantalones, faldas entre otros, ya es muy conocida en la zona y últimamente ha aumentado su clientela pues lo que comercia es de excelente calidad, con precios accesibles y el servicio es inigualable; Melisa es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre se encuentra adelante de la competencia, su más grande secreto para llegar al éxito es la constancia y el amor en la labor que realiza, esta muy motivada y quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas etc.  Melisa tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Thirty-year-old Melisa lives with her parents and her two daughters.  She sells clothing, such as shirts, blouses, pants, and dresses, among other things.  She is well known in her neighborhood and lately her clientele has expanded because what she sells is of excellent quality, her prices are affordable, and her service is incomparable.  Melisa is a very hardworking woman who is always ahead of the competition.  Her biggest secret for success is perseverance and love for the work at hand.  She is very motivated and she wants to see her business grow, which is why she decided to ask Apoyo Integral for a loan that will enable her to buy blouses, dresses, pants, shirts, etc. at wholesale.  Melisa is confident that this will enable her to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, pants, and shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service her motorcycle.

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena K. has a small agency for copying and printing services and office materials. She runs this little business for more than 10 years. The hall in which her office is belongs to her family.

Milena is a ventilation engineer by education and has worked in a ventilation construction company for 6 years. She says she always wanted to have an own business so she left her job together with her mother. Now she runs the business alone and sometimes her daughter who is a student in Varna helps her.

Milena Kazandvieva needs a new professional copy machine and a scanner for her agency and she applies for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: a new professional copy machine and a scanner

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: I am a married man, a father of 6. I sell second-hand handbags for a living. I intend to use the loan to expand and diversify my business so as to enable me to pay school fees for my children with ease.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosita has a business selling gifts, jewelry, household plastic articles such as jugs, glass figurines, slippers, garbage cans, clothing hangers, rope and others. Her businesses has been located in her home for the last ten years. She began with very little money that she saved through a lot of effort. She tends to her clients from 6 am until 10 pm every day of the week.

Rosita needs a loan in order to buy school supplies and gifts. For the school year her clients have requested supplies from class lists.

Rosita is 39 years old and has two sons that are both students. With this loan, Rosita will invest in more products that will provide greater profits for her and will also be in accordance with client requests and her family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Rosita tiene su negocio de venta de regalos, bisuterías, artículos plásticos para el hogar como: Lavacaras, jarras, juegos de vasos y tazas plásticas, zapatillas, tachos de basuras, cestos de ropa, ropa y otros. Ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 10 años. Se inicio con pequeños ahorros que ella ahorro con mucho esfuerzo. Atiende a sus clientes desde las 6: AM a 22: PM todos los días de la semana.

Rosita necesita de un préstamo para poder comprar útiles escolares, regalos. Por ser época escolar sus clientes le han solicitado que les provea de las listas de útiles escolares.

Rosita tiene 39 años 2 hijos los mismos que están estudiando. Rosita indica que con el préstamo invertirá en mas productos que le proporcionara mayores ingresos y a su vez cumplirá con la demanda de sus clientes y el bienestar de su familia

loans.use: Invest in school products

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Business Description

Mrs. Carmen sells various products and gifts for every occasion. In addition, she has years of experience as a seamstress and she makes a type of knitting called bees nest which she supplies to a clothes factory. She also sells home products to her clients through credit arrangements which has been working out well for her.

Loan Use

Mrs. Carmen needs the credit to buy merchandise and raw material, given she is receiving more and more orders for her products and she lacks cloth to make her dresses.

Personal Information

Mrs. Carmen is 42 years old and she has four children of which two are students. Her house is made out of bamboo and her husband helps her at home. She has a stable family environment.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Carmen tienen a la venta artículos de novedad y regalos para toda ocasión, adema que hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración de vestidos y fabrica un tipo de tejido llamado nido de abeja que entrega a una fabrica de ropa. Ademase ella ha incursionado en un negocio de dejar artículos del hogar a crédito y le esta yendo muy bien.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería y materia prima pues cada vez son mas los pedidos que tiene y le falta tela para elaborar mas vestidos.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 42 años y cuatro hijos que estudian de los cuales dos estudian su casa es de caña su esposo le ayuda en la casa y tiene estabilidad familiar

loans.use: Buy merchandise and sewing materials

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
"I have a big construction project that I need to do. I need to install a concrete roof over our bathroom. It has been very difficult due to the lack of money, but I'm currently working very hard to make sure my family lives in better conditions." I'm requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 USD to install a concrete roof over my bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

"Tengo una construcción sin terminar y necesito poner techo de concreto en el baño de mi casa, me ha sido un poco difícil por falta de dinero pero estoy trabajando mucho para lograrlo y lograr que mi familia viva en mejores condiciones” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner techo de concreto en el baño de mi vivienda.

loans.use: to build a new roof for the bathroom

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Sra. Trinidad belongs to the "Mujeres del 2000" (Mothers of 2000) community bank in the Peruvian region of San Martin. She operates a business growing and selling garden produce.

Thanks to help from her husband and their children, as well as her own dedication and persistence, the business has grown considerably, from uncultivated lands at the beginning to fields of lettuce, onions, coriander, cucumbers, cabbage, etc., all of which is sold, at wholesale, in the nearby market at Tarapoto.

With a recently-granted loan of S/.2,500 (2,500 Peruvian soles or about US$833) from Manuela Ramos, to be repaid in 9 months, Trinidad will buy seeds, fertilizer and mesh (for protecting the crops) and repair her cultivator so that she can provide the quality of produce that her customers expect.

Sra. Trinidad is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children, for whom she works everyday so that they can fulfill their goals in life. Her future plans include growing and selling roses. She's already planted 200 rose bushes which will produce 200 roses a day next year.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Trinidad pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del 2000, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Lamas, distrito de Lamas, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Reynaldo Bartra 1080 y se dedica al cultivo y venta de hortalizas.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos y a la constancia y dedicación propia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, ya que cuando se inicio solo tenia tierras sin producción y actualmente cultiva hortalizas como lechuga, cebolla china, culantro, ají pimentón, pepinillo, repollo, las cuales las vende al por mayor en el mercado del distrito de Tarapoto.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ($ 833.00) el mismo que será pagado en 9 meses, comprará semillas en kilos, fertilizantes en frascos y sacos, malla sombreadora y reparar su motocultor, para obtener hortalizas de calidad y cumplir con las expectativas de sus clientes.

La señora Trinidad tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día para cumplir sus metas, uno de los proyectos que tiene en mente para el futuro, es dedicarse al cultivo y comercialización de rosas, actualmente tiene 200 plantones instalados con los cuales tendrá una producción de 200 rosas ínter diario, para el próximo año.

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers, along with maintenance costs for cultivator.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
I am Sajida B.. I was married when I was only 15. I am a mother of five children - two sons and three daughters. I have enrolled all of my children in school so that they can educate themselves and find better employment in the future. I learned stitching from my mother before I was married but could not practice it as a skill once I was married. This is because my husband did not want me to work. My husband runs a small spare parts business, which yields small profits.

My eldest son is now done with his studies and operates a motorcycle workshop. He not only repairs clients' bikes but also buys second hand bikes, repairs them and sells them at a good price. He now wishes to buy a few more second hand bikes for his business and requests a loan of $175.

loans.use: To expand her son's motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her inventory with more products

loans.name: Banda B7 B Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Cissy K..  She is currently a tailor and is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine.  Cissy is 35 years old and is married.  She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 14 and her children go to school.  Each week, Cissy makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the increased profits from her loan, she hopes to buy a plot of land  Cissy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time. Cissy is joined in her small group by Rose N., Kizza A.,  Scovia M., and Shamim M..  Rose N. is also a tailor and wants to add in business.  Kizza A. is a tailor a wants to buy more cloth materials and expand business.  Scovia M. operates a bar and wants to expand her business.  Shamim M. owns a salon and is requesting a loan to buy more salon equipment.

loans.use: To expand tailoring business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 38 years old and a married woman with 3 children, ages 18,15 and 13 years old. Sarah owns a Grocery, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Sarah has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her items.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is 32 years old and is a widow with 4 children, ranging in age from 3 to 14. Aysha is a cloth seller, a business she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the amount and variety of her products

loans.name: Felícita

texts.es:
Felicita is a sweet woman who earns a living by making cakes and pastries for her neighbors. Thanks to her great skills and creativity in making these delicious pastries, she receives many orders for every occasion. This business has helped her provide an education to her children, who are currently studying in the capital city and therefore need large sums of money. Felicita and her partner cover these expenses with her business and with the income he earns by selling books as a street vendor. Rosa must now increase her orders and speed up production. She therefore requires certain materials that will help boost sales. She would like to obtain those cake pans that will improve the appearance of her cakes, thereby causing customers to choose her baked goods at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Felicita es una dulce dama que se gana la vida haciendo pasteles o bocaditos que le piden sus vecinos y gracias a su gran habilidad y creatividad para elaborar estos riquísimos pastelitos recibe constantes pedidos para diversos compromisos.Esta actividad de igual manera le ha ayudado a educar a sus hijos quienes estudian en la capital y quienes por motivos de estudios requieren de grandes sumas de dinero y de inversión, gastos que son solventados con el trabajo de Felicita y su pareja quien se dedica a la venta de libros de manera ambulatoria.Siendo la educación de sus hijos la prioridad en su familia Rosa necesita incrementar sus pedidos y agilizar su trabajo, y requiere de ciertos materiales que ayude a mejorar sus ventas y adquirir estos moldes que le ayudarán a mejorar la presentación de sus pasteles y tener preferencia en el mercado.

loans.use: Purchase of bakeware to improve appearance of her cakes

loans.name: Cheikh Tidiane

texts.fr:
This young entrepreneur is in the business of hairstyling. Owner of a salon, he plans to use his loan to build up his equipment and improve his services. In his business, he employs three young people from Ziguinchor who thus won’t be tempted to immigrate illegally.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Ce jeune entrepreneur intervient dans le secteur de la coiffure. Propriétaire d'un salon , il compte avec ce crédit renforcer ses équipement et améliorer ses services. Par cette activité, il emploie trois (03) jeunes ziguinchorois qui ne seront pas tentés par l'immigration clandestine.

loans.use: Building up his barbershop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bedspreads, tablecloths, and similar goods to retail in her community.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes is 32 years old and separated from her husband. She lives with her little 6-year-old daughter Maria. She has a small metalworking shop which she installed in her parent´s house, where she lives. The work is rough. Lourdes has workers who help her but she manages everything. She has been doing this job for the past five years, during which time she has been very productive and happy doing the work.

She wants her daughter Maria to have a respectable life and to give her what she needs to have that, like an education. With a loan, she would like to buy more metal and increase production so she can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes tiene 32 años, está separada de su esposo, vive con su pequeña hija de 6 años llamada Maria. Se dedica a trabajar en el pequeño taller de metal que puso en la casa de sus padres que es donde vive, el trabajo es rudo, Lourdes tiene trabajadores que la ayudan, pero ella es la que maneja todo.Ella realiza este trabajo desde hace cinco años atrás, tiempo que ha venido siendo muy productivo, por lo que está contenta de realizarlo.

Quiere que su pequeña María tenga una vida digna, darle armas, como la educación, para que se defienda en la vida. Con el dinero obtenido quiere comprar más metal y aumentar su producción para expandir su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase metal for her workshop.

loans.name: Nelson Cecilio

texts.es: El Señor Nelson, tiene el negocio en la casa de su mamá, empezó a trabajar desde jovencito para ayudar a su familia en el mantenimiento de sus estudios, y ayudar también en los gastos de la casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su hemana mayor, quien está constantemente guiandolo para continuar sus estudios y mejorar cada vez más su negocio. Aspira a acrecentar su negocio y poder tener sucursales en la zona. Es una persona muy responsable, y buen cliente  de la institución. El crédito será invertido en la compra de material para ensamblaje de computadoras para la ampliación del negocio.
texts.en:
Nelson has a business in his mother's home. He started working when he was young in order to help his family, pay for school, and also to help pay for the costs of the home. He has the support of his older sister, who is constantly encouraging him to continue his studies and improve his business. He aspires to grow his business and be able to have business branches in the area. He is a very responsible person and a good client of Emprender. The loan will be invested in purchasing material for the assembly of computers in order to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase computers.

loans.name: Azizan

texts.en: Azizan baji is the wife of Z. A. and lives in a small place named Kot Radha Kishan of the city Kasur, Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishan is 40 kilometers from Kasur. She has been living in this place for the last 20 years. She is the mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her son is in 10th standard and her daughters are in 8th standard. Azizan baji’s husband runs a grocery shop. Azizan baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor C. is  50 years old and the mother of six. Her husband is a farmer, and two of their children are away studying in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. Flor never stops investing in and improving her business. 

In 1997, she started her hog-raising company with six piglets, using a CEV loan as start-up capital. She sells her output to hog buyers in the municipality of Sto.Niño. With this income, she has been able to renovate her house and pay her family's  daily expenses. 

She is requesting a new loan to buy additional livestock and animal feed. She believes that she could definitely increase her income if she could buy more hogs. “The demand for meat is extremely high, so I should grow more hogs to benefit from that demand," she said. “ If I get my requested loan, I could do more in my business”, she added.

By joining CEV, she gets the insurance benefits of our program as well as credit assistance and training.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Pum D. is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province. He is married to Heng Seang, age 31, a rice farmer. They have two children, all of whom are single. Mr. D. has been a local fisherman since 2000. He uses nets and traps from his fishing boat to catch fish in Tunle Sap Lake. Mr. D. is requesting a loan to purchase more fishing supplies for his business that will allow him to catch more fish. (Mr. D.'s wife is pictured because he was not available.)

loans.use: Purchase more fishing supplies

loans.name: Kankounding

texts.fr: Kankounding D., 49 ans, mariée est membre de banc villageois de Kadior à Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du mil, du citron et du bois pour préparer et vendre de la bouillie de mil. Ses revenus vont permettre d’assurer une partie des charges familiales.   Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Kankounding D., age 49, is married and has been a member of the village loan group of Kadior in Ziguinchor for seven and a half years. She want to buy millet, lemons, and wood to make millet porridge to sell. Her income enables her to ensure that a portion of the family expenses is covered. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, lemons, and wood to make and sell millet porridge

loans.name: Lucia Teodora

texts.es: Doña Lucia T. cuenta con 40 años de edad, es casada de oficios tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 15 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ellos puedan aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, aprovechando la oportunidad para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia T. is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children who live at home. She and her husband are tailors by trade, and their workshop has three looms. Their business also employs two other people. Doña Lucia has 15 years experience sewing for people from her home in Aldea V., in the Totonicapan district of Guatemala, and currently, there is a high demand for her work. Unfortunately, the current economic conditions make it difficult to raise the necessary capital, and for this reason, the couple has asked for a loan from ASDIR. They will use the loan to buy material so that they can increase their sales and take advantage of this opportunity to better the lives of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with one daughter. She sells clothing at one of the markets in Berdyansk city. Her monthly net income is 2,000 UAH. Ludmila has a good and caring family. Ludmila’s husband, Oleg, supports her in her business.

Ludmila has been in this business for 7 years. Good pricing policy, good client service, and a strong desire to go forward have helped Ludmila make her business a success.

Ludmila would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase the assortment she has to sell. The additional income would be spent on her family's needs: buying food, medicine, some clothing, etc.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothes for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 52 años, enviudó hace 3 años, tiene 7 hijos, pero ya ninguno vive con ella. En vida, su esposo trabajaba en una empresa de cemento, y en sus días libres cultivaba sus chacras con la ayuda de sus peones. Desde que falleció, María empezó en el negocio de la venta de ropa, para evitar la melancolía, desde entonces con mucho empeño y entusiasmo todos los viernes, sábados y domingos vende en los pueblos aledaños y el resto de los días acude a su casa a cuidar el jardín de su esposo. Llevar ropa a los pueblos le resulto muy favorable, porque le ha permitido crecer y ganar experiencia en el comercio, de lo cual se siente muy contenta por estar en contacto con la gente. Maria viaja a la capital cada 15 días para la compra de su mercadería y de paso aprovecha en visitar a sus hijos que viven en Lima, quienes la asesoran de la moda actual para cada prenda. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad en los pagos, y es muy comprometida en la organización de las actividades que realiza su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de ropa, para llevar los pedidos de sus clientes de las zonas rurales.
texts.en:
Maria E. C. is 52 years of age, and she has been a widow for three years. She has 7 children, none of which live with her. Before he died, her husband worked in a cement factory, and, with the help of some day laborers, he farmed in his spare time. After her husband died, Maria began a small business of selling clothing. With much hard work and enthusiasm she travels to nearby villages every Friday, Saturday and Sunday to sell her wares. The rest of the week she stays home to attend to the garden her late husband had prepared. She has been successful in selling clothing in the nearby villages. This experience has allowed her to grow her business, and to gain very valuable business experience. Every two weeks Maria travels to Lima to buy her clothing for resale. She takes advantage of this trip to visit with her children who live there. They also give her advice about what clothing to buy depending on current tastes. This will be the eighth loan Maria is requesting from MFP. She has shown responsibility and promptness in repayment of the previous loans, and she is an active member of the organization. The funds requested will be used as working capital, to allow her to buy merchandise for resale in the countryside.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - buying clothing for resale

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El señor Marcos P. y su esposa tienen un hijo, quieren darle lo mejor. En esté momento ellos están en el procesa de construcción de una cuarto ya que su vivienda solo tiene una habitación y su niño ya está creciendo y necesita su espacio. 
Portal motivo están solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material y así empezar la construcción de una cuarto en la parte trasera de la casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos P. and his wife have a son they want the best for. Right now they are in the process of building another room because they live in a one-room-house and their son is growing and needs his own space. They are applying for a loan so they can buy materials and begin building the room at the back of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construcción de un cuarto en la parte trasera de la casa

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est membre  de ce groupement depuis 7 ans. Elle mène une activité de vente de céréales locales comme le mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Son objectif est de participer beaucoup plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou S. has been a member of this association for seven years. She runs a business selling locally-grown plants like millet, peanuts and beans. Her goal is to take a much larger part in improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of millet, peanuts and beans

loans.name: Jesca's Group

texts.en:
K. Jesca is a hardworking and devoted married lady with seven children. The oldest is in university and she also cares for two orphans. She has a retail shop in Rwomuhoro Trading Centre that she has been running for ten years. She started with a very small shop which has now grown substantially.

For years she has been getting loans; this is her 16th loan. She has been able to attract many customers because she treats them well and has enough stock that is in demand. She has a goal of expanding her shop further so that she can increase her profit which is at 260,000 shillings per month now. Jesca needs this loan to be able buy more sugar, soap, salt and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.use: To restock sugar, salt, soap and other products

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs Cecilia P. formed this group in the Fátima neighborhood of the Ciudad del Este by contacting her neighbors and friends. She is the mother of seven children, and works selling food with her husband. 

The group is called 'Miraculous Medal' and is maD. up of 16 active and supportive women, all from the same area.  They all all engaged in different activities, such as clothing sales (selling pants, shirts); small grocery stores (selling brooms, dustpans, detergents, fabric softeners, meats, bananas, sodas, cookies, sugar, milk, oil, candies, melons, tomatoes, apples, onions, garlic); the sale of cosmetics (such as facial creams). Others are starting their own new businesses with a fixed income.  

The women applied each for a credit between 300,000 and 800,000 PYG which will be used for the purchase of merchandise for resale.  

1  Petrona G. D. S. – dressmaker 
2  Modesta P. – dressmaker 
3  Cynthia S.  – clothing sales
4  Maria Estela A. – small grocery store
5  Julia L. – clothing sales 
6  Cecilia P.  – clothing sales
7  Mirian T.  – lingerie sales 
8  Tomasa C. – used clothing sales 
9  Lelia A. – cosmetics sales 
10  Lucrecia M. – ice-cream sales
11  Dominga S.	 – clothing sales
12  Laura S.  – clothing sales
13  Maria G.	 – plastic sales
14  Nancy P. – clothing sales
15  Alicia P. – hair salon 
16  Blanca R. – clothing sales

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.en:
This committee was formed through the promotion from past months. The group is strong and has the desire to continue to improve. All of the women have their own business activities.

1. Juana G. -- Dressmaker
2. Josefina D. -- Domestic employee
3. Sonia C. -- Domestic employee
4. Fatima R.- 	Undergarment sales
5. Isidra A. -- Small grocery store
6. Marisa P. -- Domestic employee
7. Maria S. -- General sales
8. Gregoria V. -- Secretary
9. Carmen M. -- Convenience store
10. Maria V. -- Saleswoman
11. Myrian A. -- Clothing sales
12. Cornelia O. -- Convenience store
13. Ramona O. -- Beverages sales
14. Sonia P. -- Food sales
15. Maria O. -- Food sales
16. Teofila A. -- Fruit sales
17. Alberta A. -- General sales
18. Fidelina P. -- Domestic employee
19. Mirta F. -- Teacher

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for sale or of raw materials

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes H. is a poverty-fighting woman from the island village of Bombong in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is 45 years old and is married to Dominador, a 36-year-old fisherman. She is the mother of a daughter who is in high school.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2006 with bag full of hope to have the opportunity to rise above poverty. She use her previous loans as a continuous supply capital for her grocery business.
