Now, for her fourth loan, she proposes the amount of 20,000 pesos to buy 7 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of white sugar, 2 gallons of gasoline (for resale), and liquor, and among many other grocery items. She been in this kind of business for three years.

She dreams of really being able to provide the basics and any other needs of her child, especially for schooling. She dreams of having a bigger grocery and someday, she will hire employees.

loans.use: 7 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of white sugar, liqours and other grooceries for her general store

loans.name: Sanda Association Group

texts.en:
This is Abu K., Abu B., Harrison J. K., Adamsay S. and Sheika T.. They are motorbike riders in the town of Magburaka except for Adamsay S. who is a businesswoman. They call their group Sanda Association, named after their village. This will be the fourth loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva. With the help of previous loans, they have experienced a vast improvement in their lives, as their income levels have increased.

Abu K. (right) is the leader of the group. He was born in the town of Magburaka twenty-four years ago. He is married with one child who is still not of school-going age. Abu is an Okada (motor bike) rider. He transports people within Magburaka and surrounding villages and has been in this business for five years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta S. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 31 years old. Julieta is engaged and has 1 young child. To make a living, Julieta runs a general store where she sells a variety of products in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Josefina Hortencia

texts.es: La Señor Hortencia es conocida en su zona como tenchita con residencia en la zona 4 de Totonicapan ell visita las oficina para solicitar un credito que le servira para culminar sus estudios universitario en la elaboracion de una tesis por su trabajo no cuenta con el efectivo necesario ya que su fuente de ingreso como maestra de un colegio privado de la aldea Nimasac Totonicapan. Ella manifiesta que es una madre soltera pero lucha dia a dia para sobre vivir  para dar lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Hortencia is known in her area as Tenchita and lives in Zone 4 of the city of Totonicapan. She visited the office to request a loan to help her finish her university studies and make a thesis. She doesn't have the necessary funds from her job and source of income as a private school teacher in the village of Nimasac Totonicapan. She is a single mother who says she fights every day to survive and give a better life to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete her university education

loans.name: Aigbe

texts.en: Aigbe is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She lives in Benin City. She hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more foodstuffs. She thanks all Kiva lenders for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Dashdorj

texts.en:
Dashdorj B. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Both his young son and daughter attend a local secondary school.

B. operates a used clothing business out of a stall at the local market in his town. He started his business in 2007 with the help of his older sister after previously working as a herder for several years. In a short time, B. has made much progress in growing his business. His earnings have enabled him to buy out his sister and become the sole owner of the business, and he recently purchased a second stall at the market in order to expand his product offerings.

For the future, B. hopes to grow his business further and says, "My future business growth will help me provide for my children's education." He is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~840 USD) loan to purchase more clothes to increase his clothing inventory at his new stall.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to expand his clothing inventory at his new stall

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Eleuterio tiene 60 años, vive con su esposa quien lo apoya en todas sus decisiones y objetivos. La casa donde habitan es propia, gracias al arduo trabajo en su juventud.

Desde hace 8 años tiene en su casa con un tanque de 50 metros de altura con el que abastece de agua a más de 100 familias de la zona donde vive. Adicionalmente, se dedica al oficio de maestro constructor y debido a su buena labor es contratado por varias personas.
Lo que le gusta a Eleuterio de sus labores es sentirse activo y útil ante la sociedad, además le satisface mucho su trabajo porque le genera los ingresos necesarios para vivir y seguir adelante. Para el futuro quiere mandar a construir otro tanque en un terreno que tiene a dos horas de distancia de su casa para abastecer de agua a las personas que necesiten.

Con MFP ya tiene 3 préstamos y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son personas responsables y sobre todo, porque se ha ganado la confianza de ellos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará tubos para abastecer de agua a 50 personas más que requieren de este elemento útil en la vida diaria.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 60 years old, he lives with his wife who supports him with all his decisions and objectives. They own the house where they live, thanks to hard work in their youth.

For the past 8 years he has had a 50 meter tall tank from which he supplies more than 100 families in the area with water. Additionally he works as a building contractor and due to his good work he is hired by many people. What Eleuterio likes about his jobs is that he feels active and useful to society as well as satisfied with his work because it generates the necessary income to live and move ahead. For the future he wants to build another tank on land he owns two hours away from his home in order to distribute water to people that need it.

He has had 3 loans with MFP and he likes to work with his community bank as his partners are responsible and above all he has earned their trust. With the requested money he will buy tubes to supply 50 people, who need this useful element on a daily basis, with water.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tubes

loans.name: Roque

texts.en: Mr. Roque M. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old, is married, and is blessed with three adult children. Roque is a security guard of PLDT (Philippine Long Distance Telephone Company) and a motorcycle driver in the local community, earning 4,000 PHP monthly income. Currently, Roque is obtaining his 2nd loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP which will be used for buying housing materials and for his son’s tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay his son's tuition fees and to buy housing materials

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia es una socia emprendedora y muy colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali, tiene 44 años de edad, madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a venta de especias(saborizantes para los alimentos), desde hace muchos años, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es electricista. Forma parte del Banco Comunal ´´Las Lomas de Yarina´´ desde hace seis años, ella se siente contenta en el banco y agradece a Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque la ayudo a iniciar el negocio propio y  le a permitido ayudar a sus hijos en su educación, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo invirtió en la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, leche, arroz, aceite, para vender. En la actualidad Aurelia necesita en crédito de 1500 soles, que será utilizado para comprar productos de abarrotes en general para vender en su negocio. La meta de Aurelia es tener una tienda de produstos comestibles bien implementado y amplio para una mayor comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Aurelia is an enterprising member and contributes a lot to the group. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district, in the region of Ucayali. Aurelia is 44 years-old and has three children, all no longer minors. She has been working selling spices (flavoring for foods) for many years and has the support of her husband, who is an electrician. She has been a member of the Communal Bank "Las Lomas de Yarina" for six years. Aurelia is very happy with the bank and grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her own business, which allowed her to help her children get an education. Her first loan was 300 soles, which she invested in the purchase of basic necessities to sell such as milk, rice and oil. Currently Aurelia needs this loan of 1500 soles, which will be used to purchases grocery products to sell in her business. Her goal is to have a well furnished grocery store with a wide selection that will be more comfortable for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general grocery products for resale.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en: Adelita C. is from the village of Gumbil, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Adelita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Adelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is thirty-five years old and has two children with his wife. Both of his kids attend school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in their community.

The majority of the people in the community are into trading activities and Michael is a trader, too. He deals in mobile phones and accessories. He buys his wares from the capital city and sells in a kiosk by the roadside in his community.

Michael has been trading for five years. He wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more phones and accessories

loans.name: Siempre Viva Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Siempre Viva, inicia su segundo ciclo con 15 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. abarrotes en general, ropa, lubricantes, medicina, leña, comida.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Fernandina que es casada, tiene 45 años y tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días, Fernandina necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar.

Mientras Yessenia es soltera, tiene 30 años y venD. ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos y familiares, Yesenia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. chompas, casacas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total D. 10,050 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, leña, carne, ropa variada, medicinas, chompas casacas.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un negocio propio, aumentar sus ingresos y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank Siempre Viva has begun its second loan cycle with 15 members. These members have various businesses such as sales of groceries, clothing, lubricants, medicine, firewood and food. Fernandina is married, 45 years old, and has a stO. in her home from which she sells groceries everyday. Fernandina needs a loan of 300 soles, which she will use to purchase rice and sugar. Yessenia is single, 30 years old, and sells clothing by order to her friends and family. Yessenia needs a loan of 600 soles to invest in the purchase of sweaters and jackets. The partners require different loan amounts like 300, 600, and 1050 soles, totaling 10,050 soles for the communal bank. Their loans will be used to purchase rice, sugar, firewood, meat, various clothing, medicines, sweaters, and jackets. The members' dreams are that their children will become professionals, they will have their own businesses, they will increase their earnings, and they will be able to buy their own houses

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, firewood, meat, various clothing, medicines, sweaters, jackets

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es:
La Sra. Loydith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 59 años y 03 hijos todos ya independientes, presenta Estudios Superiores es Profesora D. Primaria, pero no ejerce, por que se dedica a trabajar.

Loydith,  se dedica a la venta D. Bocaditos y se inició con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00  Nuevos Soles y por iniciativa propia, implemento su pequeño negocio, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, donD. venD. sus bocaditos  como, dulces, keke, suspiros, budín y otros dulces más.

Con este crédito  D. S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para sus bocaditos como: harina en sacos, mantequilla en kilos, azúcar rubia y blanca, huevos en jabas, leche en cajas y parte del dinero lo invertirá  en utensilios D. cocina para brindar un servicio D. calidad.  

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas D. bocaditos. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con ella y otras mujeres que la necesitan, su meta es tener su Refrigerio bien surtido.
texts.en:
Ms. Loydith belongs to the Communal Bank 'Las Brisas", District of Bellavista, Province of Bellavista, Department of San Martin. She's married, 59 years old and has 3 children who are all independent. She has a college education and is an elementary school teacher, although she doesn't practice because she works. Loydith sells confections. She started with her first loan of S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles. By her own initiative, she started her small business in a well equipped locale to attend to her client. At present, she continues with the same business where she sells confections such as: candies, cake, merengues, pudding, and other sweets. With this loan of S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy ingredients for her confections, such as : sacks of flour, kilos of butter, brown and white sugar, cases of eggs, and crates of milk. She will invest part of the money in kitchen utensils to offer a quality service. She has the strength to continue with selling her confections. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women who need it. Her goal is to have a good selection in her cooler.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients for her confections.

loans.name: Pedrita's Group

texts.en:
Pedrita P. is from the village of Dela Paz, Panaon. She is 59 years old. Pedrita is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Pedrita is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Pedrita owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Pedrit has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Pedrita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrit has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Pedrita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Pedrita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cristian Group

texts.es:
María José P. H., Karla Patricia Hernández Hernández y  Cenia Delfina P. P. son tres mujeres trabajadoras quienes laboran arduamente con el objetivo de ayudar a su familia. Estas conformaron un grupo llamado Cristian donde la coordinadora es María José P. de 33 años la cual se dedica a la comercialización de variedad de productos desde calcetines, bisutería, prensa pelos,  desodorantes, perfumes, cosméticos etc.

Las otras dos integrantes Cenia Delfina P. P. vende cosméticos, ropa usada y nueva; mientras Karla Patricia Hernández Hernández comercializa ropa para niños de todo estilo y marca.
texts.en:
María José P. H., Karla Patricia Hernández Hernández and Cenia Delfina P. P. are three industrious women who work hard with the goal of helping their families. They have created a group called Cristian. María José P., the coordinator, is 33 years old and sells a variety of products such as socks, imitation jewelry, hair accessories, deodorants, perfumes and cosmetics, etc. Cenia Delfina P. P., one of the other members, sells cosmetics and new and used clothing. Karla Patricia Hernández Hernández sells an assortment of styles and brands of children’s clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy socks, imitation jewelry, hair accessories, deodorants, perfumes and cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Gansuh is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Hovd province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son, Uuganbayr, is nine years old and attends a local secondary school. His youngest son, Suhbaatar, is two years old and doesn't yet attend school. During the day, Gansuh operates a motorcycle spare parts trading business in his town. There are very few shops that sell the same products in his province, which is a great advantage for him. He has been successfully operating his business since 2003. Gansuh is taking a loan for the second time from XacBank. He has been planning to expand his spare parts trading shop.  Gansuh is a very hardworking person who has strong selling and communication skills. He is focused on the future and says, “I would like to expand my business and to build a house for my family on a plot of land that I purchased recently.” He is requesting a 300,000-tugrug loan to purchase more motorcycle spare parts at wholesales prices in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and resell them at his shop for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase motocycle spare parts

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
La señora M. es una profesora de educación primaria con más de 20 años de experiencia en su profesión en la cual atreves de su profesión ha brindado sabiduría a sus estudiantes que oscilan entre las edades de 7 – 11 años.
Este crédito es para sufragar los gastos del hogar ya que ella tenía que pagar los servicios de energía y teléfono ya que con su salario es algo bajo y no le habían mandado una ayuda su hija que se encuentra fuera del país ya que atreves de esa ayuda ella paga esos gastos
texts.en:
La señora M. es una profesora de educación primaria con más de 20 años de experiencia en su profesión en la cual atreves de su profesión ha brindado sabiduría a sus estudiantes que oscilan entre las edades de 7 – 11 años. Este crédito es para sufragar los gastos del hogar ya que ella tenía que pagar los servicios de energía y teléfono ya que con su salario es algo bajo y no le habían mandado una ayuda su hija que se encuentra fuera del país ya que atreves de esa ayuda ella paga esos gastos

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos personales

loans.name: Julia Piedad

texts.es:
Julia de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, actualmente vende almuerzos en su casa. Ya todos sus hijos se casaron y vive sola ya que se separo de su esposo hace unos años atrás. 

Julia empezó el negocio de almuerzo cuando sus hijos se casaron y cuando se separo de su esposo. Por la falta de ingresos decidió invertir sus ahorros en arroz, legumbres, carnes, mariscos para la venta de almuerzos, comenzó a repartir almuerzos a sus vecinos y amigos en sus casas, poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio. 

Ahora ella vende almuerzo utilizando el comedor de su casa para que las personas vallan a comer porque no tiene un local para un restaurante por falta de dinero. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, mariscos y también una parte del dinero quiere comprar cemento y bloques para remodelar su casa. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local para su restaurante y también un minimarket.
texts.en:
Julia, 58, lives in a periurban area in El Suburbio, Guayaquil; she sells prepared lunches from home. All of her children are married and she lives alone because she separated from her husband a few years back. Julia started her lunch business when her children got married and she separated from her husband. Because she lacked income she decided to invest her savings in rice, vegetables, meats and seafood for her lunches. She started to home deliver them among her friends and neighbors and gradually her business grew. Now she sells lunches using her home’s dining room where customers can come eat because she doesn’t have enough money to have a place to set up a restaurant. She will use the loan to buy rice and seafood and she’ll use part of it to buy cement and concrete blocks to remodel her house. She would love to have a place for her restaurant and a minimart in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, seafood, cement and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Nharn

texts.en:
Mrs. Nharn T. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Savoeun Nhorng, are farmers who own one and a half hectare of land on which they cultivate rice. 

Aside from being a farmer on her own land, Mrs. Nharn T. is also farm laborer where she can receive a small salary to support her family's needs. 

To support her crop, Mrs. Nharn T. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. 

This couple has two children who both are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité  Primavera  se encuentra en su décimo tercer ciclo, cada una se encuentra trabajando en sus actividades dependiendo de las facilidades con que cuentan.
Ademas realizan trabajos en conjunto para recaudar fondos, todas son muy responsables y activas, una de ellas es la señora Maria quien se dedica a la cofección de ropas para damas. 
Ella trabaja en su salon de acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe, asi ella puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
Su objetivo es la de trabajar mucho para terminar su vivienda.
Ella solicita el prestamo para la compra de pinturas para el salón y pago de mano de obra ya que quiere hacer algunas mejoras en su taller de costura.
texts.en:
The Primavera Group is in its thirteenth cycle, each one of its members working on her activities depending on the means available. In addition to working as a whole to raise funds, all of the members are very responsible and active. One of the them is Maria, who works making women’s clothing. She works in her living room, fulfilling the requests that she receives so she can her help her family with household expenses. Her goal is to work hard in order to finish her home. Maria is requesting a loan to buy paint for the living room and to pay for the labor since she wants to make some improvements in her sewing workspace.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint and payment for labor

loans.name: Mrs. Phea Chey Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phea C. is 31 years old and the village bank president. She was selected by the 13 members located in Paen Meas village in Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it for a different purpose. Mrs. Phea C. is a grocery seller in the local village. She is able to earn a small income to support her family. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Phea C. wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Pheakdey Ngoun, is a soldier who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has three children. One of her children attends the local school and the others are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz D. is from the village of Lower Dicayas. She is 62 years old and married with 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Beatriz operates a specialized retail store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community.

Beatriz has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month. In 2006, Beatriz joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to to purchase construction materials for house repair.

Beatriz is requesting her 7th loan from PMPC, for 7000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Maria Carmita

texts.es:
La Señora María Carmita C. es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral que es perteneciente al parroquia de Turi, la misma que es reconocida por ser el mirador del la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura mucha de su población ha migrado para ofrecer a sus familias un mejor futuro.

Nuestra socia tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 14 y 10 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y todo su dinero es para sus gastos personales, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su última hija estudia en la escuela; su esposo es albañil y con el esfuerzo de los dos han podido construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María Carmita se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aprovecha el tiempo en su casa para dedicarse a la cría de pollos y cuyes a los mismos que los vende vivos en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo, fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte de este gran grupo de señoras, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su meta es llegar a comprar una camioneta para vender sus pollos.
texts.en:
María Carmita C. is a member of the “Mujer y Fortaleza” (Women and Strength”) community bank. She lives in the Punta Corral area of Turi, known as a viewpoint over the city of Cuenca. The people in her community are farmers and raise livestock, though many have left the area in search of opportunities to better provide for their families. María Carmita is 37 years old, married, and has three children, ages 18, 14, and 10. Her oldest son works and uses his income to cover his personal expenses. Her second son is in high school and her young daughter is in elementary school. Her husband works in construction. Their hard work has enabled them to build their own home. María Carmita is a homemaker and uses her free time to raise chickens and guinea pigs to sell in her community. A friend invited her to be a part of this great group of women and now she is in her fourth loan cycle. She will invest this loan in the purchase of chickens and feed. Her goal is to be able to buy a pickup truck to use to sell her chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Claire runs a small eatery, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Claire has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more saucepans and stock food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Claire hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food and school fees.  In the future, Claire hopes to own a big restaurant. Claire is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by managing to provide the home needs in a timely manner. 

Note to lenders: 

BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food

loans.name: Nob Sa Jëkër Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NOB  SA JËKËR est né le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 18 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de NDIABOOT.

Madame NDATTE D., debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo avec un foulard noir sur la tête, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de poissons frais au marché de son quartier. Elle s'approvisionne sur place auprès des mareyeurs en provenance des villages de pêcheurs. Elle fait cette activité depuis 4 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son commerce de poissons frais en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement.

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group NOB SA JËKËR was created on December 5, 2007. It is composed of 18 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They established their group based on friendship and neighborhood. The solidarity group is affiliated with the NDIABOOT Banc Villageois. Mrs. NDATTE D., standing at the far right in the photo with a black scarf on her head, is the leader of the group. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She sells fresh fish at the market in her neighborhood. She gets her provisions on site from fish wholesalers from fishing villages. She has operated this business for 4 years. Her new loan will enable her to expand her fresh fish business by bolstering her stock. Her goal is to build her savings and to help her husband provide for the family’s financial needs.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell fish

loans.name: Davenews

texts.en: Davenews W. is a 36-year-old married father of three children. He has been in the motorbike and bicycle transport business for two years. Davenews is borrowing his first loan from KADET LTD and intends to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for transportation. He has been serving the residents of Mamba in Nyali and has been able to provide for his family with his income. Davenews hopes to save some money and open a business for his wife to be able to support his family better.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Jessica Pamela

texts.es:
En la calle San Eduardo vía a Santa Ana, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal “16 de Julio”.

La señora Jessica tiene 32 años de edad y tiene de casada 16 años, de esta relación procreo tres hijos de 15, 10 y 8 años, el mayor esta en colegio y los otros dos en la escuela. Su esposo es bodeguero en una constructora.

Tiene un salón de belleza junto con su hermana donde comparten el trabajo y por supuesto las ganancias del negocio, realizan muchos trabajos desde tinturados hasta depilaciones, trabajan todos los días  desde las 9 hasta las 19h00 y los sábados hasta las 22h00.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar tintes, cremas y otros productos de belleza que utilizan y que además venden en el salón. Es socia del Banco hace 4 ciclos y está muy a gusto porque en cada reunión aprende mas y se divierte con sus amigas.

Sus sueños son ser una gran cosmetóloga y tener su SPA.
texts.en:
The members of the “16 de Julio” (July 16) communal bank meet every two weeks on San Eduardo Street towards Santa Ana in Portoviejo, known as the City of Royal Tamarinds since colonial times.

Jessica is 32 years old, married for 16 years and has three children who are 15, 10 and 8 years old.  The oldest is in high school and the other two are in school.  Her husband is a warehouseman at a construction company.

She has a beauty salon with her sister where they share work and, of course, profits from the business.  They do all kinds of jobs from hair coloring to hair removal.  They work every day from 9am until 7pm and on Saturdays until 10pm.

The loan will be used to buy hair dyes, creams and other beauty products that they use and sell at the salon.  She has been a member of the Bank for 4 cycles and is very pleased because she learns more at each meeting and she enjoys her fellow members’ company.

Her dream is to become a great cosmetologist and to have her spa.

loans.use: To buy hair dye, creams and beauty products.

loans.name: Manos Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí se reunieron las mujeres interesadas con el objetivo de  aumentar su capital de trabajo emprendiendo actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinamos la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, a quienes les pareció interesante por ser una  oportunidad crediticia muy buena.
El comité lleva por nombre Manos Emprendedoras, las cuales debido a que todas las integrantes coinciden de que ésta oportunidad les servirá para progresar, actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo, integrada por  12   emprendedoras señoras, quienes se esmeran periódicamente para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. 
Todas las personas son muy trabajadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria C. quien se dedica a la confección de artesania, como fabricación de  frazadas y hamacas de hilos de algodón para esta epoca de primavera – verano.
Ella y otras integrantes se dedican a esta actividad y lo fabrican en forma continuada ya que tienen muchos clientes que solicitan para volver a vender en otras ciudades.
Esta muy satisfecha con su grupo ya que mediante ella puede obtener el crédito que facilita la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de sus artesanias.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguari women meet up who are interested in increasing their capital by setting out to do productive work. From there we coordinate the meetings to inform those who were interested about the program since it is a great loan opportunity.

The committee is named Enterprising Hands since all of the members agree that this opportunity will help them progress. Currently they are in their sixth loan cycle. The group is made up of 12 enterprising women who always do their best to increase their income hence they can offer the best to their families.

All of these individuals are hardworking and have invested their loans in their respective activities. One of the members is Mrs. Maria C. who makes traditional artwork such as blankets and hammocks from cotton for the spring and summer seasons.

She and other members are dedicated to this job since they have many clients that come back to buy and sell in other cities. She is very satisfied with her group since she is able to obtain the loan that helps her buy raw material to make her artwork.

loans.use: To buy various colors of cotton string.

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Minata O. est une veuve de 55 ans, vivant avec ses 4 enfants dans la grande famille de son défunt mari à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Minata O. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité de restauration il y’a environ six ans. Elle mène son activité devant une école tous les jours où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle composée d’ élèves et de professeurs pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’un an. Après un premier prêt individuel bien remboursé, elle sollicite un deuxième prêt individuel pour  acheter, 3 sacs de pomme de terre, 40kg de viande de bœuf, 60kg de poissons frais, 5 litres d’huile alimentaire, 2 paquets de maggi, 2 bidons de vinaigre, 20 sachets d’Attièkè, 1 sac de charbon de bois, des miches de pain,  des bananes (Aloko), etc.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiale et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Minata Outtara is a 55-year old widow. She lives with her four children in the extended family of her deceases husband in Kaboila II,  a central district of Sikasso (the third administrative Region of Mali). Having tried various business activities without success, about six years ago Minata Outtara  launched her food preparation business. She cooks her food in front of a school every day. Her business is very popular with customers, students and teachers, because of the high quality of her products. 

In order to meet the ever growing customer demand, more than a year ago she decided to return to the microfinance institution SOro Yiriwaso. After a duly repaid first loan, she is now seeking a third individual loan in order to purchase three bags of potations, 40 kg [approx 90 lbs] of beef, 60 kg [130 lbs], of fresh fish 5 liters [1.3 gal] of vegetable oil, two packs of Maggi bouillon cubes, two jugs of vinegar, 20 packs of  Attièkè [cassava root], 1 bag of charcoal, loaves bread, Aloko bananas [a snack made from fried bananas] etc. 

She plans to achieve a monthly income of 100,000 West Africna Francs, which will essentially be used to increase her working capital, contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on her loan.

loans.use: Purchasing raw materials for food production

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a thirty-six-year-old single mother of three children. She runs a retail shop and lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She dreams of constructing a personal permanent house and of transforming her retail shop into a wholesale shop. Paying school fees for all her children is not a simple task she says, thus the need for a loan. 

Harriet intends to use the loan funds to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for the children.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie E. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Lenie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lenie raises pigs for sale. Lenie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lenie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lenie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Lenie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
Lovella S. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old. Lovella is single and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Lovella owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including fish like milk fish & mackerel in the local community. Lovella has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lovella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lovella is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like salmon & sardines to buy and sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lovella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like salmon & sardines to buy and sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina B. is a 36-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a frozen foods business.  She lives in District 1, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her frozen foods business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 11,000. Christina is borrowing PHP 13,500 to continue to fund the operations of her frozen foods business. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Christina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her frozen foods

loans.name: Pedro Cesar

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y reside con sus padres en un barrio de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos descartables, como vasos, bolsas, platos y similares. Compra su mercadería en el mercado mayorista de Moshoqueque y lo vende en pueblos anexos a Chiclayo, como Ucupe, Mocupe, Cayalti, Nueva Arica,  Chepén Olmos y otros. Su mercadería la vende al contado y al crédito.  Esta actividad la realiza con la finalidad de incrementar sus ingresos y apoyar la economía de su familia

Pedro desea comprar más mercadería que al venderlos le generen mayores ganancias que le permitan seguir progresando y ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Pedro is 28, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

He works selling disposable plastic products like cups, plates, and similar products. He buys his merchandise in the Moshoqueque wholesale market and he sells his products in nearby towns like Ucupe, Mocupe, Cayalti, Nueva Arica, Chepen Olmos, and others. He sells his product for cash or credit. This job helps him earn an income that supports his family economically.

Pedro wants to buy more merchandise so his higher sales volume will result in a higher income, and he can help provide for his family. In order to reach his goals he has applied for a loan of 2,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Odette’s husband sells cattle and supports her in whatever she does. Odette has a shop in which she sells various home items such as soap, matches, and sugar. Odette has done this business for seven years and it has helped her to pay for her children’s school fees. Odette is requesting a new loan in order to expand her shop; she wants to buy other foodstuffs and items such as maize flour, bread, and juices. With the profits she plans buy more items and in the future she hopes to open up a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita O. is from the village of Cabantian, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Teresita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 18th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more barnyard animals.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 33 years old and married with two children. He has been operating a bodaboda (motorbike) transport business for five years. He also sells electronic goods for extra income. He has used his previous loans from Faulu Kenya to improve his business and hopes to open a wholesale shop in Kiambu town in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kes to add to his stock of electronic goods.

loans.use: To stock electronic goods

loans.name: Ingrid Katerine

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ingrid, ella tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y 10 años de edad, la mayor este año comienza la Universidad y el menor esta en escuela. Su esposo es maestro constructor.

Ella tiene una mini tienda de viveres de consumo y  también vende productos de Esika, (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), en su misma tienda realiza todas sus ventas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 20h00, los productos compra en Manta y algunos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva tres años con su tienda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, y productos de Esika como perfumes, cremas, entre otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal 6 años, es la tesorera del banco y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en sus negocios.
 
Su meta es terminar sus estudios y le gustaría ser farmacéutica.
texts.en:
In the Circunvalación [ring road] area of the city of Manta, the Nuevo Proyecto [New Project] communal bank meets every two weeks. The city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited by many domestic and foreign tourists during all seasons of the year. On the shores of the Pacific Ocean, it is one of the most important ports in Ecuador and in the Americas.

In this place, we meet Ingrid, who is 37 years old and married. She and her husband have two children, aged 17 and 10. The older one is starting at the university this year, and the younger one is in school. Her husband is a master builder. 

Ingrid has a small grocery store, and she also sells Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women). She sells all of her products in the same store. She works every day from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. She buys the products in Manta, and some of them are delivered to her store. She reports that she has operated her store for three years. 

She will use this loan to stock her store with more goods; she will buy rice, sugar, oil, and also Esika products such as perfumes and creams, among other products. She has been a member of the communal bank for 6 years; she is the bank's treasurer, and she likes it because the loans help the members very much with their businesses. 
 
Her goal is to finish her studies, and she would like to be a pharmacist.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil, as well as creams, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Mamia

texts.en:
K. Mamia lives in the village of Vedidkari, Martvili District. He has a greenhouse where he grows red and black roses. At the moment he has 2,700 rosebushes. Each bush bears on average 2-3 roses. He sells them to retailers. 

Mamia started this business eight years ago. The greenhouse is already old and needs renovation. The requested amount will be used to replace damaged glass and plastic. This will allow him to maintain the required temperature in the greenhouse. It will positively influence the quality of the flowers and thus their price as well. 

Mamia hopes that his income will increase. He plans to reinvest in the greenhouse. Also, he wants to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase glass and plastic for greenhouse renovation.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 31 years old.  She has 2 children who are 1 and 2 ½ years old.  Vestine owns and operates a shop in which she sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, coffee, sugar and powder milk. This business has enabled her to buy a piece of land. She is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell and make more profits. She plans to save all her profits and build a family house.

loans.use: buy items to resell such as cooking oil, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.en:
Scolastica D., who is in her early forties, is married with five children who are still at school. She has been a fish monger for five years. She buys her fish from the ocean area of Kigamboni, fries them and then takes them to her home area of Mbenzi for selling. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Scolastica's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more fish and repaid it successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her fish stock. Her dream is to one day buy land.

Scolastica will share this loan with her loan group "Twitange" which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans. In the picture, Scolastica is 3rd from the right in the front row wearing an orange sarong.(It was raining that day so the photo was not good and Fadhili K. was trying to adjust his glasses so his face was a bit covered).

loans.use: To increase her fish stock.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 36 ans, Kossiwa vit avec son mari et ses deux enfants. Elle est revendeuse  ambulante de pagnes et de basins  depuis 2003 et s’approvisionne au grand marché. Pour  épauler son époux elle s’acharne au quotidien pour ramener le minimum à la maison.
texts.en: A young woman of 36, Kossiwa lives with her husband and two kids. She has been retailing "pagnes" (traditional decorated fabric) and damask door-to-door since 2003, and gets her supplies from the great market. To support her husband, she strives daily to bring home a little sum of money.

loans.use: to purchase "pagnes" (traditional cloth) and damask.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He is an experienced industrial mechanic. He has been involved in this type of business for the past seven years. He works on a freelance basis. His work consists in repairing industrial machines. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to rent a small place where he will be able to conduct his business operation properly. In the future, he is planning to own a big garage.

loans.use: to rent a small place to do his work.

loans.name: La Presa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama La presa se encuentra localizado en Palo Blanco, en el estado D. Morelos México, está integrado por la señora Daniela va a comprar con su préstamo perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, labiales, la señora Socorro va a comprar aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, sopas, jabón , etc., la señora Agustina va a comprar manta tipo red para pescar mojarras, la señora Erisela va a comprar catálogos para empezar a vender zapatos, la señora Graciela va a comprar borregos para crianza, la señora Anahi va a comprar refrescos por mayoreo. 
La señora Agustina  tiene 46 años D. edad, ella estudio hasta el 4º. Año D. primaria, ella vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijas Tania Lizbeth D. 19 años D. edad ya trabaja, María Guadalupe D. 14 años D. edad no estudia y Alessandra Sofía D. 9 años D. edad está estudiando la primaria. Ella venD. mojarras tilapia y solicito su crédito para comprar tarrallas, redes y madera para hacer una lancha. Ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años, su esposo aprendió viendo a sus compañeros como pescaban, a él le prestaban la lancha y las redes para pescar; haciendo un gran esfuerzo ella y su esposo compraron la madera para construir su lancha y redes para trabajar en la pesca D. mojarras. 
Ella sale a vender las mojarras al mercado D. Tepalcingo y Axochiapan utilizando el transporte colectivo, su negocio es importante porque gracias a este negocio tiene para comer, ella está orgullosa D. tener un trabajo honrado y que tiene dinero, la mojarra que lleva a vender la termina toda por su buen sabor porque van vivas y frescas, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio es el clima, ya que en tiempo D. calor se mueren las mojarras por el calor, otro desafío es la competencia, pues hay mas compañeras que van a vender mojarras D. otras presas.
Las ganancias las utiliza para pagar el préstamo, para la comida y para la escuela D. su hija, ella tiene las esperanzas D. construir un cuarto para sus hijas y las mejorías que desea lograr para sus hijas son que  crezca, que ella les pueda dar lo mas que se pueda, que no deseen las cosas. 
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos mucho que nos apoyan con sus préstamos y que nos sigan apoyando, con su ayuda podemos salir adelante, muchas gracias que nos están prestando”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “La Presa” (The Dam) and is located in Palo Blanco in the Mexican state of Morelos.  Its members are Daniela who will buy perfume, creams, makeup, lipsticks, etc., Agustina, who will buy net-like cloth to fish tilapia, Socorro who will buy oil, sugar, toilet paper, soup, soap, etc., Erisela who will buy catalogues to start selling shoes, Graciela who will buy sheep to raise and Anahí who will buy soft drinks at wholesale.

Agustina is 46 years old.  She finished 4th graD..  She has a spouse and three daughters:  Tania Lizbeth, 19, who is already employed, María Guadalupe, 14, who does not go to school and Alessandra Sofía, 9, who is in elementary school.

She sells tilapia and asked for the loan to buy circular cast nets, nets and lumber to build a boat.  She started her business 20 years ago.  Her husband learned by watching his companions fish and they’d lend him the boat and nets so he could fish.  Thanks to  much effort on her and his part they bought lumber to build a boat of their own and nets to work fishing tilapia.

She goes out using public collective transportation to the Tepalcingo and Axochiapan markets to sell the tilapia.   Her business is important because thanks to it she has food to eat.  She is proud to have an honorable occupation and that she has money.  She sells out the tilapia she takes to sell because of its good flavor; she sells them alive and fresh.   The challenges she faces in business is the weather because during times of heat the tilapia die and another challenge is competition because there are many other companions that also go to sell tilapia from other dams.

She will use profits to repay the loan, for food and for her daughter’s education.  She hopes to build a bedroom for her daughters.  The improvements she wants to accomplish are so that her daughters will grow and she will be able to proviD. the most possible so that they won’t desire things.

The group members want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “We are very grateful for the support you’ve given us with the loans and please continue to support us.  With your help we can get ahead.  Thank you very much for lending to us.”

loans.use: to buy cast nets, nets and lumber to build a boat.

loans.name: Ashford

texts.en:
Ashford is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where he has been farming for five years. He has a mixed farm that is currently producing milk and vegetables. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family. He is 33, married and has two children who both attend school.

Ashford has requested a loan of 31,200 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that this loan will enable him to acquire a high-quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help him improve his family's livelihood and expand his farming activities.

His major challenge has been diseases and lack of enough capital to expand his farm. He hopes to acquire at least three high-quality dairy cows in the next five years and also venture into poultry farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Empresarios Surgiendo Con Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Empresarios Surgiendo con Esperanza” está conformado por 20 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran la venta de ropa de temporada, venta de frutas, verduras, mariscos y pescados. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Ricardo quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo, en el lugar del medio, su cabello es de color oscuro. Se dedica a vender pescados y mariscos en un mercado de la zona, ahí trabaja los días miércoles y sábado durante las mañanas. Su mercadería la compra dos veces a la semana directamente a un proveedor de pescado y mariscos. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 35 años. Experiencia que le ha servido para dirigir y administrar su negocio de la mejor manera posible. 
Con el crédito comprará pescados y mariscos para su negocio.
Sus metas son instalar su negocio en un local establecido, para esto se encuentra esperando un permiso para concretar sus proyectos. Ya que por ahora solo vende sus productos en forma ambulante. 
Ricardo comenta que sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, se deben a que le gusta lo que realiza, ya que también ha sido un negocio heredado.  
El vive junto a su esposa, sus tres hijos adultos y un nieto de 11 años de edad. Comenta que sus hijos ya son unos profesionales, por lo que sus sueños y expectativas están abocado directamente en su nieto, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ricardo está muy agradecido del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y junto con esto agradece también los valores inculcados por Fondo Esperanza, lo que ha generado unión y compromiso al interior del grupo del banco comunal. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “Empresarios Surgiendo con Esperanza” (Businesspeople Emerging with Hope).  It is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different fields including selling seasonal clothes, selling fruit, vegetables, seafood and fish.  They are all from the city of Valparaíso.

In the photo, Ricardo is at the back of the group.  He is the man with dark hair in the middle.  His business is selling fish and seafood in a market in the area.  He works there on Wednesday and Saturday mornings.  He buys his merchandise direct from a fish and seafood supplier twice a week.  He has been in this business for 35 years.  His experience has helped him to direct and manage his business in the best way possible.  He will use his loan to buy fish and seafood for his business.

Ricardo's goal is to set up his business in stable premises.  He is waiting for a permit so that he can carry out his plans.  Right now, he sells his products as an itinerant vendor.

Ricardo comments that his motivation for continuing in his business is that he enjoys what he does.  It is also an inherited business.

Ricardo lives together with his wife, his three adult children and an 11 year-old grandson.  He says that his children are now professionals so his dreams and hopes are now directly devoted to his grandson, towards providing him with a better quality of life.

Ricardo is very grateful for the loan he has obtained from Fondo Esperanza as it has allowed him to invest in his business.  He is also grateful for the values instilled by Fondo Esperanza which have created unity and commitment within the community bank.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers to the north-west of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and is also the seat of the country's legislative power.  It is the most important port in the nation and offers a wide variety of beautiful and picturesque places such as, for example, the home of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy fish and seafood for his business

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua buys rice, oil, and soap in large quantities and sells them to customers who live in the vicinity at Elmina. She is married and assists her husband with feeding, clothing, and educating her children. Her loan will be used to buy rice and soap for sale. Her future plan regarding her business is to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase rice and soap for sale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, with her children. She is a widow. Juliana works hard to support her children.

Juliana has been engaged in farming for more than 35 years. She grows rice and corn crops and sells her harvest to rice traders at her town. Juliana earns about 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming.

Juliana has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to acquire the farming equipment that she needs and to have a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand her stand and buy more chickens.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 48 years old and married with four children. She has been running her sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Amalia has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Dario Andres

texts.es:
Dario Andres  tiene 22 años, es soltero vive los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl.

Dario se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandúl. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar semillas de maíz, arroz, frejol gandúl y compra de insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos agrícolas para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades económicas. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder reunir dinero y comprarse una casa para poder casarse.

En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
22 year old Dario is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. He has no children. 
The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank are located in Amarillos which belongs to Ventanas Canton. They are short-cycle corn and rice farmers. 
Dario farms corn and rice. He buys his products in Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well. 
He is asking for a loan to buy seeds of corn, rice, and beans and to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for the crops. Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs. The challenges he faces are infestations of pests, illnesses, and climactic variations. His dream is to be able to save money and buy his own house so he can get married.
In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds of corn, rice, and beans, and to buy supplies and various fertilizers

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is divorced and has five children. She is standing close to the cupboard in which she stores the bread after she has taken it out of the oven to cool (she does this to prevent flies from settling on the bread before it is bagged). She has run her business for about 12 years. Theresa will use the loan to purchase flour, sugar, currants and other ingredients for baked goods. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to buy an additional oven.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, currants and other ingredients for baked goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yot

texts.en:
Yot, 49 years old, is a weaver. Her husband, Mao, 52, is a construction contractor. They have six children - two sons and four daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mao needs some money to pay his workers. That’s why Yot decided to ask for a loan of $400 to assist in her husband’s business.

Photo: Yot is not pictured with her loom because the house where she lives is flooded, so she needed to move her looms to a place that is not affected by flood.

loans.use: To assist in her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: German Santiago

texts.es:
Germán, quiere comprar laminas y cemento para la vivienda, por eso se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, ya que el anterior le sirvió para los insumos agrícolas, estas inversiones que realiza le ayudan para fortalecer el negocio, y en este momento para mejorar la vivienda. Con esto él quiere brindar a su familia una mejor comodidad y seguridad.
Germán esta agradecido, ya que en los pagos del prestamo anterior se atraso y por lo mismo dudo para solicitar otra vez, gracias Dios se le dio la oportunidad, esperando que esta vez no pasen percanses y pueda pagar puntualmente.
texts.en:
Germán wants to buy metal sheeting and cement for his house so has decided on a new loan since the previous one helped him get farm supplies.  These investments he makes help him strengthen the business and at present to improve his house.  He wants to provide his family with better comfort and security this way.

Germán is grateful because he was late with some of the previous loan payments so he was hesitant to request again but thank God he was given another opportunity and he’s hoping this time not to have any misfortunes and to be able to pay punctually.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and cement.

loans.name: Nabunulu Group

texts.en:
Martin is the facilitator of Nabunulu group. Martin and his group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Martin takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and due to his neighbor's experience in farming. In the recent 2011 season, Martin  had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Martin will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Nabunulu group will each plant maize plots between half and 1 acre of land.
The photograph shows Martin with his group members. The field officer is standing on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a seamstress and also sells ladies bags and underwear at Besease near Elmina. She has been into sewing for 12 years now. She is married to a fisherman and has one child. Veronica assists her husband in paying utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase bags and materials for sewing.  She will use her new profit to get a shop for her sewing.

loans.use: purchase bags and materials for sewing

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El señor Julio es un hombre casado que tiene 4 hijos, él menor de ellos tiene 4 años, se dedica a trabajar para poder darle una buena alimentación y educación a sus menores con la finalidad de que en algunos años se conviertan en unos grandes profesionales. Actualmente él vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ubicada en la costa Sur de la ciudad de Ica, a la vez se encuentra también en una de las zonas más sísmicas del Perú.

Julio es moto taxista desde hace 4 años, el está integrado a un grupo de moto taxis lo que le ayuda a tener más clientes debido a que las personas prefieren, por su seguridad, transportarse en una que pertenezca a una empresa. Para que una moto taxi pueda asociarse el que conducirá la moto debe comprarse una propia y es así como recien empieza a ser parte de este equipo.

El préstamo Kiva ayudará a Julio a poder mejorar algunas habitaciones en su casa y esto le permitirá brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños hijos. Su gran sueño es poder comprarse una nueva moto taxi y terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julio is married and has four children.  The youngest child is four years old.  Julio works in order to be able to give good food and education to his minor children.  He does this so that in some years they will become great professionals.  He currently lives in the city of Camaná on the southern coast of the city of Ica.  It is also one of the most seismic zones in Peru.

Julio has been a mototaxi (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver for four years.  He is part of a group of moto taxis, which helps him get more customers.  For their safety the customers prefer to use transportation that belongs to a business. In order for a moto taxi driver to be able to join the group he needs to buy his own motorbike.  That is how he recently started as part of this team.

The Kiva loan will help Julio be able to make some improvements to his house.  It will allow him to give his small children a better quality of life.  His big dream is to be able to buy a new moto taxi and to finish building his house.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a widow with five children. Her retail shop has been in operation for two years. She started the business from the sales income of farm produce.

Priscilla joined Milango to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy a sack of sugar and bags of beans. She aspires to own a wholesale shop. Her main challenges are price fluctuations, high fuel costs and some customers not paying on time. She will save the additional income.

loans.use: To buy a sack of sugar and bags of beans.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish and other seafood to sell.

Merlita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.
