loans.use: To buy additional fish and other seafood to sell

loans.name: Celso

texts.es: Celso, de 40 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador con muchas ganas de sobresalir, es soltero e independiente, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de  04 amistades compartiendo los gastos mutuamente. La actividad que realiza Celso es la agricultura para eso se ha asociado con su padre quien tiene un terreno donde cultivan semilla y verduras. En el departamento de San Martín, lugar donde Celso invierte su capital para luego ver las ganancias obtenidas  por cada producción sacada a la venta  al mercado, siendo sus ganancias derivadas a sus necesidades. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 06 años, y hasta ahora le gusta su actividad pues comparte con su padre un negocio familiar, además que siente que los apoya y logra generarse un ingreso económico para pagar sus gastos personales. Comenta asimismo, que no le agrada cuando alguna plaga quiere malograr sus cosechas pero los combate a tiempo. Ahora con las ganancias que le deja su trabajo, tiene planes de abrir un restaurante en la ciudad ya que conoce  de cocina. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente contento y agradecido por el apoyo financiero para continuar con su negocio, además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes que en mayoría son sus vecinos y los considera ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en el negocio que tiene en sociedad con su padre, pues comenta se acerca la fechas de siembra de semillas para un nueva producción.
texts.en:
40-year-old Celso is a hard-working man who has a great desire to do well in life.  He is single and independent.  He lives in a rental property, together with 4 friends, sharing expenses.  Celso's business is farming.  He works in company with his father who has a plot of land where they grow seeds and vegetables.  The land is located in San Martin department.  This is where Celso invests his capital.  He sees the profits that he makes from each harvest when he takes his produce to sell at market.  He uses his profits to cover his needs.  He has been in this business for nearly 6 years and, up to now, he has enjoyed working in his business as he shares the family business with his father.  He manages to make the income he needs to cover his personal expenses.  

Celso tells us that he doesn't like it when pests destroy his harvests but he combats them in a timely manner.  He now has plans to use the profits he makes in his work to open a restaurant in the city as he knows how to cook.  

This will be Celso's second loan from MFP.  He feels happy and grateful to be receiving financial support which will enable him to continue in his business.  He feels very much at ease with his community bank as he knows the other members.  They are mainly neighbors and he considers them to be responsible people.  Celso will invest the sum of 1,200 soles in the business he shares with his father as he says that it is time to sow seeds for a new growing cycle.

loans.use: to buy manure and vegetable seeds, and to hire laborers

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a hardworking married woman living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. She is a banana farmer who started out by harvesting 3 bunches of bananas and who can now harvest 80 bunches quarterly. Despite the fact that Violet has progressed in her farming, she faces the challenges of price fluctuations, inflation and banana bacterial wilt. Her dream is to educate her children, to build a permanent house and to buy land to grow crops. Violet needs this loan to rehabilitate her banana plantation.

loans.use: to rehabilitate her banana plantation

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es: Saúl de cincuenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia; él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor y  obtener las mejores cosechas; su terreno está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a la localidad donde reside, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela pues saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable siempre está a la orden de las personas; Saúl es un hombre muy trabajador, siempre dispuesto a salir adelante, tiene muchos sueños que desea cumplir y piensa luchar hasta lograrlo, uno de sus mayores sueños es hacer crecer su negocio, quiere aumentar la producción pues solo así aumentaran las ganancias, necesita comprar los insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Saúl tiene buen record de crédito y tiene excelente capacidad de pago por eso asegura saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, herbicida, herramienta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a used car to expand his taxi business.

loans.name: Tulipe

texts.en: Running a shop seven days a week and operating a barbeque stand is Tulipe’s line of work. She loves her work. SPBD has kindly assisted her in setting up her business.  She makes two hundred tala of profit daily. Tulipe’s income enables her to put her children in school and look after her family’s welfare both physically and spiritually. She trusts that the more she gives, the more she earns, and that everything she desires will be hers if she continues to work hard.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase snacks, turkey tails, chicken, mutton flap, coke, canned fish etc.  It will also help finance a home extension.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes will the loan to expand and diversify her business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson S. P. is 34 years old, married, and has 2 sons: one is 8 years old and goes to primary school, and the other is 2 years old.

Nelson has a micro-enterprise located in his home, a car repair shop. He learned the trade while working as a mechanic in a repair shop in the city, and little by little, he specialized and saved some money to buy materials and start his own shop.

Nowadays, he works with his brother, and they have a lot of work. Because he didn't own the house where he lived and where his workshop is, he decided to buy it and has been paying for it. In order to pay it off completely, he needs a loan of $600 with which he will finish the purchase.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original loan description in Spanish:

Nelson S. P. tiene 34 años de edad está casado y tiene dos hijos varones, uno de 8 años que ya va a la escuela primaria y otro de 2 años.

Nelson tiene una microempresa ubicada en su casa, es dueño de un taller mecánico para autos. Aprendió el oficio trabajando varios años como ayudante en un taller de la ciudad, de a poco fue especializándose y junto unos ahorros con los que pudo comprar materiales y montar su taller.

Hoy día trabaja con su hermano y tienen bastante trabajo; como la casa en la que viven y que en donde también se encuentra el taller, no es propio, el ha decidido comprar la casa y la está pagando actualmente. Para completar su pago necesita un préstamo de $ 600 con lo que cancelará la compra.

loans.use: To pay off the purchase of his home and workshop

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her two working-age children. Antonia supports herself and her family selling new and used clothing at Santa Cruz's various markets. It is a very competitive business, but with seven years of experience Antonia understands what locations are profitable. She treats her customers well and has a knack for sales. At this time she is asking for a loan to buy clothing for men, women and children. The cost of the items varies according to their quality. Antonia has a good track-record with this institution and no other outstanding debts.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Antonia es una madre soltera que trabaja como comerciante de ropa nueva y usada en las diferentes ferias ambulantes de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, esto con el fin de mantener a su familia que está conformada por sus dos hijos, quienes también ayudan económicamente a la familia ya que trabajan de manera independiente.Todos viven juntos en el inmueble de Antonia. El comercio por menor de ropa es un mercado bastante competitivo en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, pero los siete años de experiencia con los que cuenta Antonia en este rubro, le permiten tener conocimiento de los mejores lugares para ofrecer la misma, además de la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes y lo más importante el poder de convencimiento que posee le permiten ser bastante competitiva. La presente solicitud tiene como objeto la compra de mercadería variada, ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, los precios varían de acuerdo a la calidad de las prendas. Los antecedentes crediticios de Antonia son buenos en nuestra Institución, actualmente no tiene otras deudas más.

loans.use: To buy new and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene is 54 years old, married, and has two children. Rene is a contract bricklayer, and his wife sells food in their guest house. With these businesses they can meet their family's needs. Rene has a lot of experience in the field of construction, and his wife has been making and selling food in their guest house for quite some time as well.

In the construction field there isn't as much competition as there is in the food business. The family is well established and well known in the area, and Rene's wife has a reputation for delicious cooking. Rene also offers excellent quality services and is known for his high quality work.

The present loan is for the purchase of a freezer and also supply the guest house with items. Rene does not have debts to any other institution other than ours.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Rene es una persona de 54 años de edad, su familia se encuentra compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos. Rene presta sus servicios como albañil contratista, por otra parte su esposa vende comida en su pensión ambos atiendes estos negocios par abastercer las necesidades de la familia. Rene tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro de la construcción, así también su esposa atiende hace bastante tiempo en su pensión con el negocio de las comidas.

En el rubro de la construcción actualmente no hay tanta competencia como en el de comidas, pero debido a que la familia es antigua en la zona, son bastante conocidos y la sra. tiene reputación de cocinar muy rico. Rene por su parte se dedica a ofrecer servicios de excelente calidad y también atiende con el acabado de obra fina.

La presente solicitud es para la compra de un freezer y también para abastecer de diferentes cosas la pensión. Rene actualmente no tiene deudas en ninguna Institución ajena a la nuestra.

loans.use: Freezer and supplies for guest house.

loans.name: Ugilkhon

texts.en: Ugilkhon A. is married and she lives with her family in Spitamen. She works in bazar 5 years and during her experience in materials' sale she showed herself as very capable of making business, she is quick and smart. They like her good assortment. Her turnover is fast and now she is seeking an extra capital for expanding her assortment of materials in order to satisfy customer demands and improve her income.

loans.use: Business expansion and variety of goods

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.en:
Vilma, And Maria, and Eudosia have been part of the community bank “Solución” for four, five, two years respectively.  In their community bank they have learned to be responsible, how to care for their children, how to have healthy relationships with their husbands, and to be punctual. 
Vilma is 28 and has one 12-year-old son.  She sells groceries, vegetables, and meats in the markets of the Ayacuchan jungle.  She has done this for the past 11 years, since she was very young.  From the jungle she brings coco, peanuts, and coffee, which she sells on the return trip.  On the other hand, Ana Maria is 38 and has four children.  She has three stands where she sells CDs and DVDs.  She has been in this business for 13 years.  Now she is helping her daughters who need to work.  Meanwhile Eudosia is 51 years old and has one 18-year-old son.  She sells groceries from her friend’s house in the Belén neighborhood.  Before she sold grains at open-air markets in the region.  She chose to start a new business in order to spend more time with her children.
Vilma, Ana Maria, and Eudosia need loans of 400, 600, and 100 soles, which they will invest in buying fish, celery, onion, chilli, carrots, sugar, beans, shoes, dies, soap, detergents, oil, milk and condiments.  Their savings are to expand the merchandise in their businesses, to educate their children, and to improve the roof on their house.  Ana Maria’s dream is to have a second business, and that her children can be professionals.  On the other hand Vilma dreams of having a car and a piece of land.  Meanwhile, Eudosia’s dream is to have a bigger business.

loans.use: Vilma, Ana Maria, and Eudosia need loans of 400, 600, and 100 soles, which they will invest in buying fish, celery, onion, chilli, carrots, sugar, beans, shoes, dies, soap, detergents, oil, milk and condiments.

loans.name: Kazo 11 Abamwe Group

texts.en: Evaristo T., 48 years old, is the chairperson of Kazo 11 Abamwe, and has seen his business grow over years. He is married, has 7 children and 2 other dependants, and is a boda boda cyclist by profession. “Boda boda” is a term used in Uganda for motorcycle business which Evaristo has been involved in for the last 3 years. He has borrowed from this loan organization before, and his previous loans have enabled him to buy a new motorcycle and to pay school fees for his children. Now, Evaristo and his loan group are asking for a loan to purchase a number of cows and to develop Evaristo's piece of land by building houses for commercial purposes. All members of the group are certain that, with the help of the loan, their business ideas will be implemented successfully.

loans.use: 1) Purchase of cows and 2) development of a piece of land by building houses for commercial purposes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix the outside appearance of his restaurants

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr:
Kadidiatou G. is a mother who is responsible for her seven children and two girls. She sells food items: palm oil, vegetables, and peanut butter in the Diaobé marketplace. Her income enables her to support her family. Kadidiatou is a loyal customer and is exemplary within her group. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Kadidiatou G. est une mère qui a à sa charge ses 07 enfants et 02 fillettes, Elle vend des produits alimentaires ; huile de palme, légumes et pâte d’arachide au niveau du marché de Diaobé. Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille. Kadidiatou est une cliente fidèle et un modèle au niveau de son groupe. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de 6 mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, vegetables, and peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in the purchase of merchandise for the back-to-school season

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith is a happy woman who every morning she goes out to sell products from the farm. She doesn't have a stand to make her sales so she set herself up in the entrance of the market of her city. She very gladly offers her products to the patrons. For Edith this work is beautiful because she always makes new friendships and she partakes of hours of company and this makes her work fun, leaving all the problems aside. She dedicates her time eagerly to her work, working to sell corn at the doors of the market. But now she's been thinking she'd like to purchase a stand where she can sell her products and she needs your support to do it. This stand will her her increase her family's income, and for this she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

EDITH, es una alegre mujer que todas las mañanas sale a vender sus productos agrícolas y por la falta de un puesto para poder vender, se las ingenió para instalarse en la entrada del mercado de su ciudad donde muy alegremente ofrece sus productos a las personas.Para Edith este trabajo es muy hermoso porque siempre comparte con sus amistades horas de compañía y esto hace de su trabajo algo divertido dejando de lado los problemas, dedicándose íntegramente a su trabajo y así la vimos trabajando vendiendo su maíz en la puerta del mercado Pero ahora tiene pensado comprarse un puesto donde vender sus productos y requiere de su apoyo para adquirir este puesto que le ayudaría a aumentar sus ingresos familiares y solicita un préstamo.

loans.use: To acquire a stand within the safety and security of the market.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita B., 44, is married and has 5 children. For 3 years, she has had a farm growing vegetables. She sells vegetables to the villagers 3 days per week. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, barbed wire, nails, chemicals, and other supplies for her farming needs. She expects her weekly net profit will be 200 Tala (about 83 USD).

Makerita has had 2 previous loans from SPBD. SPBD loans are Makerita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, barbed wire, nails, chemicals, and knives

loans.name: Thi Ngoc

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngoc has been a member of the TYM Fund for 6 years. During these years, she has always been an active and model member. Even though she is very busy with her business of renting tractors and other farming equipments, she always sets aside some time to share her business experiences with other members of the TYM Fund. She also participates enthusiastically in the activities organised by the Fund. After 6 years of borrowing to invest in buying and renting tractors and other farming equipments to meet the demand of the people around the area, her family's economy has improved. Apart from renting, Mrs. Ngoc also sells general goods in the market to increase her family's income. She has just built a new house and is able to send all her children to school. This time, she would like to borrow 15,000,000VND (900USD) to purchase more tractors and ploughs to rent out. Her family's monthly income is 5,000,000VND (about 300USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngọc tham gia Quỹ tình thương đã được 6 năm. Trong suốt những năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Ngọc luôn là thành viên gương mẫu và tích cực của cụm. Mặc dù công việc kinh doanh máy cày và dịch vụ công nông của gia đình chị rất bận rộn nhưng chị Ngọc luôn dành thời gian để chia sẻ kinh nghiệm làm ăn với các thành viên trong Cụm và tham gia rất nhiệt tình các hoạt động do Cụm và Quỹ tình thương tổ chức. Đến nay qua 6 năm vay vốn của Quỹ để đầu tư vào dự án mua máy cày bừa, công nông phục vụ bà con trong xóm và các vùng lân cận kinh tế gia đình chị đã phátt triển rất ổn định. Ngoài thời gian phục vụ bà con trong dịp mùa chị Ngọc còn đi chợ buôn bán để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Gia đình chị mới đầu tư xây mới được căn nhà cao tầng rất khang trang, 2 con của chị cũng được đầu tư cho học hành đầy đủ. Chị mong muốn được vay thêm 15.000.000 để đầu tư mua thêm máy cày về để phục vụ kinh doanh. Hàng tháng gia đình chị thu nhập 5.000.000đ.

loans.use: Renting tractors and farming equipments

loans.name: Akofa

texts.fr: Akofa A. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. EIle habite à  Apéyémé un village commercial des plateaux de Danyi à 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle achète à chaque saison des produits tropicaux tels le café et le cacao qu’elle revend à aux exportateurs. Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle désire acheter beaucoup plus du café e du cacao pour la revente. Akofa compte vraiment gagner avec cette opportunité de kiva ce qui lui permettra de rembourser promptement et améliorer la qualité de la vie.
texts.en:
At 38, Akofa A. is married and the mother of five children. She lives in Apéyémé, a village on the Danyi plateau, about 170 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. Each season, she buys tropical products like coffee and cacao, which she sells to exporters. With this loan, she wishes to buy large quantities of coffee and cacao for resale. Akofa expects to profit greatly from this opportunity Kiva has given her, which will allow her to repay her loan promptly and improve her quality of life.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee and cacao for resale

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano se formo  recientemente, son un grupo que esta en 1er. Ciclo.
Pertenecen a la zona de km. 15. San Lorenzo, un donde conviven personas de escasos recursos.
Las señoras se dedican a la venta de productos vaR. en sus hogares, las demás hacen venta de ropas, remedios y comidas, algunas en su casa y otras recorren de puerta en puerta.
Como grupo es un comité nuevo que ya realizo actividades de ayuda para las integrantes.
En este ciclo se nota el esfuerzo de las señoras por salir adelante y el apoyo de su grupo ha sido fundamental para hacerlas crecer en su actividades económicas y también en su autoestima que se ha desarrollado por la forma en que ellas son protagonistas e importantes con su trabajo en el grupo.
Las integrantes se dedican cada una a actividades diferentes, que a continuacion detallamos:

NOMBRE, APELLIDO Y NEGOCIO U OFICIO. EJ.:
1-Marilyn G. Jara.Venta de merceria y perfumes.
2-Estefana R..  Venta De Comidas y panaderia.
3-Sonia M.. Venta de producto de belleza.
4-Ramona R..venta de remedios naturales.
5-Norma G.. Venta de merceria.
6-Ynes P..Vta de Ropas.
7-Nidia L.. Vendedora de ropa.
8-Elsa MedinaVta. Venta de merceria.
9-Selva P.. Peluquera.
10-Maria S.. Venta de ajo.
11-Maria Enciso Venta de fruta.
12-Francisca B.. Venta de articulos para el hogar.
13-Barcilicia L.. Venta de comestibles y modista.
14-Cristina BarR.. Venta de za`patos.
15-Alba S.. Modista.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano group was recently formed; they are in their first loan cycle. They are located in the zone around Km. 15 in San Lorenzo, an area in which people of limited resources live. Some women work selling various products in their homes and the others sell clothing, medicines and food, some in their homes and others sell door to door. Even though the group is new they have already performed activities to help the group members. In this group the effort of the women to get ahead can be seen and the group's support has been fundamental to the growth of their economic activities as well as their self-esteem, which has grown because each person's work is important to the group. The members each work in different activities, as detailed below: 1-Marilyn G. Jara. Sells products for sewing and perfumes. 2-Estefana R.. Sells food and baked goods. 3-Sonia M.. Sells beauty products. 4-Ramona R.. Sells natural remedies. 5-Norma G.. Sells products for sewing. 6-Ynes P.. Sells clothing. 7-Nidia L.. Sells clothing. 8-Elsa MedinaVta. Sells products for sewing. 9-Selva P.. Hairdresser. 10-Maria S.. Sells garlic. 11-Maria Enciso. Sells fruit. 12-Francisca B.. Sells household products. 13-Barcilicia L.. Sells foodstuffs and is a dressmaker. 14-Cristina BarR.. Sells shoes. 15-Alba S.. Dressmaker.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: According to their activities, the women will assign the money to the purchase of merchandise; the sellers of foodstuffs will buy meat, cheese, milk, wine, cider, etc.  The women that are dressmakers will buy cloth to offer new services.  The women that travel selling sewing products will be able to setup booths in their homes.

loans.name: Suraiya

texts.en: Suraiya Baji lives in a small town called Kot Radha Kishan near the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house, in which she has been living for the last 30 years. Suraiya Baji has three sons: the eldest one drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheel motor vehicle), while the other two work in a factory. Suraiya Baji’s husband earns income selling milk - he has been engaged in this business for the last 40 years and presently owns one buffalo. Suraiya Baji herself is a housewife, taking care of the household and the family. She is now applying for a loan to buy an additional buffalo for her husband’s milk sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for a milk sales business

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang Y. is a farmer who now lives in Trapaing Ampil village in Kampong Cham Province. She owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice to earn her living. She has very little income for her family. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start her cattle breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Neang Y. is a 48-year-old widow and the mother of five children. Two are laborers, one stays at home to do housework and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start her cattle breeding business.

loans.name: Hoa Thi's Group

texts.vi:
Hoàng Thị Hoà sinh năm 1969 ( Mã Số 010117050049 )  tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ bán hoa quả. vợ chồng chị có ba con đang độ tuổi đi học. Hàng ngày, chị đi chợ bán hoa quả đem lại thu nhập khoảng 90.000 vnđ/ ngày. Chồng chị cũng đi làm thuê nên thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ/ tháng. Với thu nhập theo ngày, vốn vay trả góp theo tuần, gia đình chị rất thích và mong muốn tham gia vay vốn lâu dài tại tổ chức tài chính vi mô Bình minh. Trong nhóm chị còn có:
 Phạm Ngọc Thuyên sinh năm 1970 ( Mã Số 010117050043 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ cá.
 Trần Thị Lan sinh năm 1948 ( Mã  số 010117050044 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
 Nguyễn Thị Ninh sinh năm 1963 ( Mã  số 010117050045 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ cá.
 Đặng Thị Trang sinh năm 1964 ( Mã  số 010117050046) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ.
 Đỗ Thị Nguyên sinh năm 1962 ( Mã  số 010117050047 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư kinh doanh v ật liệu xây dựng.
 Nguyễn Thị Hoa sinh năm 1970 ( Mã  số 010117050048 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đi chợ bán hoa.
 Trần Thị Thuỷ sinh năm 1985 ( Mã  số 010117050050 ) tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa Thi H., the SEDA fund ID 010117050049, is a 39 years old woman. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 Vietnamese Dong to sell fruit. She and her husband have three small children in school age. Every day she sells fruit in the local market; income from this selling is usually 90,000 Vietnamese Dong per day. Her husband is a worker, whose income is 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. With support from the SEDA fund, the couple now has chance to improve their live; they plan to build a long-term partnership with the fund. In the group there are following individuals: Ms. Thuyen Ngoc P., 38 years old, the SEDA fund ID 010117050043, wants to borrow 4,142,000 Vietnamese Dong to sell fish. Ms. Lan Thi T., 60 years old, the SEDA fund ID 010117050044, wants to borrow 4,142,000 Vietnamese Dong to raise pigs. Ms. Ning Thi N., 45 years old, the SEDA fund ID 010117050045, wants to borrow 4,142,000 Vietnamese Dong to sell fish. Ms. Trang Thi D., 44 years old, the SEDA fund ID 010117050046, wants to borrow 4,142,000 Vietnamese Dong to start selling small items. Ms. N. Thi D., 46 years old, the SEDA fund ID 010117050047, to borrow 4,142,000 Vietnamese Dong to sell construction material. Ms. Hoa Thi N., 38 years old, the SEDA fund ID 010117050048, wants to borrow 4,142,000 Vietnamese Dong to sell flowers. Ms. Thuy Thi T., 23 years old, the SEDA fund ID 010117050050 wants to borrow 4,142,000 Vietnamese Dong to raise chicken.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc T., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small businesses

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es:
El señor Bonifacio P. tiene ya más de diez años con su negocio de venta de comida preparada este negocio y el ingreso de su trabajo como maestro son para darle lo mejor a su familia.
Al local le está haciendo falta el techo pero por el momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir en esta mejora, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder colocar el techo de lámina a su negocio y así podrá atender mejor a sus clientes.
Don Bonifacio P. y su esposa la señora Claudia Arizpe son los que atienden el negocio, el día que realizamos la visita del negocio solo estaba su esposa quien nos atendió.
texts.en:
Mr. Bonifacio P. has had his ready-made food business for more than 10 years. This business and the income of his managerial position give a better life to his family.

His business's building needs a roof, but at this time he does not have the necessary capital to invest in this improvement. This is why he is asking for a loan, so he can install a roof on his business, and, therefore, he will be able to better serve his customers.

Mr. Bonifacio P. and his wife Mrs. Claudia Arizpe both run the business, the day that we visited the business, only his wife was present.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install laminate flooring

loans.name: Mohammad Rafiq

texts.en: M. Rafiq is the son of A. M.. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his family of six members. His younger son is engaged and is going to get married. M. Rafiq needs money for the expanses for his son’s wedding. As most people know, in Afghan people have different customs and they have to spend more money on weddings, so he requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. He would like to say that the loan process is the best because it can support those who really need money.

loans.use: Wedding expense

loans.name: Sabougnouma (La Bonne Cause) Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe Sabougnouma  sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, 6 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de kouroubadougou de la sous préfecture de Kimparana (région de Ségou, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté.
Elles exercent  presque la même activité de transformation de noix de néré en soumbala qu’elles ont apprise avec les mamans. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Sabougnouma a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier   prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de noix de néré et du bois de chauffe pour la fabrication. Le soumbala ainsi prêt est vendu à Kouroubadougou et au marché de Kimparana   en détail et au comptant. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 50 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir un prêt élevé afin d’élargir la vente de soumbala en faire une grande quantité  pour vendre à Bobo et à Bamako.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouma group are all married. On average, they are 44 years old with 6 children and live in large traditional extended families in the village of Kouroubadougou in the sub-prefecture of Kimparana (Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They know each other as neighbours and as relatives. They all engage in almost the same business, namely the conversion of néré nuts into soumbala, which they learned from their mothers. They are highly sought after for their work. In order to satisfy the needs of their clientele, which is constantly increasing, the Sabougnouma group decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are seeking their first solidarity (group) loan. They intend to use this loan to buy bags of néré nuts and firewood for the fabrication of soumbala. The soumbala thus made is sold in Kouroubadougou and at the market in Kimparana at retail and in cash. They each hope to earn an average profit of 50,000 FCFA during this loan term, which will be used to repay the loan and meet the needs of their extended families, with the remainder being invested in their businesses. Their ambition is to obtain a large loan in order to expand the sale of soumbala by making a large quantity for sale in Bobo and in Bamako.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy néré nuts and firewood

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es: La señora Gladys trabaja en una imprenta y también vende ropa y zapatos desde hace cinco años el cual inicio vendiendo cosméticos, tiene  34 años de edad, reside en el barrio la Esperanza, tiene tres hijos de 3,15. 17 años los dos mayores están estudiando, su esposo es mensajero. Con esta solicitud va a comprar ropa y productos de cosméticos para vender más a sus clientes. Sus planes a futuro es diversificar el producto, poder dar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gladys works in a print shop. For the past five years she has also sold clothing and shoes, and started off selling cosmetics. She is 34 years old and lives in the Esperanza neighborhood. She has three chidren who are 3, 15 and 17. The two oldest are students. Her husband is a messenger. With this loan, she is going to buy clothing and cosmetics to sell to her clients. Her future plans are to diversity her product offering and to provide a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of women´s and men´s clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Mrs. Lanie E. is 39 years old and married to Mr. Pedro E.. They are blessed with five children, and reside in the province of Misamis Occidental.

Mrs. Lanie E. raises pigs. As a new member of the Paglaum Coop micro finance program, she is requesting her first loan of 10,000 PHP to buy pig feed. In addition to raising pigs, she earns income from growing tangkong (a type of vegetable) at her mother's place. She dreams that her children will finish their studies, that there are more harvests to come, and that she can expand her pig pen one day.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a fifty-year-old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Sonia has owned an accessory shop since 1982. She also sells beauty products. She requested a loan of $1000 from one of Kiva's field partners, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Sonia has requested a loan. 
Sonia is exemplary in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. They are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, it was a success. Sonia decided to open her business because of her financial need. In the future, she plans to maximize her business by selling clothes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Berna Luz

texts.es: La Señora. Berna F. tiene 36 años de edad, Sus dos hijos estudian, habita en el barrio Monseñor Lezcano en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo es de gran ayuda en la ferretería. Doña Berna tiene su pequeño negocio de ferretería desde hace veinte  años iniciándolo con capital propio en sociedad con su esposo, además compraban cantidades pequeñas de productos e reinvertían las utilidades y pocas variedades Gracias a los prestamos en Afodenic a logrado crecer su negocio y mejorando su nivel vida. Con el prestado comprar productos como: clavos, alambres, hierros, palas, cobas, para obtener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Berna F. is 36 years old. Her two children are in school, and she lives in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Married, her husband is a great deal of help in the hardware store. She started 20 years ago, in partnership with her husband, using her own capital. They also bought small quantities of products which generated income that the reinvested. Thanks to the loans through Afodenic, she has managed to grow her business and improve her standard of living. With the loan, she will buy products such as: nails, wire, iron, and planks to generate better sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase nails, wire, iron, among other items.

loans.name: Melva

texts.es: LA SEÑORA VENDE PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS A CREDITO Y ATIENDE UN PUESTO DE VENTA DE DULCES Y HAMBURGUESAS EN EL COLEGIO MARIA MIKAELA DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS, VIVE EN CASA DE SU SUEGRA. ES UNA PERSONA MUY SACRIFICADA YA QUE ADEMÁS HACE LIMPIEZA EN EL COLEGIO EN EL TURNO DE LA TARDE. EN ESTE MOMENTO ES ELLA QUIEN MANTIENE AL HOGAR YA QUE EL ESPOSO ESTÁ SIN TRABAJO, ÉSTE LE ESTA AYUDANDO EN LAS TAREAS DE LIMPIEZA DEL COLEGIO HASTA QUE ENCUENTRE UN EMPLEO.
texts.en:
This lady sells food products on credit and attends a stall where sweets and hamburgers are sold in the high school Maria Mikaela. She has done this for the past 5 years. She lives in her mother-in-law’s house. She is a very sacrificing person and she also cleans the school in the afternoons. Currently, it is she who maintains the home since her husband is without work, because of this she is helping with the cleaning work at the school until her husband finds a job.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, soda pop, rice, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice K. is a friendly and hard-working 40-year-old widow with five children aged 12 to 20 years of age. The older two are currently on vacation, while the rest are in secondary school. She also cares for one nephew, one niece and her own parents. Beatrice makes a living running a canteen and a farm that she has owned for five years. She is also a seamstresss, who learned her trade at a school where she now teaches sewing other people, mostly young girls. 

In her canteen, Beatrice sells a variety of products because this attracts more customers, and uses a portion of her income to pay school fees for her children and to maintain their standard of living. She has applied for this loan to complete work on the building where she teaches sewing, and to buy more products for her canteen, particularly sugar, bread and cakes. She leads the Tulwanirewamu loan group pictured here.

loans.use: To restock her store and buy building materials .

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Kang K. A., 31, lives in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land since 1999. She grows both rice and vegetable crops. She cA. plant her crops twice a year, the dry season and the rainy season. She requests a loA. for capital to expend on growing a rice crop. She is married to Doung Toung, 39, who assists her in the farm actions. The couple is responsible for two children. Both of them are single and in school. (Kang K. A. and her husband are pictured).

loans.use: To expend on growing a rice crop

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 31-year-old father of one. He operates his boda boda (motorbike taxi) business in Massai Village in Nairobi Kenya, where he lives. Having first worked as a casual labourer, Richard hired a motorbike, which he is currently running. He is asking for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to buy his own second-hand motor bike. He hopes to own fuel pumps and vehicles one day, as well as his own home. He wishes to educate his children and raise a stable family. He describes himself as energetic, with a good personality, high self-esteem and a good character.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking microfinance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Espedita

texts.en:
Espedita is a member of the Semtema A borrower group in Kihesa Iringa,she is 41 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children,Her children are aged 18,16,14,8 and 5 years.

 Espedita started her own food business selling vegetable 9 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 48000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Espedita first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Vegetable.

With the profit she gain from the use of this Loan espedita hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable

loans.name: Rosio

texts.es: Rosio tiene 19 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres a quienes quiere ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida, es por eso que trabaja duro. Las actividades de Rosio comienzan a las 5 de la mañana, cuando saca a pastear a sus animales, pues se dedica a la crianza de ganado, a los cuales cuida con mucho cariño y dedicación, ya que sabe que de la buena crianza y alimentación depende la ganancia que obtendrá por venderlos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es caminar por lo inmensos campos por donde pastea a su ganado, el cual le fue regalado por sus padres para que empiece su propio negocio. Lleva un año en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que llevar sus reses hasta la ciudad de Puno que es donde los vende. Rosio espera poder incrementar el número de reses que tiene y así poder aumentar sus ingresos para tener en el  futuro una carnicería. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio. Rosio sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyarán y la guiarán. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (tipo de pasto) para su ganado y de esta manera tendrá animales mejor alimentados.
texts.en:
At 19 years of age, Rosio is a cheerful and industrious young woman. She lives at home with her parents and helps with the household expenses. She is eager to excel in life, which is why she works extremely hard. Since she devotes her time to raising livestock, Rosio starts her day at 5am when she takes her animals out to graze. She handles her work with much love and dedication. Rosio knows that good breeding and proper nutrition result in better profits when it comes time to sell her animals. What she likes most about her job is walking through the vast fields where her cattle graze. This property was given to her by her parents in order to start her business. She has been engaged in livestock breeding for one year and believes the hardest part is taking her cattle to the city of Puno when it is time to sell them. Rosio hopes to increase the number of cattle she has in order to generate more revenues so that she can open a butcher shop in the future.

This is Rosio’s second loan with MFP. She wants to make her payments on time so that she can qualify for more loans in the future to improve her business. Rosio knows that her Communal Bank will support and guide her. With her loan of 800 soles, she will purchase fodder in order to feed her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fodder for her animals

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary N. is the chairperson of her group in Katosi. She is a business lady with a tailoring business she transacts from her home. She makes and mends people's clothes and sells a few new clothing materials from a stall. Also in the photo is Christine B., the secretary of the group, and Madinah N., the treasurer. Each one of them needs a loan to boost their businesses.

loans.use: Buy more clothing materials for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her business

loans.name: Ahtankajaa

texts.en:
Ahtankajaa S. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He lives together with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son currently attends a local secondary school and his younger daughter is in kindergarten.

Ahtankajaa operates a vegetable trading business in his town. He grows and sells a variety of vegetables at the local market. Due to the short growing season and long winters in Mongolia, Ahtankajaa preserves most of his vegetables through the winter and sells them in the spring when demand is high. He purchases vegetables from other farmers to sell during the fall and winter months.

Ahtankajaa started his business in 2004 when he began growing vegetables on two hectares (5 acres) of land he owns. Since then, he has built a stable operation and hopes to expand in the near future by planting more vegetables. He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase two tons of beets and three tons of carrots to sell.

loans.use: To purchase two tons of beets and three tons of carrots to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ISABEL L. F., tiene  47 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE UNIDAS. Ella presenta estudios  superiores de Auxiliar en educación, pero no pudo ejercer porque se caso a los 18 años al finalizar su carrera y tuvo que dedicarse al hogar y a  la crianza de sus hijos. La socia tiene 3 hijos pero solo 1 depende económicamente de ella porque se encuentra estudiando en la universidad.
Maria s e dedica a la preparación y venta de menús (alimentos) y platos criollos como: arroz con pato, pato guisado, cabrito, cebiches, caldos, etc. en el restaurante que tiene en su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró mesas y vajilla para su restaurante y con su próximo crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles comprará arroz, menestras, aceite, fideos, papas, etc. para preparar los menús que venderá en el restaurante de su casa.
Ella sueña con remodelar y ampliar su local por lo cual esta ahorrando y así lograr mejorar su local.
texts.en:
. MARIA ISABEL L. F., 47, lives in the Las Delicias district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the SIEMPRE UNIDAS (ALWAYS UNITED) communal bank. She studied to be a Teacher's Aide but has not been able to work in this profession because when she finished her studies she got married and had to focus on her home and on raising her three children, only one of whom is still dependent on her economically since she is a university student. Maria prepares and sells meals typical of the region like: rice with duck, roasted duck, kid, cebiche (raw fish marinated in lemon juice), soups, etc. in her home-based restaurant. With her first 300 new sol loan she bought tables and crockery for her restaurant and with her next 1000 sol loan she will buy rice, vegetables, oil, pastas, potatoes, etc. to use in preparing the meals that she will prepare and sell. She dreams with remodeling and enlarging her restaurant for which she is saving money hoping thereby to improve her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables, oil, pasta, potatoes, etc. to prepare the meals she sells in her home restaurant.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha R. is 25 years old and lives in the village of Barangay Marobbob Amulung, Cagayan. She is married to Jomar, 27, who manages their farming business in the village. They are blessed with two children: Judith, 5, who attends kindergarten, and Janice, 3.

Editha operates an electronic cellphone load business in her village. In this way, she is able to help her husband earn income for the family. Editha is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP as additional working capital to maintain her business. Moreover, she wants more load to sell so that she can strengthen her business and increase her income. Editha is hoping to enjoy the lending program because it will be a great contribution towards the success of her business.

Editha‘s dreams are to have a comfortable house for her family and for her children to finish their education in order to have a better life.

loans.use: As additional capital to maintain her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 34 años de edad y está casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
La señora tiene estudios no concluidos de primaria y en su poder aun tiene a 4 hijos.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 2 años atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de ganado: oveja, toro.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una casa en Ilave.

Lo que mas le gusta de su organización son las reuniones
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the 24 de Junio Communal Bank. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 34 and married. She buys and sells livestock. She did not complete elementary school, and she is raising four children. She has worked with the Manuela R. Movement for two years. Her first loan in her communal bank was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy livestock. She is asking for a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy livestock, sheep and a bull. Her wish for the future is to have a house in Ilave. What she likes most about her organization are the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and pigs

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est spécialisée depuis 2003 dans la vente de sucre qu'elle emballe dans les sachets, elle s’approvisionne à Lomé dans la ville de tsévié, elle fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 15 sac de sucres.
étant mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle apporte sa contribution financière dans son foyer grâce à cette activité qu'elle exerce.
texts.en:
This woman has since 2003 specialised in the sale of sugar which she packs up in sachets; she stocks up at Lomé in the town of Tsévié. At the moment she has no stock left and since she wants to rebuild her stock she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy 15 bags of sugar. Married with four children, she makes a financial contribution to her household from this business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a forty-two year old married woman.  She has four children, all of whom are in school. Elizabeth lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. She is a merchant, selling cereals (maize). Elizabeth procures bags of maize from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell cereal. Elizabeth has been in business for two years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “AHORRO ES PROGRESO - SAYLLA”, Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Saylla, ubicado a 30 minutos en bus local de la ciudad del Cusco. Saylla es lugar de los restaurantes más famosos al aire libre, aquí se pude venir cualquier día de la semana a disfrutar del paisaje mientras se saborea de un deliciosos plato típico de Perú y en especial de a ciudad del Cusco, el chicharrón, (elaborado a base de carne de cerdo son trozos de 3 a 4 acompañadas con papas doradas y choclo dulce o salado con una ensalada de cebolla y hierba buena tipo menta).

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Maribel, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 10 meses de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un restaurante chicharronería en su casa, la socia vende el tradicional plato desde hace varios años y otros como son la trucha, caldos de gallina y bebidas frías y calientes, La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar vajilla para el negocio familiar y comprar uniforme para los empleados que trabajan con ella en el restaurante chicharronería.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Ahorro es Progreso - Saylla" ("Saving is Progress - Saylla"). She lives in the district of Saylla, located 30 minutes by bus from the city of Cusco. Saylla is the location of the most famous outdoor restaurants. Here you can come any day of the week to enjoy passersby while savoring a delicious Peruvian dish and specialty of the city of Cusco, chicharrón, made with three or four pieces of pork served with golden potatoes, sweet or savory corn, and a salad of onion and mint. This member is Maribel, who is 35 years old, married, and has three children, aged 14, 11 and 10 months. She alternates between her household duties and her business, which is a chicharrón restaurant located in her home. She has sold this traditional dish for several years as well as others like trout, chicken soups, and hot and cold beverages. She is seeking this loan to buy china for her family business and uniforms for the employees who work with her in the restaurant. Maribel is thankful and values the opportunity given to her by loans. She promises to complete her repayments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase china and uniforms for her employees

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is a special loan client with Esperanza, her story is representative Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. She is located in El Seibo, an agricultural area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their six children.

Ana Maria is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business as a seamstress by purchasing cloth. She will use the profits to invest in a refrigerator for her family as well as her long term goal of constructing her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Fabric for seamstress business

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn S. O. is a low-revenue citizen who has been earning a living selling fruit around the community. She established a small family home where she lives with other family members. Her husband helps to feed the family by working as a laborer at the rice milling machine. The couple was married several years ago, but they do not have a child yet. 

Recently Orn S. O. needed some capital to supplement her business which is growing well. Therefore, she requested a Kiva loan of $300 to be used to order different kinds of fruits and re-sell to gain income. (Orn S. O. was not available on that day so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To order different kinds of fruits to sell

loans.name: Wiñay Kury Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “WIÑAY KURY”, actualmente se encuentra en el I ciclo y esta conformado por 10 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la distrito de Quiquijana de la provincia de Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco. Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su centros arqueológicos, centro histórico,  sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país. La ciudad de Quiquijana se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo, venta comida, venta de panes, venta y crianza de animales menores y venta de comestibles. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

La socia Eva forma parte del banco comunal la “Wiñay Kury” y las reuniones de los socios son cada treinta días en la casa de la socia Mabel en la ciudad de Quiquijana.

Eva tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, el mayor es independiente y dos dependen de ella todavía, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con sus tres actividades comerciales que son preparar y vender pan, vender comida, crianza y venta de animales menores. Eva nos cuenta que desde muy niña aprendió el oficio de la preparación de pan y  actualmente lo vende ofreciendo de forma ambulatoria a sus vecinos, ella también nos cuenta que de lunes a sábados se levanta muy temprano para preparar la masa y hornear el pan. Ella los domingos prepara platos de comida como por ejemplo seco de cordero y pescado frito y los vende en el mercado central de la ciudad. Ella requiere el préstamo  para comprar azúcar y harina. Eva nos cuenta con mucha tristeza que las lluvias afecto a su cocina dejándola inhabitable y matando a sus cuyes. Eva es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que representa al banco comunal y su anhelo es tener una panificadora.              

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “WIÑAY KURY” communal bank is in its first loan cycle. It is made up of 10 hard-working, enterprising people who are always looking for ways to get ahead in life and, through their own efforts, to provide a better future for their children. This communal bank is in Quiquijana district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department. Cusco is a city that is known for its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery and its history. It is an enchanting city in the southern part of the country. Quiquijana is about 45 minutes from Cusco. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities; such as: food sales, bread sales, small farm animal raising, grocery sales. The communal bank has had several loan cycles and the members state that they are happy with the credit services, the savings and the training they receive. They are especially happy with the value accrued by leaving their funds in a common account over time. Eva is a member of the“Wiñay Kury” communal bank. The members meet every 30 days in Mabel’s house in Quiquijana. Eva is 49 years old, married and has three children. The oldest is independent and two still are dependent on her. She alternates her household chores with her three commercial activities: she bakes and sells bread, she sells food and she raises small farm animals for sale. Eva tells us that she learned to bake bread when she was a little girl. She sells it door-to-door to her neighbors. She also tells us that from Monday to Saturday she rises very early to prepare dough and bake bread. On Sundays, she prepares dishes like lamb and fried fish to sell in the city’s central market. She needs funds to buy sugar and flour. Eva tells us sadly that the recent rains adversely affected her kitchen leaving it uninhabitable and killing all her guinea pigs. Eva is a hard-working, enterprising woman who represents the communal bank; her dream is to have a bakery. The members as a group are grateful for the help given and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and flour.

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es: Rossi tiene 36 años, es feliz viviendo con su pareja y su único hijo, en su casa que es propia y hecho de madera, ubicado en un cerro empinado al sur de Lima. Desde hace cuatro años trabaja, como niñera, de una joven pareja profesional, que queda a media hora de su casa, empezando desde las 8.00am de la mañana hasta las 5.00pm de la tarde. Pero antes de ir a trabajar, se levanta muy temprano para dejar listo el almuerzo de su esposo, que trabaja como chofer y a su hijo, que aún esta en etapa escolar. La actividad que realiza, no le es muy pesado, sin embargo anhela tener su propio negocio, es por eso que ella y su esposo se han propuesto comprar un carro, en el cual su pareja lo conduce, es así que continúan hasta la fecha pagando la letra de su vehiculo. Rossi sólo espera que llegue la electrificación a su casa, para dedicarse a vender helados de fruta y gaseosas, y de las ganancias pueda ahorrar para construir su casa y mejorar su condición de vida. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que una vez más, promete ser bien cumplida con el pago de sus cuotas. Además manifiesta que se lleva bien con sus compañeras de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, lo derivará para terminar de pagar la letra de su carro, además de dejar en regla todos los documentos, para que pueda trabajar tranquilamente sin tener problemas con el ministerio de transporte.
texts.en:
Rossi is 36 years old and is happily married with one child. She lives in a wooden house that her family owns. It is located on a steep hill to the south of Lima. For about four years she has worked as a nanny for a young professional couple that live a half hour from her house. She works from eight in the morning until five in the evening. She gets up early before she goes to work in order to prepare lunch for her husband who is a driver and her son who is in school. Her work is not very hard but she still would like to have her own business. It is with this goal in mind that they bought a car, which the husband hopes to drive for work. To this date they have paid the loan on this vehicle. Rossi hopes that her house will get electrical service. She would like to sell ice cream, fruit and sodas from her house. She would be able to save her earnings to use to build improvements to her house and in this way improve their lives. This is her sixth loan from MFP. One more time she promises to pay her loan payments. Also she would like to say that she gets along well with the members of the community group. With the loan that she is asking for, she will finish paying the payments on their car. If they finish paying off their loan they will receive documents which will allow them to work without problems from the ministry of transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off the loan for their car and thus obtain the documents necessary to use the car for work

loans.name: Saranhuu

texts.en: Saranhuu is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband Baynnamsrai operates a taxi service in their town. Saranhuu operates a clothing trading business at a local market. She sells a variety of clothes out of a rented shipping container. Furthermore, Saranhuu purchases her products in cooperation with other local clothing traders in order to share high transportation costs and reduce expenses. She started her business in 2001, and has gained much experience over the years. She has a loyal customer base because of her great communication skills and her good selection of products. Saranhuu is a great businesswoman who has been trying to build a bright future for her family.  She says the most important thing now is to be able to purchase her own shipping container for her business.  She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase summer clothing for the upcoming warm season.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothing for resale.

loans.name: Betzabe Zulma

texts.es: LA SRA. BETZABE ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA (QUINTA SECUENCIA), ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 2 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS, HA MOSTRANDO RESPONSABILIDAD   EN LOS PAGOS DE SUS CREDITOS, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA A CREDITO DE SUS PRODUCTOS A ESTA ACTIVIDAD SE LLAMA ( EL JUEGO DE PASANAKU) ENTREGA EL PRODUCTO Y COBRA SEMANALMENTE O QUINCENALMENTE, TODA ESTA ACTIVIDADA LAS REALIZA   EN LA ZONA DE PACAJES (SE ENCUENTRA EN LA PARTE SUR DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO), EN LAS DIFERENTES FERIAS QUE SE REALIZAN EN LA SEMANA, LA SEÑORA SE ESFUREZA POR SUPERARSE YA QUE TRABAJA DESDE LA MADRUGADA HASTA QUE SE PONE EL SOL EN LA VENTA Y COBRO DE LOS PRODUCTOS, EL ESPOSO DE DOÑA BETZABE TRABAJA EN LA CERVECERIA BOLIVIANA, EL MAYOR SUEÑO DE LA CLIENTA ES LLEGAR A COMPRARSE SU CASITA COMO DICE ELLA Y DAR UNA VIDA MEJOR A SU FAMILIA. ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Betzabe is a long time client (fifth cycle). She is married and has two small children. She has shown responsibility paying her loans. She sells her products on credit. Her activity is called The Pasanaku Game. She delivers the product, and she charges weekly or biweekly. She works in the Pacajes region, which can be found in the southern part of the city of El Alto, at the different fairs held during the week. She puts forth great effort to do well. She works selling and collecting for her products from the dawn until sunset. Betzabe’s husband works in a Bolivian brewery. Her biggest dream is to buy a house and to give her family a better life. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Las Hadas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es el de Las Hadas, por que consideran que pueden lograr  grandes cosas, hacer realidad lo que sueñan para  emprender en la vida. las cuales viven en la comunidad Las Vigas en el municipio de San Marcos las integrantes son Elsa ( venta de ropa), Emma (abarrotes), Norma (venta de frutas y verduras)Guillermina (compra y venta de calzado), Santa C. (elaboración de queso) Ifigenia (compra y venta de pescado), Josefina (compra y venta de pescado), Dora ( comprar y venta de frutas y verduras), Teresa  (compra y venta de pollos), Maria Elia (se dedica  a la  venta de comida).


Emma J.  Ramírez, es la representante del grupo las hadas. ella esta casada , su esposo es Maestro y tiene tres hijos. Ellos  se llaman  Carina  que tiene 18 años de edad y estudia en la Preparatoria, Francisco  tiene 15 años cursando la Preparatoria, Manuel  tiene 6 años va en el Jardín de niños. 

Emma se dedica  a la venta de  Abarrotes, con el fin de poder sacar a su familia adelante, para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Otras de sus actividades es que también se dedica a vender tamales, atole y empanadas  en  los fines de semana.

Nos comenta que se sintió a gusto al obtener su préstamo, por que es de gran satisfacción para ella poder surtir su tienda. Ella  comprara arroz, fríjol, azúcar, y refrescos para almacenarlo, pues se acerca  la temporada de julio y es cuando los precios de estos productos suben, para esto ella surtirá con antes para poder vender mejor.

Todas las integrantes están muy agradecidas por el apoyo que le ha brindado Fundación Realidad, por la confianza que le  tienen y esperan seguir trabajando con los préstamos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Hadas” (The Fairies) because they think they can achieve great things, making a reality of the dreams they wish to undertake in life. They live in the community of Las Vigas (The Beams) in the municipality of San Marcos. The members are Elsa (who sells clothes), Emma (who sells groceries), Norma and Dora (buying and selling fruits and vegetables), Guillermina (purchase and sale of shoes), Santa C. (cheese making), Ifigenia and Josefina (buying and selling fish), Teresa (buying and selling chickens), and María Elia (selling meals). Emma is the representative of the Las Hadas Group. She is married, her husband is a teacher, and they have 3 children; Carina, who is 18 and studies at a preparatory school, Francisco who is 15 and attends preparatory, and Manuel, who is 6 and attends kindergarten. Emma sells groceries and hopes to advance her family, so that her children will have a better quality of life. Her other activities include selling tamales, atole and empanadas on weekends. She tells us that she is delighted to receive this loan because it gives her great satisfaction to restock her store. Emma will buy rice, beans, sugar, and soft drinks to restock, since July is approaching and that is when prices for these products rise. She wants to restock earlier, so that she can sell more. All the group members are very grateful for the help offered by the Reality Foundation, and for the confidence it has in them. And they hope to continue working with the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING COOKING OIL, RICE, SUGAR, BEANS, AND SOFT DRINKS TO SELL

location.town: Localidad de las VIgas, Mpio. de San Marcos.

loans.name: Peti

texts.en:
Peti V. is 42 and married with 7 children.  She plants and harvests taro for sale.  Peti has 2 years of experience in this business.  Peti needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or about US$208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Peti is a hard-working client and wishes to improve the business and assist her family financially.

In 2009, Peti joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Peti's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is married with 3 children. He owns a retail business selling toilet paper, napkins, matches, etc. Ruslan started this business 10 years ago. During this time he was able to develop it well. Ruslan offers good quality products for reasonable prices. Many customers come back. This business is the only source of income for his big family.

Ruslan is requesting a loan of 12,000 UAH to purchase inventory. Buying items in bulk, he is able to make more profit and spend it on his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng L., 40 years old, lives in Toal village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Seng Eng, are farmers who own a plot a land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Leng L. decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow her farm field to support her crop. Besides farming, Mr. Seng Eng is a construction worker, receiving a small income to support his family. This couple has three children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a student and the youngest is 4 years old. Mrs. Leng L.'s husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to plow her farm field

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma R. is from the village of Madalag, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old, married and has 3 children. Thelma owns and operates a fish selling business. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Thelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

location.town: Liloy-Madalag, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Lamp Fall Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité LAMP F. est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il a été mis en place le jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de PAL KHELY qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont toutes issues de la même concession, ce qui explique qu'elles ont pratiquement le même nom de famille "K.". Le groupe a été formé alors par voisinage et par lien de parenté. 

KHADY K., debout tout à fait derrière à droite au second rang sur la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle mariée et mère de 05 enfants et a aussi en charge un petit fils. 

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois, en 2007.

Avec son prêt elle va acheter trois moutons quelle va engraisser pendant 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Elle prend en charge ses besoins personnels tout renforçant son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
The LAMP F. solidarity group has been created on December 4, 2007. It was founded the day of the inauguration of the Banc Villageois of Pal Khely to which it belongs. The group is composed of 13 women of the same lineage, which explains why almost all of them share the same last name, K.. Thus, they are neighbors and relatives who decided to form a group. Khady K., standing on the far right in the second row in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of five children and has a grandchild in her care. She raises sheep. She has been in this line of business since joining Banc Villageois in 2007. With her loan she would like to purchase three sheep for fattening and reselling five month later at the local markets in her area. Her goal is to help her husband support the family. She takes care of her personal expenses while boosting her level of savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing three sheep for later resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth K., age 29 and unmarried, sells school supplies such as exercise books, pens, pencils, and sharpeners at her shop. She is requesting a loan so that she can expand her offerings to include textbooks, boxes of chalk, markers, and similar items.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her shop by stocking more scholastic materials like mathematical instruments.

loans.use: To stock textbooks, boxes of chalk, markers, and other such supplies in her store

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El  Sr. Juan Carlos G. G.   él  se dedica a brindar el servicio de Taxi el tiene cinco años de brindar este servicio, pero se lo administra un sobrino por que el trabaja de conductor de cabezal, es casado actualmente tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para darle mantenimiento y mejorar su taxi, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera en su vida familiar este crédito lo solicita   para hacer un aumento en su casa compra de materiales de construcción, pago de mano de obra y compra de dos llantas  para el taxi.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos G. G. has provided taxi services for five years but his nephew is the actual driver because he works as a semi truck driver. He’s married and has two school age children. He has had four CEPRODEL loans that he’s used for taxi maintenance. Ceprodel loans have been of great benefit for his family life. This loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies to enlarge his house, to pay labor costs and to buy two tires for the taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For sand, concrete blocks, cement, iron rods.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay N., 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. N. is a farmer and she also grows vegetables for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is an electrician, earning an income of USD 5 per day. 

 N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a water pump to water her vegetables. In the future, she would like to use aN. additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: a water pump to water the vegetables

loans.name: Arneledie

texts.en:
Arneledie H. is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating five business ventures: food vending, ready-to-wear clothes, hog raising, a sari-sari (general) store, and a small eatery. She lives in Upper Cambanay, Brgy. Cambanay, Danao City, Cebu City. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable and now earns an average monthly income of PHP4,000. Arneledie is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she  can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 8th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Arneledie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
