Se acerca el 11 de Noviembre, día de la Independencia de Cartagena de Indias y se conmemora con  diversos eventos historicos; en estos días tambien ocurre el reinado nacional de la Belleza Colombiana y los Cartageneros y colombianos en general, viven esta celebración con festines en todas las calles de la ciudad heroica y derroche de gran alegría carnavalera, porque alli se esta escogiendo a la mujer mas bella de Colombia. Es aqui donde suscita el espiritu emprendedor de Armando, pues el, siempre conciente de las oportunidades,  aprovecha para vender productos de gran rotación por la ocurrencia de estos eventos; así que está solicitando su credikiva para comprar espumas para el carnaval, camisas adornadas de múltiples colores gorras disfraces y atuendos de acuerdo con la época. 
Armando Cárdenas vive en el barrio Zaragocilla de la ciudad de Cartagena, él es un cliente leal de la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización donde ha recibido 11 créditos para fortalecer su negocio llamado “Comercio el Baratero” que inició en el año 1982 y se ha destacado por hacer crecer su microempresa a punta de interpretar lo que cada temporada requiere, así ha logrado dar educación a sus tres hijos que hoy están en las edades de 30 a 40 años y son profesionales y técnicos destacados. Con su vinculación a los programas de la Fundación ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo lo que le ha servido para mejorar su vivienda y generar mayores opciones de venta oportuna. Su sueño es construir su casa de dos pisos dejando un local para sus variedades de mercancías dando curso a su sueño:  " Tener un gran almacen".
texts.en:
November 11th is fast approaching; it is Independence Day for Cartagena de Indias where the people commemorate a number of historic events.  Also, this is the time of the Colombian National Beauty pageant and the people of Cartagena and Colombians in general celebrate this time with huge parties in all the city streets.  They are very excited to see who will be chosen as the most beautiful woman in Colombia.  This is what gives rise to the enterprising spirit of Armando.  He is always aware of his opportunities and takes advantage to sell products that are important during these events.  He is seeking a loan through Kiva to buy foams for Carnaval, multi-colored shirts, hats, costumes and other outfits for the occasion.

Armando C. lives in the Zaragocilla neighborhood of Cartagena; he is a faithful customer of the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo through which he has received 11 loans to build his business called Comercio el Baratero which he started in 1982.  He stands out for building his business by understanding what the people want in each season.  He has used his business to provide education for his 3 children who are now in their 30s and 40s and are successful professionals.  With his ties to the Foundation's programs, he has been able to increase his working capital which has helped him to improve his home and generate more sales leads.  His dream is to build a 2 story home with a storefront where he can sell his goods and let him leave out his dream of "having a large warehouse."

loans.use: Buy shaving cream and foams for Carnaval, multi-colored shirts, hats, costumes, and other seasonal outfits

loans.name: Carlos Ivan

texts.es:
CARLOS IVAN A. L., Trabaja como Higienista en Commema Mercado Oriental
EL PRESTAMO LO VA A INVERTIR EN COMPRA DE MEATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO :ARENA, CEMENTO Y MANO DE OBRA PARA CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
texts.en:
Carlos Ivan A. L. works as a janitor at the Commema Eastern Market.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as sand and cement. It will also be used to pay for labor in order to build a room in his house.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor

loans.name: Vilma Estela

texts.es: Vilma Estela H. A. de 39 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Santa Ana en donde vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. En dicho negocia ella comercializa leche, pan, golosinas y otros productos más. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, sobre todo con productos los cuales son muy básicos en el hogar. Vilma desea mucho poder mejorar las ventas, ya que es ella quien le brinda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar, esto debido a que el sueldo de su compañero de vida no da a bastos para todas las necesidad existentes, sobre todo porque como buenos padres, ambos anhelas poder brindarles los estudios universitarios a sus hijos, ya que el mayor de ellos esta por ingresar a la universidad y Vilma y su esposo desean poder a través de los estudios brindarle un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Vilma Estela H. A. is 39 years old.  She lives in Santa Ana department with her husband and two dependent children.  She owns a grocery store which is located in her own home.  In her business she sells milk, bread, candies and other products.  She is requesting a loan with which she can stock her business, particularly with basic household products.  Vilma would like very much to be able to improve her sales since she provides her husband with the necessary help to cover all their household expenses because his wage does not cover all their current needs.  Above all this is the case because, as good parents, they both wish to be able to put their children through university since their eldest is about to enter university and Vilma and her husband would like to be able to provide him with an education which will, in turn, give him a better future.

loans.use: To buy food products and basic household products

loans.name: Mitala Maria Tusitukirewanu-Mpigi Group

texts.en:
A boutique business is what 28-year-old Grace N. has been operating for the last six years in Bumama-Mpigi. She says it was her own enterprise and initiative that got her started. Most of the financial backing to begin this business came from her savings from her farming business. She still does farming but more priority is now given to her boutique business. 

At her boutique, she sells a variety of different clothing for kids, ladies and men. Monthly, her profits total up to 200,000 shillings and this happily married mother of two says with this loan, she is going to purchase more clothes for reselling.

loans.use: The purchase of more clothes for resale

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa A. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Alfonsa is single. To make a living, Alfonsa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling clothing & shoe products from Natasha, Avon & Boardwalk in the local community. Alfonsa has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alfonsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfonsa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alfonsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norca

texts.es: Sonia, de 48 años, convive con Jaime, de 51 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Karina, de 15 y Juan, de 10 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Desde muy niña, Sonia, incursionó en la agricultura, ahí, gracias a sus padres pudo aprender las técnicas de cultivo, como también a tener buen tacto en la manera de comercializar sus cultivos. Ahora ella tiene más de 20 años sembrando sus propios frutos, que constan de plátanos, palta y café, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues no quiere defraudar las enseñanzas de sus padres; su esfuerzo y constancia, hacen que Sonia, venda sus cosechas a buen precio; tanto así que en temporadas agrícolas, los comerciantes que visitan la zona, ofrecen por sus cultivos mayor precio de venta, por ello está planeando mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos, para comenzar a vender su grano a los exportadores de café. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y como socia de su banco comunal, augura muchos éxitos en la iniciación de este nuevo proyecto. Con el crédito que recibirá, planea comprar 8 sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en: Sonia, 48, lives with Jaime, 51 and both have 6 children but only 2 live with them, Karina, 15 and Juan, 10.  They are in a common-law marriage and live in their own house, located in Unión Palomar (the central Peruvian jungle).  Since she was a small child, Sonia worked in farming there, and thanks to her parents she learned cultivation techniques.  She tends to them with a lot of care because she doesn’t want to go against what her parents taught her.  Her efforts and perseverance  let her sell her crops for a good price.  During the growing season the buyers who come to this area offer her better prices for her produce and that is why she wants to improve the quality of her crops.  She would like to sell her coffee beans to exporters.  This is the first time that she has a loan with MFP, and as a member of her communal bank, she hopes for success with the start of the new project.  She will use the loan to buy 8 sacks of organic fertilizer that she will spread on her coffee plants.

loans.use: To buy 8 sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn F. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, snack foods, canned goods and toothpaste in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and biscuits. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and biscuits

loans.name: Jose Filonilo

texts.es:
Don José Filonilo, reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, donde vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 13 y 12 años, él se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto, don Filonilo cuenta con 48 años de edad, su negocio consiste en la crianza de ganado de leche y de repasto, en pequeñas proporciones, lo aprendió de su padre y los atiende a tiempo completo, pero además se dedica a crianza de cerdos, gallinas ponedoras, siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado de repasto, esto contribuirá a aumentar el número de reces en su granja, también en un futuro tendrá la oportunidad  de obtener un mayor ingreso por comercializarla en el momento adecuado.
Su propósito es trabajar con mucha motivación para alcanzar estabilidad económica y dar a su familia lo más necesario, también que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.
texts.en:
José Filonilo lives in Osicala, in Morazán department, with his wife and two children aged 13 and 12.  He is 48 years old and his business is raising both dairy and non-dairy cattle on a small scale.  He learned the business from his father and he works in this business full time.  However, he also raises pigs and laying hens, and sows corn, beans and sorghum.

José Filonio is requesting this loan to buy non-dairy cattle.  This will help increase the number of cattle on his farm and, in the future, he will have the opportunity to make more money by selling them at the right time.  His goal is to work with a lot of motivation in order to reach a certain level of financial stability, so that he can cover his family's basic needs.  He also wants his children to be able to study and become professionals.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg, 43, is widowed and lives with her two children in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia. They live in a two-room apartment that they own. Her older child, a daughter, attends college while her son goes to a local secondary school. Erdentsetseg currently works as a gas station attendant three days a week. When she is off work she makes traditional and modern clothing.

 She started to sell her handmade clothing in 1995. She used to operate her business out of a rented workshop but now she makes clothing at home when she gets custom orders. She is a modest and quiet person who says,  I save some more money to help my son since he has gotten married and started his own life. Therefore, I want to help him to build everything from the beginning." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase materials for her clothing business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Marianita is a 60-year-old married woman who supports her family by buying and selling spices and vegetables. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her spices and vegetable vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000.  Marianita is borrowing PHP 29,000 so that she can purchase more spices and vegetables to sell. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marianita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To purchase more spices and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Marta Rubidia

texts.es:
Doña Marta, de 54 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, donde vive con su esposo y un hijo, el negocio que administra es la venta de ropa nueva y artículos escolares, aprendió por sus familiares y luego se independizo, teniendo en la actualidad 16 años de ser comerciante en ropa y artículos escolares.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería tanto ropa como material escolar, con la intención de mantener el inventario surtido para los clientes,.
Su aspiración es ir en aumento con los negocios, mejorar la atención a los clientes así mismo las ventas, que su familia tenga estabilidad económica y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marta is 54 years old and she resides in Puerto el Triunfo with her husband and their son. The business that she has is one selling new clothing and school supplies. He learned it from family members and later she opened an independent business of her own. She now has 16 years in the business selling clothing and school supplies.

She requests a loan to purchase clothing as well as school supplies with the goal of maintaining variety in the inventory for her clients.

Her goal is to increase her business, to improve her service to clients, and to improve her sales so that her family will have financial stability and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and school supplies

loans.name: Noé Elias

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Circunvalación de la ciudad de  Manta  cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevo Proyecto. Esta ciudad es conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas Océano  Pacifico.

En este lugar encontramos a don Noé, tiene 62 años de edad, en la actualidad está divorciado pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene dos hijos ya todos son mayores de edad e independientes. Para él este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque los créditos permiten a los socios sacar adelante sus negocios.

Es contador titulado y trabaja de profesor en la universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta, pero tiene un negocio en sociedad con una de sus hijas, ellos tienen un centro de cómputo, que también es librería y papelería, en este negocio realizan trabajos contables, asesorías y proyectos, además del servicio de internet. Trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, su hija está todo el día y él cuando no está dando clases en la Universidad.

Este crédito es para invertir en útiles escolares ya que pronto empieza la época de clases y se vende mucho de estos productos en esta temporada.

Su meta es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Proyecto” (New Project) communal bank meets every two weeks in Manta’s Circunvalación neighborhood.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists alike.  It is one of the country’s and America’s most important ports situated on the shore of the Pacific Ocean.

This is where we found Noé, 62.  He is currently divorced but from the relationship he was in several years ago he has two children, all independent adults now.  This is his second cycle in the communal bank and he likes it because the loans make it possible for members to succeed in business.

He has a professional degree as an Accountant and works as a Professor at Manta’s Eloy Alfaro Laic University but also has a business in partnership with one of his daughters: a computer center which is also a bookstore and stationery shop.  They do accounting jobs, assessments and projects here as well as provide Internet access services.  They work daily from 8am until 8pm.  His daughter is there all day and he’s there when he’s not teaching classes at the university.

This loan is to invest in school supplies because the new school term is about to start and these kinds of products sell very well during this season.

His goal is to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is currently in a business of selling greens. She is 28 years old, married, with 4 children and all of them go to school. Flora borrowed a loan to stock more greens to sell. She hopes to pay her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Mary Wanjiku

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 28 years.  She is 56 years old, and a single mother of three children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers, and this will be her third loan.  She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre soltero de 40 años, vive en casa de sus padres que cuenta con servicio de agua y luz solamente y está ubicado  en la zona urbana de la provincia de Chiclayo. Lugar que se caracteriza por su gran actividad comercial, agricultura y turismo.

Carlos desde hace 5 año se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan en forma ambulatoria , ésta actividad lo realiza en las afueras de un hospital de esta ciudad, tiene buena demanda de clientela desde muy temprano,ya quemucha gente asiste a sus citas médicas.  A pesar que se tienque movilizar desde muy temprano trata de que su negocio cresca cada vez más para poder ayudar con los gastos en su casa.

El préstamo solicitado por Carlos a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1700 nuevos soles para mejorar los servicios higiénicos de su casa para brindarle mejor seguridad y limpieza a su familia, evitando cualquier tipo de enfermedad por no tener un baño apto para el uso de su familia .  Además Carlos con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo trata de darle algunas comodidades a su familia y seguir tratando de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carlos is 40 years old and single.  He lives in his parents' home which has piped water and electricity.  It is located in the urban area of Chiclayo province.  This area is noted for its commerce, agriculture and tourism.

For five years, Carlos has been making and selling bread as an itinerant street vendor.  He carries out his work outside a hospital in the city.  He has good customer demand from very early in the morning since a lot of people are attending their medical appointments.  In spite of the fact that he has to start working very early in the morning, Carlos is trying to continually grow his business so that he can help with his household expenses.

Carlos has requested a loan for 1,700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use this money to improve the bathroom facilities in his home so that he can provide better safety and cleanliness for his family.  With a lot of effort and hard work, Carlos tries to provide his family with some comforts and continues trying to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to improve his home's bathroom facilities

loans.name: Botsoé

texts.fr: Menuisier de profession  depuis 1996, et père de deux enfants il vit en couple avec sa femme qui est coiffeuse.il est âgé de 39 ans et aime son métier. Il est à son troisième cycle de prêt et il est d’une bonne moralité.son atelier est à Lomé et il s’approvisionne sur place. C’est un père de famille qui se soucie du bien être de sa maisonnée.
texts.en: A cabinet maker by trade since 1996 and the father of two, he lives with his wife, a hairdresser. He is 39 years old and fond of his trade. He is on his third loan cycle and is of good moral character. His workshop is in Lomé, and he stocks up locally. He is a family man dedicated to the well-being of his household.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI I  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de DANGASSO  de la commune de DAH, préfecture de SAN région de SÉGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 42 ans et au moins  6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide et du fonio comme cultures principales. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième  prêt de campagne.
ALIMATA, deuxième debout en boubou rougeâtre, compte utiliser son prêt actuel pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, de fonio, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au grand marché de SAN. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SAN, KOUTIALA et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes (les gens communément appelées les acheteurs).
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 30 000 à 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi I is a grouping of married women from the village of Dangasso in the commune of Dah, which lies in the San prefecture in the Segou region (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They live in traditional families, average 42 years of age with at least six children each. They mainly grow groundnut and fonio. With a view to making their farming activities profitable, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program three years ago. Having repaid their previous loans in full, they are now on their third farming loan.

Alimata, standing second from the left in a reddish boubou (flowing West African dress) is planning to use her current loan to buy a sufficient amount of groundnut and fonio seeds, small materials and agricultural inputs at the large market in San. After the rainy season the crops are stocked for a certain amount of time in order to gain value before they are sold at the large markets in San, Koutiala and in surrounding markets, on a retail basis (but often wholesale) for cash to a customer base which generally comes from large towns (people commonly called buyers).

The members of the Benkadi I group are each expecting to make, once their crops are sold, a profit of between 30,000 and 40,000FCFA, which will be used to repay the interest on their loans and to cover household running costs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small materials

loans.name: Pelagra  Juana

texts.es:
Pelagra es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, está  casada y  tiene 6 hijos (2 independientes).  Estudió hasta 4to de primaria.
Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en  la compra de 2 ovejitas para engordarlas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará una vaca para su respectivo engorde por dos meses y luego la venderá en la localidad de Ilave.  También cuenta que vende alpacas.  Ella trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos.
Su sueño es tener más ganados  y mejorados así podrá tener mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Pelagra is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Concepción", located in the Ayrumas Carumas village of the district of Acora in the province and department of Puno.  She is 48, married and has six children (two are independent).  She has a 4th grade elementary school eduation.

For a year she has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement and her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN was used to buy two sheep.

She plans to the use the new loan of 1,500 PEN to buy a cow which she will feed for two months then sell in the town of Llave.  She also sells alpacas.  She works with her husband and children and her dream is to have more well-bred livestock to increase her earnings.  What she likes best about the communal bank are the meetings, punctuality and savings.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and single. She is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 6,000 per month. 

Grace is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise and feed for them. She has been in the hog raising business  for almost 3 years.

In the future, Grace hopes to improve and strengthen this business in order to have stable source of income to satisfy her daily needs and save for their future.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise and feed for them

loans.name: Jesus De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Jesús de los Milagros tiene 21 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y sus 02 hijos. Ella cuenta con casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Ayar Ucho ubicado en un sector llamado el Valle de los Incas en el distrito de Tambogrande, la cual es una zona rural  de este distrito pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

Jesús de los Milagros cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual ella atiende permanentemente. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida. Complementariamente cría ganado ovino y porcino, los cuales al alcanzar su tamaño y peso ideal los vende en el mercado local   Con estas actividades ella  solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda  de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Jesús de los Milagros ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Jesús de los Milagros es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Jesús de los Milagros, 21, lives with her husband and their 2 children in a house they own in Peru's Tambogrande district.  The area is remote, but there is electricity.

Jesús de los Milagros owns a small general store.  She operates the store in her house so she is always available to help her customers.  She sells everyday products--groceries and other basic supplies--to local people.  She has a lot of customers.  She earns extra money raising and selling sheep and pigs.  She sells the animals locally when they're ready for market.  The businesses allow her to pay for basic expenses and help her family.

The success of the store has led Jesus de los Milagros to consider adding more products so that she can expand the business.  She is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new soles loan for that purpose.  

Jesus de los Milagros is a good, hard-working woman.  The people who know her best esteem and love her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Patrick Ngotho

texts.en: Patrick is 47 years old and married with three children between eight years old and three months old. He hopes to give the children a quality education to the university level. He runs a butcher shop in Gatundu and is served by the Thika Branch. He has been running this business for the last 15 years. He says the business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 80,000 to buy three bulls for meat to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to open other butcher shops in the future. He describes himself as very patient.

loans.use: to purchase theee bulls for beef

loans.name: Joferson

texts.en:
Joferson is 35 years of age.  He is married and is  blessed with two children. He has been managing his rice field for almost ten years and usually earns about P35,000 per harvest during the seasons of April and October.  He sets aside some of his income for their daily use and for the education of his two children. He has been working hard to earn a higher income for the next crop. 

Joferson is asking a loan amount P25,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his farm. He  needs to improve his rice field by providing all the inputs needed to be able to make it productive and profitable. He hopes that he can sustain the financial needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his farm

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is married with 14 children. Antonia is 62 years old and lives in Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Antonia sells canned goods and other items such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, etc., to earn a living and has had this business for 18 years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase goods and other products for sale.

Antonia has been a member of PMPC for 8 months. In the future, Antonia hopes to make her Sari-sari store bigger and to have a better living condition.

loans.use: To purchase food and products for her store such as shampoo,soap,oil,soy sauce,noodles, etc.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en: Encarnacion earns a living by going house-to-house selling beauty products. She has done this for the past five years, and earns most of her money by selling shampoo, toothpaste and perfumes from a catalog to customers in her village. She usually earns PHP 1,000 a week, while her husband works as a technician and also raises hogs on the side for additional income. She is 53 years old and has five children. By working hard, she and her husband have been able to support the education of all of their children. Encarnacion is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell to people in her village.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, drinks, instant products, and bread.

loans.name: Estefani Yareth

texts.es:
Estefani cuenta con 21 años de edad es soltera y aun no tiene hijos, ahorita está viviendo con sus padres, a quienes se dedica a cuidar, ya que es la más chica de 6 hermanos, tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hacen 2 años.
Dice que inicio con este pequeño negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a sus padres económicamente, para mejorar un poco sus gastos y tener una muy buena calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de mas mercancía como son: leche, refrescos, aceite, frijol, arroz, azúcar, galletas, papel higiénico, jabón, etc. para así tener mejor surtida su tienda.
Ella está convencida que uno de sus más grandes sueños se podrá cumplir, ya que es el de hacer crecer mucho mas su tienda, puesto que quiere ampliar un poco mas su local, para así tenerlo más surtido con una amplia variedad de productos, y así incrementar y mejorar sus ingresos, tanto como para continuar apoyando a sus padres.
Estefani dice que está muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que le están brindando, pero sobre todo por la confianza, ya que con esta ayuda ha logrado mejorar el negocio y la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Estefani is 21, single, and has no children.  She lives with and cares for her parents since she is the youngest of six siblings.  She has been running a grocery store for two years.

She says she began this small business because she wanted to have a way to support her parents, cover expenses and have a better lifestyle.  She plans to use the loan to buy more merchandise such as milk, softdrinks, oil, beans, rice, sugar, cookies, toilet tissue, soap, etc., so her store is well-stocked.

She is convinced that one of her greatest dreams can become reality, and that is for her store to grow.  She wants to expand the current location so she can add more product variety.  This will increase and improve her income so she can continue to support her parents.

Estefani is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for this great support, especially for the confidence shown in her, because this help has improved the business and the family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy milk, softdrinks, oil, beans, rice, sugar, cookies, toilet tissue, soap, etc.

loans.name: Hesborn

texts.en:
Hesborn is 40 years old, married, and a father of 5 children, aged 23, 21, 18, 15 and 12 years old. His spouse is Beatrice, who is a small scale farmer but contributes to the family’s total income.  Hesborn owns a timber yard where he sells timber to other traders. This business has been in operation for a period of 2 years, earning a monthly income of about Kshs 28,000.

Hesborn has just joined KADET LTD and borrowed a loan of Kshs 20,000. He wishes to use this amount to purchase trees for felling into timber.  The profits will be used to pay school fees for his school-going children as well as repaying his borrowed amount.

He hopes to expand his business and own a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase trees for timber.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
This is Carolina, 46, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is a mother of 1 and married to Ernie, who is also her business partner. She, together with her husband and child, manage the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Carolina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a common family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her stall's regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as a result.  

Carolina hopes to open another store in their area and dreams of being able to give her child a high quality education through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and other products for her food stall

loans.name: Blanca Egdomilia

texts.es:
Blanca, se dedica a la venta D. artículos D. primera necesidad, vive con sus hijas D. 21, 19 y 16 años D. edad, ella aprendió el negocio por cuenta propia, desD. hace cuatro años atienD. el negocio.
Ella está solicitando préstamo para la compra mercadería como: arroz, papel y  carteras, esta inversión le ayudará para mejorar el negocio y poder atender a la clientela.
La aspiración D. blanca está en darle el estudio y a sus hijas para que puedan superarse, teniendo mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Blanca sells basic necessities. She lives with her daughters (ages 21, 19, and 16). Blanca learned this traD. on her own and has been in business for four years.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, paper, and wallets. This investment will help to improve her business so that she can serve her customers. Her aspiration is to proviD. her daughters with an education so that they can be successful and have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy rice, paper, and wallets.

loans.name: Jackelinne Benita

texts.es: La señora Jackelinne vive junto a su esposo Rubén en la zona de Pampahasi alto, tienen dos hijos en edad escolar. Jackelinne se dedica a atender un pequeño negocio de licorería que esta instalado en el mismo domicilio donde viven. El esposo de ella trabaja como diseñador grafico en una empresa de diseño que queda en la zona de Villa Copacabana, Jackelinne trabaja con la institución desde hace varios años y siempre ha demostrado ser muy puntual y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Ahora que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año, Jackelinne solicita el préstamo para la compra de otras bebidas como refrescos por mayor para incrementar su capital antes que se eleven los precios por estas fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Sra. Jackelinne lives with her husband Rubén in the District of Pampahasi Alto. They have two children in school. Jackelinne manages a small liquor store located in her home. Her husband works as a graphic designer for a printing company in the District of Villa Copacabana.

Jackelinne has worked with Emprender for several years and has always demonstrated her promptness and responsibility when making her payments. Now that the year-end festivities are approaching, Jackelinne is requesting a loan to buy other beverages, such as soft drinks in bulk, so that she can acquire more inventory before prices increase as a result of the holiday parties.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells cosmetics at Besease near Elmina. She has been in this business for the past twelve years. Ama is married to a farmer and has six dependents. She supports her husband to provide for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more cosmetics for sale. Ama will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto, de 49 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y dedicado, además de muy amable, está casado con Jacqueline quien es ama de casa, y con quien vive a lado de sus 5 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 12 y 4 años de edad, instalados en su propia casa. La actividad a la que se dedica Sixto es la preparación y comercialización de medicinas a base de plantas medicinales, provenientes de la amazonía peruana, y que son indispensables para enfermedades como tumores, infecciones internas. Es así que dicha medicinas la prepara en su casa, siendo enviados a Puerto Maldonado, en donde lo recibe su padre para luego venderlos de manera ambulante. Él aprendió éste oficio hace 18 años, por medio de la familia de su esposa. Por otro lado, trabaja también como cuidador de unos terrenos de una universidad de la localidad, teniendo así otros ingresos extras. Le gusta su negocio pues tiene un ingreso económico ya que siendo foráneo y llegando de su tierra natal Ancash no tenía ocupación, pero con esto ya tiene un ingreso con el cual pude solventar los gastos de alimentación de su familia  a los que quiere mucho. Por otro lado tiene planes de instalar un jardín botánico de plantas medicinales en su pequeño terreno. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su negocio en la compra de plantas medicinales pues tiene un pedido pendiente por entregar, y con el saldo desea abrir una pequeña bodega de abarrotes en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Sixto is 49 years old and a hard-working, dedicated man.  He is also very kind.  He is married to Jacqueline, who is a home maker.  They live with their 5 children ages 18,16,14,12 and 4 in their own house.  Sixto makes and sells medicines made from plants of the Peruvian Amazon rain forest for a living.  They are indispensable for diseases such as tumors and internal infections.  He prepares them at home and sends them to Puerto Maldonado to his father who then sells them as a street vendor.  He learned this craft 18 years ago from his wife's family.  He also works as a grounds keeper for a local university to bring in extra income.  He likes his business since he is a foreigner here.   When he arrived from his homeland Ancash he didn't have an occupation.  This provides him with an income to feed his family whom he loves very much.  He also has plans to plant a botanical garden of medicinal plants on his small plot of land.  

This will be his second loan with MFP.  He hopes for your assistance so that he can work out his plans.  With the 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] requested he will buy medicinal plants as he has a pending order to fill.  With the balance he wants to open a small grocery store in his home.

loans.use: purchase medicinal plants and open a small grocery store.

loans.name: Vista Nueva Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Vista Nueva” está conformado por 19 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros relacionados con el comercio. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Alejandro quien en la foto se encuentra ubicado al final del grupo, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda y además viste una chaqueta color rojo con negro. Se dedica a prestar servicios de edición, fotografía, grabaciones e iluminación. Alejandro es dueño de una productora, la cual tiene el nombre de “AMR Producciones”. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 10 años.
Comenta que hace poco tiempo le sustrajeron tres cámaras fotográficas profesionales, pérdida que ha sido muy compleja para la entrega de sus servicios de manera eficiente. 
El trabaja de manera independiente y subcontrata personal para desempeñar su negocio de mejor manera. Además tiene un trabajo dependiente como ejecutivo de empresa.
El crédito y dinero adicional lo utilizará para comprar una cámara fotográfica profesional, ya que le servirá para trabajar fuera de la zona.
Su horario laboral es flexible, sin embargo debe tener la disponibilidad para trabajar de lunes a domingo. 
Una de sus metas es formar nuevamente la productora, con toda su implementación.
Alejandro vive junto a su esposa e hijo de 8 años de edad. Sus sueños son establecerse con su productora, esto le permitirá retomar el ritmo de vida laboral  antes del robo.
Alejandro se encuentra agradecido de la oportunidad que le brindó Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio, esto le permitirá concretar sus proyectos también. Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que se siente muy cómodo, ya que son muy organizados y las reuniones son muy buenas.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called "vista Nueva" and it is comprised of 19 entrepreneurs who work in different types of business. They all live in the city of Puerto Montt.
Alejandro is at the back of the group in the photo in the first place if you look from right to left and is wearing a red and black jacket. He offers services in publishing, photography, recording, and lighting. He has his own production company called "AMR Productions". He has been doing this for 10 years.
He says that he recently had three professional cameras stolen from him, and this loss has made it very difficult for him to deliver his services efficiently.
He works for himself and subcontracts so that his business operates in the best way. He also has a job as a company executive. 
He will use the loan and additional money to buy a professional camera that will enable him to work outside the area.
His work timetable is flexible but he has to be available to work Monday through Sunday.
One of his goals is to set-up a new production company.
Alejandro lives with his wife and 8 year old son. His goal is to establish his production company, and this would allow him to get back to how things were before the robbery.
Alejandro is grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza to invest in his business, and this will help him to make his projects real. He says he feels very comfortable with the loan group he is a part of as they are very organized and the meetings are good. 
Puerto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Lagos region. Some of the attractions of Puerto Montt are its beautiful green countryside, its quiet beaches, its food, and especially the reputation of its fish, seafood, and crafts. It is also the port for reaching Isla Grande de Chiloé, which is rich in tradition and legends.

loans.use: to buy a professional camera for his work outside the area.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying & selling used clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her buying & selling of used clothing business.

Jovy has been in this business for 20 years. Jovy earns more income from buying & selling jewelry.

Jovy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is married with 1 child. Analiza is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Analiza operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's had this business for 3 years. Every month, she earns PHP 1,500 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

In 2008, Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Analiza hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Teopista lives in Kampala. She is married with 4 children and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sales used clothes by means of door to door basis. She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to buy  bales of used clothes. Her business challenges includes transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy  bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Omonor

texts.en: Mrs. Omonor O. is 32 years old woman, who is happily married with two (2) children. She specializes in the making of beads and sales of clothes for the community. She is eager to get the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more Beads and Clothes for sale

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: I am a single girl aged 20. I am a tailor. I need the money to expand my business and be able to meet my college fees and increase my skills in the management of a business.

loans.use: I will use the business to expand my business.

loans.name: Paska

texts.en:
A. Paska is a married woman with eight children. Her children are well mannered, and she works very hard to bring them up morally, intellectually and spiritually.

She came to Kampala during the difficult times in 1997 when the Northern Uganda conflict made it unsafe for her family to stay. She took refuge in Kampala and eventually relocated to Acholi Quarter. While in Kampala, hard work is a part of her life. She started doing what she could to earn money for her family by selling sugar-canes and breaking stones. She eventually acquired her own pit and was able to earn more through dedication and hard work.

Paska's luck soon changed when she was introduced to Life in Africa. She joined and quickly started learning how to make paper beads. This brought a wonderful change in her life. She started earning more money, which was used to feed her family, pay for her school fees, and other necessities.

Paska dreams of constructing a permanent family house in the village. With peace on the horizon, people are starting to leave the camps and return home. Her family will need a house when they resettle back to Northern Uganda. For this she is requesting a loan in the amount of 150 USD. She will use the money to expand her quarry business so that she can start saving money to build her home. She will repay this loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Hiring Laboures

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia would like to purchase two steers.

loans.name: Ketut

texts.id:
Although she is a wife of a company employee, Ketut P. is very determined on her life struggle, proven besides owning a small Pig Farm mother Ketut P. still has a side business by owning a small food kiosk in front of her house. Mother Ketut P. bought one pig breeder for RP 700,000 (about $75), and it would take up to six month until this breeder could produce 7 offsprings, which she sold for Rp1,400,000 (about $150). From that sales Ketut P. paid for schooling for her child, who still attend Grade school to ease her husband's food kiosk business which would also benefit from this micro pig farming. Loan from Dinari would be used to expand her pig business for buying food to fatten the pigs.

Walaupun sebagai istri seorang karyawan sebuah perusahaan, namun Ketut P. sangat ulet dalam menjalani kehidupannya, terbukti selain mempunyai usaha ternak babi Ibu Ketut P. juga mempunyai usaha sampingan yaitu membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya. Ibu Ketut P. membeli 1 ekor penginduk dengan harga Rp. 700.000,- dan diperlukan waktu sampai enam bulan bagi penginduknya bisa berproduksi, dan anak yang dihasilkan berjumlah 7 ekor yang kemudian dijualnya Rp. 1.400.000,- . Dari hasil penjualan ini Ketut P. membiayai sekolah anaknya yang masih duduk di sekolah dasar untuk meringankan beban suaminya dalam menhidupi keluarga Usaha warungnya juga dicukupi dari hasil beternak babinya ini. Pinjaman dari DINARI dimanfaatkannya untuk mengembangkan usahanya yaitu dengan membeli pakan untuk penggemukan.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use:
To buy pigs stock and animal feed

membeli bibit Babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Celia Luz

texts.es:
Celia C., 24, and her husband Edgar, 32, have two young children. Their struggle to escape poverty is one of many in Perú. They work together daily on their small land, growing and raising various crops. Thankfully, both are seasoned agricultural workers, having had experience since youth. For personal reasons, they still live with their in-law, who left the home in their care. Their great wish is to build a house of their own where they can live comfortably; they own a small plot of land where they can build their dreams. For this reason, they seek a loan that will allow them to buy a little more land to improve and quality and increase the quantity of their crops. This will allow them to start construction of their own house. Their dreams are dependent on your kind cooperation.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Celia C. tiene 24 años, junto a su esposo Edgar de 32 años tienen dos menores hijos, los cuales son su motivación para continuar con la incansable lucha por salir de la pobreza en la que están sumergidos una multitud considerable de personas en el Perú.Juntos trabajan diariamente en su pequeña parcela de tierra, cultivando diversos productos gracias a la experiencia adquirida por ambos desde pequeños, aún viven en la casa de su cuñado, que por algunas circunstancias personales, tuvo que dejar su casa a su cuidado. El gran anhelo que posee esta familia es construir una casa propia donde poder vivir cómodamente ya que poseen un pequeño terreno, donde iniciar estos sueños.Y a razón de este hecho solicitan un préstamo con los que podrán comprase una parcela más de tierra para mejorar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos de cultivo a través de una mejor implementación de semillas; esto les permitirá iniciar la construcción de su casa y también de sus sueños contando para este fin con su gentil colaboración.

loans.use: To buy a small lot of land for optimal production

loans.name: Sanubar

texts.en: Sanubar  and her 3 children  live in  the Khachmaz region. She sells bread in order to support her family. She needs a loan of $950 to buy foodstuffs to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Sati

texts.en: Sati is a 50-year-old woman who sells chickens at the market to support her family needs since her husband, S., has been unemployed for a long time. She earns upto US$10.5 a day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$150 to add her working capital. She will repay this loan within period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add to her working capital

loans.name: Ivis

texts.es:
Ivis works incessantly every day selling gelatin desserts which she carries on a tray. She sells in different parts of the city, mostly at festivals and sporting events. Each day she leaves her house early in the morning and when she comes back with an empty tray, she’s happy because she knows she has made enough to maintain her 4 children for one day. Doing this and with the work her husband does, who also takes care of the kids, she is able to cover the most urgent household necessities. She dreams that one day she’ll have a kiosk at the market where she can sell her gelatin desserts. Let’s support Ivis’s desire to see her children do better each day.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Ivis, trabaja incesantemente cada día en la venta de gelatinas de manera ambulante, siempre vende en los diferentes puntos de la ciudad, sobre todo en las fiestas y eventos deportivos, cada día ella sale de su casa temprano y cuando regresa con la bandeja vacía de sus ventas está contenta porque sabe que es el sustento diario para cuatro hijos. Con esta actividad y también con el trabajo de su esposo que a veces apoya con la manutención de sus hijos ha podido cubrir durante años las necesidades más urgentes de su hogar.Ella sueña en que algún día tendrá un puesto en el mercado para comercializar sus gelatinas.Apoyemos a Ivis a seguir adelante con sus deseos de ver a sus hijos superándose día a día.

loans.use: Increase capital in order to offer the public a better selection of desserts.

loans.name: Safeta

texts.en: Safeta was born in 1968 and she is from Crijevčići, a small suburb of town Živinice. Her husband is self-employed and he earns about 400 KM monthly. They get additional money from cattle breeding. They have two children and are receiving 80 KM child support. Safeta intends to use this loan in the amount of 1200 KM for buying animal nutrition for a cow and heifer. Her intention is to keep her animals healthy and continue to earn a monthly income.

loans.use: Buying nutritional food for her animals.

loans.name: Roxana Maricela

texts.es:
Roxana Sánchez is a married mother of a 3-year-old daughter. She started her hamburger business 3 years ago in order to help herself with the household expenses, thus improving her quality of life. At that time, she was pregnant and well aware of the impending expenses. Her business has prospered and she has been able to maintain it until now thanks to her dedication.

She now needs a loan of $375.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can expand her business. With your help, Roxana will be able to continue with her business, offering better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Roxana Sánchez es casada y tiene una niña de 3 años. inicio su negocio de venta de hamburguesas hace 3 años para ayudarse en sustento económico y así tener un mejor nivel de vida, ya que en ese momento ella estaba embrazada y estaba conciente de los gastos que se avecinaban, gracias a su dedicación su negocio han prosperado y por eso lo ha conservado.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $375 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio. Con tu ayuda Roxana podrá continuar su negocio brindándoles mejor servicio a sus clientes

loans.use: Expansion of hamburger business

loans.name: Esmeralda De La Cruz

texts.es:
Esmeralda started selling food to her friends and neighbors five years ago. A divorce forced her to care for her two children, now 11 and 9 years old and in school, on her own, which is why she started the business. With time things have improved.

Now she needs a $775 loan, which she plans to repay in six months, to purchase of chairs, tables and a new stove because the old one is worn down, so she provide a better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Esmeralda empezó hace 5 años vendiendo comida entre sus vecinas y amigos, ya que después de su divorcio tenia que mantener a sus dos hijos, que actualmente tienen 11 y 9 años y son estudiantes, por lo que emprendió este negocio. Con el tiempo le ha ido bien.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mesas y sillas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus comensales y una estufa nueva por que la anterior estaba muy deteriorada

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs and a new stove / Comprar mobiliario

loans.name: Husen

texts.en:
S. Husen is 34 years old, married, and has three children of school age. 
Together with his wife, Husen earns income selling children's clothing and shoes in a store. The store is located in the central market of the town. Husen has been in this business already for 10 years. In order to be able to offer a wide range of goods for any taste and level of income, Husen almost every month travels to the neighboring town Istaravshan to purchase new goods. During his absence, Husen’s wife, pictured in the photo, helps him in the market. Husen has managed to increase his clientele, but he is still not able to fully meet the demand. Therefore, he needs a loan of US$300 for a term of 3 months. With the help of the loan, Husen plans to increase the stock of goods at the store, so that he can earn more income and provide his children with good education. This is Husen's first loan; however, he is sure that he will repay it on time. Husen is thankful to everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase of children's summer clothing for sale

loans.name: Faatolu

texts.en: Faatolu D., 54, is married with twelve children. She has been in the plantation business for many years, selling what she grows to the villgers and public five days per week; she expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~160 USD).  She has one previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Faatolu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to improve her plantation.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, knives, barbed wire, nails, and other supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Tham Thi

texts.vi:
Before joining TYM in 2001, Mrs. Tham Thi D.’s family faced many difficulties; they had many children at school age. Then she borrowed the first loan of 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to invest in live-stock. Her husband is a construction worker, whose income is 1,800,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. The family’s financial situation has improved. Their children can go to school, and they can buy more home facilities. This time she plans to borrow 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to renovate the farm and their house.

The family’s income is 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2001, kinh tế gia đình chị Dương Thị Thắm khá khó khăn do đông con lại đang trong độ tuổi ăn học. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn cũng là cơ hội để gia đình chị giảm bớt khó khăn, vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị xin vay 2.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, tần tảo chịu thương chịu khó chăn nuôi sản xuất. Chồng chị làm thợ xây công việc của anh rất đều đăn thu nhâp 1.800.000đ/tháng. Kinh tế gia đình chị đã giảm bớt khó khăn và từng bước phát triển. Từ những đồng vốn tích lũy được gia đình chị đã đầu tư cho các con ăn học và kiến thiết nhà cửa. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị có nguyên vọng sửa sang công trình phụ và chuồng trại để đảm bảo cho việc chăn nuôi. Mức vốn gia đình chị xin vay là 15.000.000đ.

Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/tháng

loans.use: live-stock

loans.name: Solidarios Group

texts.en:
The Solidarios ("Solidarity") group bank consists of 14 partners who meet every two weeks in the Virgen de Cotoca zone on Santa Cruz Street in the tropical Santa Cruz region of eastern Bolivia. Their first loan having gone well, the group now wants to take out a second one, confident that they will continue to work well together. The group says that both the responsibility and the desire to work hard are helping them to develop their small businesses and support their families. Several of the women are teachers who have businesses on the side providing additional income to improve the lives of their families.

The group members are involved in a variety of businesses: Noel, Luis and Julio all drive taxis or motorcycle taxis; Raquel owns a copy shop; Teresa, Lucia, Liliana and Celia sell clothing and underwear; Cecilia sells bread; Nancy and Celia sell prepared meals, while Maria Noemi sells Yambal cosmetic products and Rodolfo runs a body shop. Most of the group members plan to use their Kiva loan to purchase more merchandise to sell, supplies for their businesses, or ingredients to make meals.

The group's president, Rosmeri B., is thankful for the support that AgroCapital has offered the group. She is committed to ensuring that all member obligations are met.

loans.use: To purchase bulk merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia inició el negocio para realizar una actividad que le de un sueldo ya que es difícil conseguir un trabajo con horarios flexibles para no desatender a su familia, tuvo la oportunidad de aprovechar un espacio que le otorgaron en el mercado, y fue así como hace tres años puso su negocio de venta de novedades, que le da ingresos para sostener a su familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Sonia began her business in order to have an activity that would give her an income. Currently it is difficult to find a job with flexible hours in order that she wouldn’t neglect her family. She had the opportunity to take advantage of a space that they gave her in the market, and this was how three years ago she began her business, selling novelty items, that gives her the income to sustain her family. She needs a loan of US $250 that she will repay in 6 months in order to buy merchandise. With your help, she will improve her life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Soeurng

texts.en: Mrs. Soeurng T. is a villager in Kradas Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer. Because her plantation has infertile soil, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. An Ngeun, assists her on the plantation. Mrs. Soeurng T. is 37 years old and the mother of two children, who are both attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is a 38-year-old trader. She is married with one child; she also cares for her sister's child.  She has been selling used clothes in the local market of Tema for 2 years. With income from her business, Florence supports the two children in school. Her major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business. She has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her children through school. She belongs to the group called ‘Morning Star’ Trust Group; members in this group provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Keomtouch

texts.en:
Mrs. Keomtouch E. is a villager in Sro Mor Village in the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She is poultry breeder and raises ducks. Since her ducks are growing larger, she does not have enough money to feed them and is requesting a loan to buy more duck food.

Her husband, Mr. Yoem Bunthoeurn, is a policeman who makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Keomtouch E. is 31-years-old and the mother of three children. One is a laborer, while the remaining two are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more duck food for her duck breeding business.

loans.name: 15 De Diciembre Group

texts.es: El grupo "15 D. Diciembre " esta integrada por personas D. negocio D. diferente rubro y representados por la señora SonI.. Las socias integrantes desempeñan diferentes actividades como a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, venta D. comida y tienda D. abarrotes;  los socios participantes también tienen comercios pequeños, como venta D. cinturones, billeteras y comida. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencI. D. la oferta y la demanda espacialmente en el sector comercio pero los socios siempre tratan D. estar con la mercadería nueva para poder cumplir con la demanda D. productos y ofrecer productos D. buena calidad y a abajo precio. El crédito esta destinado para incrementar su mercadería, comprar material D. trabajo y a la compra D. herramientas para mejorar la calidad D. sus productos. Los socios (as) participaron con anterioridad en grupos diferentes demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos, por lo conocen el trabajo en grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The "15 D. Diciembre " group is maD. up of people owning a variety of different types of businesses. They are represented by SonI.. The women of the group work selling cosmetics from catalogues, selling food and running their grocery stores; the men of the group also have small businesses such as selling belts, wallets and food. As in any commercial setting, there is always competition in sales and in supply but all the members try to offer new products in order to satify the demand for their products and to ensure they offer good-quality products at a good price. The loan will be used to bolster their stock, buy materials for their businesses and the purchase of tools to improve the quality of their products. The members have been part of other groups previously and have demonstrated their responsibility, having repaid previous loans in full: they are familiar with working as a group.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ath

texts.en: Mr. Ath D. is a villager in Tom Por village in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation he needs fertilizer to make his crop more productive. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and he would use the rest of the loan to purchase chickens and ducks for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Van Srey Chheang, is an animal breeder. Mr. Ath D. is 36 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or study. His wife is presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field and make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene un puesto de venta en la localidad de Mallasa (a 15 minutos al sur de La Paz) y también trabaja como asistente de abogado, es la única que genera ingresos en su familia ya que cuenta con una hija en edad universitaria.
Vive en la zona de Villa San Antonio Bajo de la Ciudad de La Paz, en alquiler 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo ( compra de pasankalla, refrescos, tarjetas de llamadas telefónicas y dulces).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.
texts.en:
Sonia has a retail stall in Mallasa (located 15 minutes south of La Paz) and she also works as a lawyer's assistant. She is the only one that generates income for her family as she has a college-aged daughter. Sonia rents her home which is located in the Villa San Antonia Bajo zone in the city of La Paz. This loan will be used as working capital to purchase pasankalla corn, soft drinks, phone cards and candies. This is the third time that she receives a loan with IMPRO and her credit history qualifies her as a client 1 which means that she has a good record of repaying her loans. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, phone cards and candies for resale at her stall.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana tiene 37 años, es divorciada y vive en su propia casa con sus dos hijos Wilfredo de 15 y Lucy de 10, y lo que más desea es darles unos buenos estudios. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y bromista, está en el negocio de la producción de helados, los cuales luego distribuye a varias heladerías con las que tiene contrato, sus helados son muy solicitados por los clientes, ya que son muy ricos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es que puede disfrutar de sus helados mientras los prepara, anhela tener una heladería donde pueda vender con mucha más comodidad, ya que lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que distribuir los pesadas cajas, lo cual la cansa mucho. Emiliana sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para alcanzar sus metas y está dispuesta a hacerlo con tal de mejorar su vida. Es su quinto préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y lo hará, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida y admirada. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más ingredientes para fabricar sus helados, además de cajas de tecnopor para distribuir mejor sus helados.
texts.en:
Emiliana is 37, divorced and lives in a house she owns with her two children, Wilfredo, 15 and Lucy, 10. What she desires the most is to give them the opportunity to have a good education. She is a very joyful and funny woman, she is in the business of making frozen desserts, which she distributes to various ice cream shops that she has a contract with, her frozen desserts are very demanded by her clients, because they are delicious. She has being doing this activity for 15 yeas and what she likes the most is that she can enjoy the desserts while making them, she wants to have an ice cream shop where she can sell more comfortably; because what she doesn't enjoy about her job is to do the heavy box distribution, which is very exhausting. Emiliana knows that she has to work hard to achieve her goals and is willing to do it to have a better life. This is the fifth loan with MFP, she knows she has to repay it on time and she will, she doesn't want to cause any problems to her community bank, where she is an admired and loved member. With the loan requested she will buy more ingredients to make the frozen desserts, she will also buy boxes to better distribute her products.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make frozen desserts

loans.name: Dinna

texts.en: Mrs. Dinna R. raises pigs in order to help her husband and provide educational support for her school-age child.  She needs this loan to purchase feed and medicine for her piglets. Dinna is 28 years of age, married with two children and a resident of Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte.  Her husband is a merchandiser with a company.  She is an active member of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicine for piglets

loans.name: Hsien

texts.en:
Hsien has been working as a furniture repairman for twenty years. He is a 38-year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Hsien has requested a loan of $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his shop. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. His clients can be anybody from his region. He hasn't faced any difficulties since he first started his business. Hsien chose this business out of financial need. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for a furniture repair shop

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en:
Xuân Đặng Thị (1025060747) is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily ducks, for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2005, Xuân joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

Xuân is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 7th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ramón Estanislao

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Ramón Estanislao G. le faltan los acabados del interior y exterior de la casa. Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar a cabo la mejora. 
  El señor Ramón Estanislao tiene poco que se quedo viudo y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijos y los cuales están estudiando la universidad. 
Solicita el préstamo para realizar las mejoras lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Ramón Estanislao G.’s home is missing interior and exterior finishings. At this moment he does not have the necessary money to carry out the home improvements. Ramón Estanislao recently became widowed and is responsible for two children who are in the midst of their university studies. He is requesting a loan to carry out home improvements as quickly as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To carry out home improvements in the interior and exterior of his house.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity sells foodstuffs. She is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun P. is a modest person of twenty-five years, who lives with her family in Siem Reap province. She is married with two kids who are minors and a school-aged child. She helps be responsible for her family by selling a few fresh fish in the local market, through which she can make around $2 of profit a day. She is married to Bunthoeun, 38, who owns a car to provide a taxi service for income. Recently, Khun P.’s husband isn't earning as much money as before because his taxi is not attractive to the customer. Khun P. hopes to decorate the taxi by using the Kiva loan to pay for painting the taxi.
