loans.use: To pay for painting the taxi

loans.name: Son Of Man Group

texts.en:
Francis is a 43-year-old trader. He is married with eight children. Seven of them are schooling and his last is still nursing. For two years, he has sold used clothes in the local market in his community where he lives. He also sells by hawking during the market days in his surrounding communities. His major business challenge over the years has been obtaining funds to scale up the business. He has a lot of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable him to achieve remarkable business progress. He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve his customers. He hopes to save enough money to support his children's entire schooling.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Son of Man’. He is the one in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and there is peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a member of the Semtema B borrower group In Kihesa,Iringa,she is 23 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is 1 year aged.

 Lilian started her own shop business selling commodities like rice,sugar,salts etc 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Lilia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Lilian hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.es: A sus 60 años, Gaudencio mantiene un buen sentido del humor, vive en su casa propia, está casado con Hilda y tienen 8 hijos, quienes ya son independientes. Mediante la siembra de papa, arvejas, ollucos y habas, ha mantenido durante todos estos años a su familia, además de la crianza de sus vacas, que al ordeñarlas acumulan entre 3 a 4 baldes de leche, con la que elaboran ricos quesos. Por el sabor de estos quesos son reconocidos por sus clientes, los cuales también lleva a la ciudad de Lima cada quincena. Gaudencio ya cuenta con clientes regulares en Lima, es por eso que prepara entre 40 a 60 quesos sólo para sus pedidos de la capital. Por otro lado, el resto de sus quesos los vende en el mercado “Dos de mayo” de la ciudad de Tarma (mercado minorista). Gaudencio está muy contento con sus actividades, pues les permiten solventar sus necesidades. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y se siente muy identificado, pues todos sus créditos anteriores le han sido de mucha ayuda. Por otro lado, nos cuenta que él es uno de los fundadores de su banco comunal, el que tiene cerca de 5 años de formado. El dinero solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y chacras de avena para la alimentación de sus vacas.
texts.en:
At 60 years of age, Gaudencio maintains a good sense of humor. He and his wife Hilda live in their own home and they have 8 adult children. They have been able to support their family throughout the years by cultivating potatoes, peas, beans, and ulloco. In addition, they raise dairy cows so that they can obtain 3 to 4 buckets of milk each day to produce their rich cheeses, which are well-known among customers for their flavor. They sell their products in Lima every 2 weeks. Gaudencio already has regular customers in Lima, which is why he prepares between 40 to 60 blocks of cheese so that he can fulfill his orders. He sells the rest of his cheese in Tarma at the “Dos de Mayo” (May 2) Market, where products are sold at retail. Gaudencio is very happy with all of his business activities, since they enable him to provide for all of his necessities.

This will be Gaudencio’s ninth loan with MFP. His previous loans were very helpful. He has been with his Communal Bank for 5 years and was one of its founding members. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers and a supply of oats to feed to his cows.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & feed for his dairy cows

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has a boutique where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with a child and she is 27 years old.

Mercy hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a father to seven children. He is 58 years old and married. His business is rice farming and he also sells fish when it is not harvest season.

Samuel joined CEVI last June and is grateful for the financial service he was able to obtain. Now he is requesting to loan Php 7,000 which he will use to purchase farm inputs that his farm lacks.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Farhad

texts.en:
This is a picture of Farhad, son of Zemarai, who lives in Jalalabad city. He is the oldest son in his family and holds many responsibilities for his family members. He lives in a family of eight, including his father and mother.

Farhad has a general store where he sells a wide range of items. He is asking for an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the purpose of purchasing more good quality food items and materials for his shop. He wants to attract more clients by purchasing high demand items for his market. He hopes to improve his business by bringing new changes to it. He is confident that he can repay his loan on time and plans to join the second cycle loan after the full repayment of the first cycle loan. He would like to extend his gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more food items for store

loans.name: Bellie

texts.en:
Bellie A. is from the village of Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Bellie owns and operates a business selling snacks, like banana cue (deep-fried bananas with carmelized sugar) and other delicacies, in the local community. Bellie has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $109 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Bellie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bellie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Bellie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Santa Barbara (which is the name of a virgin), are clients of Asociación Arariwa. This communal bank consists of 10 members in Cusco. All the group members live in Poroy, which is a neighborhood in Cusco. All of the members live with their common-law spouse and have children. The members of Santa Barbara are involved in various commercial activities, including selling fruits, artesanía (hand crafts), and construction materials.

One of the members, Claudio Francisco, was born in Cusco, and lives in Poroy. He is 38 years old. He lives with his partner and has 3 children. He sells construction materials for homes, mostly wood. He sells 1,800 soles per week, which is the equivalent of $620. He earns about 4,380 soles per month. With this loan, he will invest in his construction business.

All of the members of Santa Barbara appreciate and thank you for the loan and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

(Cristobal is not pictured in the photo.)

loans.use: Capital for businesss capital, for example, for material for construction business

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita A. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 48 years old. Pacita is married with children. To make a living, Pacita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for several years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pacita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pacita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Power And Might Group

texts.en: Lydia is a thirty-six year old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercially-dominated community. Lydia is a merchant who sells jewels. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Power and Might. The members of the group are mainly merchants. They are hard working, trust themselves and want the loan to invest in their businesses. Lydia, the group leader, is on the right in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Jeaneth tiene 39 años de edad, casada, procreo tres hijos los cuales están estudiando, junto a su esposo han logrado tener su propio negocio una pequeña ferretería en donde vende variedad de productos, desde hace cinco años administra ella, ya que su esposo trabaja como gerente de una empresa privada de transporte. Gracias al apoyo de su esposo como de los surtidores de pinturas, hierro que le dejan materiales para la quincena ha aumentado su capital. Con este financiamiento quiere comprar: cemento, hierro, pintura, cerámica, alambre ya que es lo que mas se vende. Y cuando no tiene sus clientes se van a la competencia lo cual no le conviene, es por eso con esta inversión espera aumentar las ventas. A futuro espera aumentar más su ferretería. Para poder apoyar a sus tres hijos con su educación, como cubrir sus necesidades y pagos. Da las gracias a la institución por el aporte a mejorar  su vida en el ámbito económico.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is 39 years old and married. She has three children who are in school. Together with her husband, she has been able to start her own business, a small hardware store where she sells a variety of products. For the past five years, she has run the business herself, because her husband works as a manager for a private transportation company. Thanks to her husband's help, for instance with supplies of paint and iron goods every two weeks that provide her with materials, she has been able to increase her capital. With this loan, she would like to purchase cement, iron, paints, ceramics, and wire, which are the best-selling products. When these items are out of stock, her customers go to the competition; this is not good for her, and so she expects to increase her sales thanks to this investment. In the future, she hopes to further expand her hardware store, so she will be able to support her three children with their education, as well as covering their daily needs and necessary payments. Jeaneth thanks the institution for its help in improving her life economically.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cement, iron, paints, wire and ceramics because her inventory of these products is low

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima F. est un yoffois de 41 ans qui habite plus précisément dans le quartier de Mbenguene. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2003. Il est marie et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 6 et 10 ans. Sa première profession était celle de cuisinier dans un hôtel de la place. Mais il a rompu avec cette activité et depuis 2003 il s’est substitue en technicien. Il fait des montages en électricité, du câblage et du reportage dans les cérémonies. C’est par passion qu’il est entre dans ce secteur d’activiste toujours dans l’objectif de satisfaire la clientèle. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs dans le but de renouveler un amplificateur et acheter 2 décodeurs qui sont ses outils de travail. Ce crédit pourra contribuer à l’amélioration les conditions de vie de sa famille a qui il doit soutien et assistance.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima F., 41, is a native of Yoff who lives in the Mbenguene district, to be precise. He has been a member of the Yoff credit union since July 2003. He is married and the father of 3 children, aged between 6 and 10 years. His first profession was that of cook in a local hotel. However, he quit that job and since 2003, he has become a technician. He sets up electrical and cable systems and records local events. Getting into this very active work is exciting for him and he is always looking to satisfy his clientele. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 frs so as to get a new amplifier and buy two decoders, the tools of his trade. This loan will contribute to improving living conditions for his family to whom he owes support and assistance.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: a new amplifier and two decoders for his work

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon K., 37, is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where she has established a small family home and lives with other family members. She is married to Bun Sokha, 41, and has three school-aged children, who require her financial support. Her husband owns a small truck that he uses to pick up merchandise or garment workers for a profit. In order to earn an income, Suon K. buys clothing in bulk from the factory and from her wholesale supplier and sells it at retail prices in the local public market. Suon K. is taking out her loan to buy a new motorcycle which will allow her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mrs. Muong Pil Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Muong P. is a 32-year-old farmer who owns 3 hectares of land to cultivate rice to support her family. She is also a pig breeder and her husband, Mr. Sauben Nuon, is a construction worker. She is the mother of three children, two of whO. are enrolled in the local public school while the other one is too small for school.

With the farm, they have some problems because their rice field has infertile soil and it is time to plow. Thus, in order to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Muong P. decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizers. With the rest of the loan, she would like to hire some farmers to plow the rice field. 

Mrs. Muong P. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members consisting of 22 people located in Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province. These members will be using the loan for different purpose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 45 años, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos ya independientes y con familia, en el que viven juntos en un barrio al sur de Lima.Por muchos años trabajaba vendiendo comida, hasta que cayó enferma, por lo que tuvo que dejar ese negocio. Con el tiempo, siendo sus hijos adultos y con la ayuda de ellos, pudieron comprar un carro. Desde entonces realizan el servicio de transporte interurbano, desde las 5:00am de la mañana hasta la media noche,  en donde su hijo mayor es el chofer,  y el segundo realiza la cobranza de pasajes, de esa manera evitarían gastos extras de cobrador a otras personas. De las ganancias que obtiene puede cubrir las revisiones técnicas de su vehículo, además del cambio de llantas, así como el pago de permiso y el seguro, al mismo tiempo que necesitan pagar los gastos diarios para la familia. Es así que se siente con mucha responsabilidad, además que le gusta la actividad que realiza a lado de sus hijos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y se compromete a no retrazarse ninguna cuota, de ese modo no logrará perjudicar al resto de sus compañeros a quienes mucho aprecia. Con el crédito que solicita, lo derivará en la compra de llantas para su carro, puesto que ya las tiene muy deterioradas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 45 years old. She is a single mother and has two independent adult children. They have their own families now. They live together in a south Lima neighborhood. [Carmen] sold food for many years until she fell ill and had to leave the business. Over time she and her children were able to buy a vehicle. Since then they have been providing intercity transportation from 5:00 am to midnight. Her oldest son drives and the second oldest collects payment for the service. This way they are able to save the cost of hiring someone else to collect. The income covers the cost of vehicle maintenance (less the cost of tires), registration, and insurance. They also pay for the family's daily expenses. She feels that she has a lot of responsibility, but likes working alongside her children. This will be her sixth loan through MFP and she promises not to fall behind on any payments, so that she will not shed a bad light on her colleagues, whom she appreciates very much. She will use the money from this loan to buy tires for her car because the ones on it are already much deteriorated.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tires

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguissèmè de l’association Sabougnouma, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Sirimou, sous préfecture de Fana; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de céréales et du charbon de bois. 
Les céréales (arachides, mil, maïs, fonio, sésame) constituent l’activité de prédilection de Tata Temeté un des membres fondateurs du groupe.
Ces femmes du groupe Djiguissèmè sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents. Tata Temeté compte  utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des sacs de céréales sur place dans le village et dans les environnants. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Tingolé et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22.500FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguissèmè group of the Sabougnouma association are all married, are on average 33 years old with four children, and all live in traditional extended families in Sirimou, in the Fana sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They became acquainted through family ties and trade grain cereals and charcoal. Trading cereals (peanuts, millet, corn, fonio, and sesame) is the preferred activity of Tata Temeté, one of the group’s founding members. The Djiguissèmè group women are requesting a fourth group loan, having fully repaid all three previous loans. Tata Temeté will use her portion of the loan to buy bags of cereals locally, in the village and the surrounding area. She sells locally at the Tingolé market and in surrounding market fairs, for cash, retail and on credit, to both women and men customers. She hopes to reach an average monthly income of 22,500 FCFA which will be used for daily family expenses, the remainder being reinvested in the commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grain cereals

loans.name: Ñustas Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Santiago II, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Ñustas, están juntas hace 3 años aproximadamente y desean estar juntas por mucho tiempo.

Uno de los integrantes es Santos Eliseo A. de 32 años, se dedica a reciclar muebles, cosinas, botellas y otros. Eliseo cuando un bien no esta muy dañado lo repara para venderlo, en otros casos los vende a otros negociantes, en esta oportunidad él necesita el préstamo para comprar mayor chatarra.

Las demás integrantes de éste grupo tienen diversos negocios como la atención de una tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, transporte, costura de prendas de vestir, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de verduras, cerrajería y venta de lana.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para fortalecer y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Ñustas (Incan Princesses) communal bank is part of the Santiago II focal center; they have been organized for about three years and wish to stay together for a very long time still. One of the members is Santos Eliseo A., 32. He recycles furniture, stoves, bottles, etc. When an article isn’t too damaged, Eliseo repairs it. In other cases, he sells them to other merchants. He needs funds to buy more recyclables. The other group members have various commercial activities; such as: neighborhood grocery store, clothing sales, public transportation, seamstress services, quinoa juice sales, vegetable sales, locksmith services and wool sales. All the members need funds to strengthen and improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recyclable items.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante.
Carmen es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Carmen tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donde vende condimentos, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aji y comino.
Los sueños de Carmen es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Radiant Sun village bank. She is married, 37 years old and has 3 children. She has a stand in the Playa Grau market where she sells condiments everyday. She needs a $575 loan to buy chili and cumin. Her dream is for her children to someday finish their college educations.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chili and cumin

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. is from the village of Panadtalan, Maramag Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Rosita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yude

texts.es: Yude, de 25 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Humberto (28) y de sus dos pequeños hijos.Desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, con lo cual genera un regular  ingreso extra a la economía familiar, pues siempre le ha gustado compartir los gastos con su pareja. Le agrada mucho su trabajo, pues le da la independencia de poder realizarlo desde su casa, y así puede  vigilar a sus pequeños hijos, además que no descuida las labores de su hogar. Ofrece su variada  mercadería por catálogos a sus vecinas y amigas; de esta forma  obtiene buenos pedidos, sobretodo porque recomienda los tonos y productos que mejor le cae a las clientes.  En el futuro espera instalar  un gran bazar donde pueda ofrecer más cómodamente su mercadería.Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y se compromete a  ser muy puntual con sus pagos.Yude tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de cosméticos para tenerlos en stock, y ofrecerlos a buenos precios a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Yude, 25, lives in her own house with her partner, Humberto, 28, and their two young children. She has sold beauty products for the last three years. This produces extra income for the family because she has always enjoyed sharing costs with her partner. She enjoys her work very much because it gives her the freedom to work from home so she can watch over her small children; in addition, she doesn’t neglect her household chores. She offers a variety of catalogue items to her neighbors and friends. They place good orders especially because she recommends what hues go best and which products are most appropriate for her customers. In the future, she’d like to set up a large store where she can sell her merchandise more comfortably. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with repayments. Yude plans to use the requested funds o buy large amounts of cosmetics to have in stock so that she can offer them at good prices to her best customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angélica es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una zona que tiene bastante movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad. Se encuentra ubicado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chialyo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde hace mas de dos años a la comercialización de animales menores, ella cría patos, gallinas, pollos y pavos en su vivienda, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en el mercado principal de la ciudad en donde vive. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Luz Angélica desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales para que estos se desarrollen de mejor manera y pueda venderlos a un mejor precio, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Luz Angélica es una mujer empeñosa y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a los suyos. Su mayor anhelo es tener una casa propia, ya que la casa donde actualmente vive es alquilada.
texts.en:
Luz Angélica is 30, and a mother of two who lives with her husband in the agricultural district of Chepén, an area that has a lot of commerce. It is in the province of the same name, in La Libertad region, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has been working for more than two years selling small animals. She raises ducks, hens, chickens and turkeys around her home. When they have grown to a good size, she sells them in the main market of the city where she lives. The earnings that she receives from the business help her husband with the financial support of the family. Luz Angélica wants to provide more nutritional food for her animals so that they will develop better and she can sell them for a higher price. That is why she has seen the need to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 new soles. Luz Angélica is a hard-working woman who is always giving her best to have her family get ahead. Her biggest dream is to have her own home, since the one where they currently live is rented.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food and improve the nutrition of her animals so that she can sell them.

loans.name: José Aparicio

texts.es: José Aparicio G. H. 55 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La libertad. Vive junto a su compañera de vida la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, junto a una hija y una nieta. José es un señor muy esforzado quien trabaja como camionero, transportando diferentes tipos de materiales, ya sea leña, arena, incluso haciendo viajes para mudanzas, él posee dos camiones los cuales son su fuente de trabajo y gracias a los cuales cuenta con el sustento diarios, en muchas ocasiones él realiza viajes desde Opico hasta San Salvador, los cuales son los viajes en los cuales gana más. Él solicita un préstamo a integral, con el deseo de contar con el monto necesario para invertir en el mantenimiento de sus camiones, y así mandar a reparar la cama del camión y las fajas de este, esto lo hace con el fin de poder contar con un medio de transporte más seguro tanto para el como  para sus clientes, ya que les asegura llevar con bien sus pertenencias hasta el lugar destinado. José es muy trabajador por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes, esto es muy beneficioso para él ya que cuenta con un trabajo seguro.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old and lives in the town of San Juan Opico, department of La Libertad. He lives along with his wife, who dedicates herself to household chores, along with their daughter and granddaughter. José is a very hard-working man who works as a truck driver, transporting all kinds of materials, whether it be wood or sand, and even makes trips for removals. He has two trucks, which are the source of his labor, and thanks to those he counts on daily income. Many times he makes trips from Opico to San Salvador, on which he earns the most. He is requesting the loan with the goal of having the necessary funds to invest in the maintenance of his trucks and make repairs to the truck bed and tie-downs. This will make his trucks more secure as much for him as his customers because it assures he can carry his items safely to their destination. José is a very hard worker who has many customers. This loan is very beneficial for him because it provides job security.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts and make repairs

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Máyela Suyen

texts.es: La señora Máyela Suyen R. A. tiene la edad de 26 años vive en el Barrio de Las Conchitas es casada y su esposo labora como técnico en Refrigeración y le apoya en los gastos del hogar con sus ingresos, ellos tienen un hijo de 8 años el cual estudia la escuela primaria, la señora R. es comerciante de frutas y verduras, desde hace ya 4 años que ofrece su mercadería en las calles, ellos son muy humildes, pero jóvenes emprendedores, trabajadores y responsables que desean invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan llevar a cabo unas remodelaciones a la parte trasera de su hogar, es por su hijos que solicitan este préstamo para ofrecerle mejores condiciones de habitad y que goze de un espacio mas optimo donde jugar y pasar sus ratos libres.
texts.en:
Máyela Suyen R. A. is 26 years old and lives in the Las Conchitas neighborhood. She is married and her husband works as a refrigeration technician. She helps him with the household expenses with her income. They have an 8 year-old son who is in elementary school. Ms. R. has been selling fruits and vegetables for four years. She sells her product in the streets. Her and her husband are very humble but are enterprising, hard working and responsible young adults who want to invest in the purchase of construction materials to remodel some parts of the back of their home. They are requesting this loan in order to offer their children better living conditions and to give them a better place to play and spend their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to remodel their house.

loans.name: Rosa Natividad

texts.en:
Rosa Natividad N. R. is 50 years old. She is married and lives in Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She has three children, ages 30, 17, and 15. 

Rosa is a member of the rural loan group San Jacinto. The group consists of 15 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture. 

Rosa also works in agriculture and earns on average $160 per month. She does the buying and selling of her products in the nearby town of Matilde. 

Rosa plans to use the loan to buy farm animals. Her dream is to have her own plot of land. She has struggled with many of her cattle dying due to the lack of food. 

In her free time, she likes to watch television and listen to music. Her favorite community tradition is the Christmas festivities.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Brenda Lisset

texts.es: Brenda tiene 33 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, ella es una joven muy activa y dinámica, le gusta mucho su trabajo, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido muy satisfactorio para mantener a sus clientes. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de  desodorantes, pinturas de uñas, lápiz labial, cremas,  perfumes y tratamientos. El deseo de Branda es que sus hijos logren mantener este negocio.
texts.en:
Brenda, 33, sells cosmetics. She’s a very active and dynamic young woman. She enjoys her work very much. This isn’t her first loan since they have been very satisfactory for her to keep her customers. She is asking for financing to buy deodorants, nail polish, lipstick, creams, perfumes and beauty treatments. Brenda’s wish is that her children continue to manage to keep this business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: 05.01.19 Group

texts.en:
Nien N. T. (48) is a 62-year-old woman living in the town of Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Nien is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 19 (05.01.19).


Nien is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, Nien operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattL. for saL..  Nien has been engaged in this business for over 40 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Nien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nien is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Womenin the amount of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Tam (49) is a 47-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock24

2.  T. T. Sen (50) is a 34-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,428.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nien N. T. (48) là 62 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Nien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 19 (05.01.19).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Nien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 40 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nien kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Nien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Nien đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 12th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  L. T. tam (49) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  T. T. sen (50) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.4248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer A. is from the village of Delapa, Sibutad. She is 39 years old and married and with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer sells tuba (a native wine) in the community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2006, Jennifer joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for corn production. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Jennifer from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For corn production

loans.name: Jenny Alexandra

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar. Este lugar es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Jenny tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha tenido dos hijos de 23 y 12 años de edad, la mayor ya es graduada de la universidad y el menor esta en colegio. Su marido es comerciante.

Ella y su marido tienen un negocio de compra y venta de pescado y camarón, trabajan todos los días, en la madrugada el se desplaza hasta Puerto López donde le compra a los barcos que llegan hasta la playa  ya que allí le salen más baratos ya que son entregados directamente de los pescadores, luego venden en el mercado de Puerto López y el resto lo llevan a San Jacinto donde ella se encarga de vender.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar mas de sus productos, es socia del Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y está muy conforme porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the Communal Bank “Esperanza Para Superar” (Hope to Overcome) meets in the beautiful resort town of San Jacinto, which is surrounded by a beautiful beach and where the Portoviejo River meets the sea. This place is visited by many domestic and foreign tourists.

Sra. Jenny is 47 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 23 and 12). Her older child has already graduated from university while the younger child is in high school. Her husband is a merchant.

Jenny and her husband have a business buying and selling fish and shrimp. They work every day. At dawn her husband goes to Puerto López where he buys from the fishing boats that arrive at the beach. The seafood is cheaper because he buy directly from the fishermen. He later sells at the market in Puerto López and brings what remains to San Jacinto for Jenny to sell.

This loan will be used to buy more products. Jenny has been a member of the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and is very happy because the loans have been a great help to her business. Her dream is to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase fish & shrimp

loans.name: Juan De Mato

texts.es: Juan de Mato, de 50 años, es un hombre alegre y muy trabajador, esta casado con Hilda, de 44 años, ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos, David, de 13 y Verónica de 11 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Santa Clara. El trabajo que desempeña, es la agricultura, ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a ello. La siembra de papa en sus diferentes variedades, es su principal actividad, cuando sus sembríos están listos para ser cosechados, él los empaqueta y vende en el mercado central de su ciudad; pero no solo a eso se dedica Juan, ya que, la crianza intensiva de ganado vacuno y ovino; es lo que le divierte más. Los enseba y posteriormente, vende su carne en pueblos aledaños de su localidad. Ahora él está planeando construir un cobertizo, con el cual podrá cuidar a sus animales del constante frío de la zona. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y agradece a su banco comunal, que durante todo este tiempo trabajo con esmero y ahínco. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará semillas de papa de la variedad “Yungay”, de la misma manera, invertirá el restante en la compra de abono orgánico, para su producción de papa  de la variedad “Pericholi”, que cosechará dentro de algunos meses.
texts.en:
Juan de Mato, 50, is a cheerful, very hard working man.  He’s married to Hilda, 44, and they have 6 children but only two, David, 13 and Verónica, 11, still live with them in their own house located in a rural area of Santa Clara.

He has been a farmer for 20 years.  His main activity is planting various varieties of potato.  When the harvest is ready he packages it and sells it in the city’s Central Market.  But this isn’t all Juan does.  He also raises cattle and sheep.  That’s what he enjoys the most.  He fattens them up and then sells the meat in adjoining towns.   He is planning to build a shelter to protect his animals from the constant cold in the area. This is his 8th loan with MFP and he thanks the communal bank which has worked with dedication and effort all this time.

He will use the loan he’ll get to buy potato seed of the “Yungay” variety as well as using the rest of the loan to buy organic manure for his “Pericholi” variety of potato that he will harvest in a few months.

loans.use: To buy potato seed and organic manure for his next planting.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 44 years old and runs a grocery store business in a busy part of Nairobi. Her store attracts a good flow of customers. Monica is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to add stock of omena (young fish), sukuma wiki (kales) and tomatoes, among other products. She is a single mother of two young adults and describes herself as hardworking, happy, honest and trustworthy. In the future, she hopes to be an employer with several business outlets.

loans.use: To add stock of omena (young fish), sukuma wiki (kales) and tomatoes, among other products

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy J. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 30 years old, married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Judy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap,  toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Judy has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Judy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Judy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Judy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Twikuremubukene Group

texts.fr:
Farida M. est commerçante dans le secteur Rugerero, et elle est un membre du groupe Twikuremubikene.  Elle a 23 ans, et elle a 2 enfants entre 3 ans et 5 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 6eme primaire, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paires des habits pour son commerce.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de rembourses bien ce crédit en vue de solliciter un autre.  Avec son prêt, elle voudrait acheter beaucoup de biens.  Elle voudrait s’autofinancer elle-même, épargner pour sa famille, et payer des frais d’études pour ses enfants.
NB: Sur la photo il y a une nouvelle femme qui est nouveau membre qui n'a pas encore sollicité le prêt.
texts.en:
Farida M. is a shopkeeper in Rugerero and is a member of the Twikuremubikene group. She is 23 years old and has two children, aged 3 and 5, one of whom attends school.  She left school after the sixth year. 
She would use her loan to buy 10 dresses for her business. Her growth strategy for the business is to repay this loan and request another. With the loan she receives she would like to purchase some goods. She would like to finance the business herself, put some money aside for her family and pay her children's school fees. 
NB in the photograph there is another woman who is a new member of the group and has not yet sought a loan.

loans.use: Achta de 10 paires de tissus pour les tailler en  habits finis

loans.name: Norlito

texts.en:
Norlito B. is from the village of Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya.  He is 29 years old.  Norlito is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Norlito owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Norlito has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Norlito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Norlito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield.  Norlito is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Norlito from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma C. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Erma is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Erma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like detergents and biscuits. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, like detergents and biscuits

loans.name: Palo Herrado Group

texts.es:
el grupo Palo Herrado esta ubicado en la aldea palo herrado, lo integran 3 mujeres, muy amigas y con muchas ganas de superarse, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas relizan:
 
la joven Maria Teresa R. se dedica a la venta de comidas y golosinas, le vende sus comidas a mucho personal del SANAA (empresa gubernamental) y a Radio Paz, por la ubicación de estas empresas que estan cerca a su negocio estas personas visitan a diario su local. 
Maria se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para estar muy temprano en su local y asi satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, tortillas, refrescos, agua, jugos, vegetales, frijoles, arroz, embutidos etc.
 
la joven Cecilia O. se dedica a prestar los servicios de moler maiz, les brinda el servicio a la mayoria de personas de la aldea en donde vive ya que es el unico molino que se encuentra en su comunidad , todos los 
dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para cubrir con la demanda de las personas que necesitan de dicho servicio, Cecilia trabaja muy fuerte ya que su madre depende de ella.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para el molino.

la señora Santos A. es una mujer honrada y respònsable, que se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, su producto lo distribuye en su misma aldea donde vive, la demanda es bien grande y esto hace que su negocio tenga buenos ingresos, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para empezar la produccion de tortillas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal, agua.
texts.en:
The Palo Herrado group is located in the village of Palo Herrado.  The group has three female members who are good friends and have a great desire to improve themselves.  Their business activities are as follows:
 
Young Maria Teresa R. sells meals and candies.  She sells her meals to a large number of workers at SANAA (a government-run company) and Radio Paz.  As these companies are close to her business, these people visit her premises every day.  Maria gets up at 4 in the morning so that she can be in her business very early and meet her customers' needs.  She will use her loan to buy beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, soft drinks, water, juice, vegetables, beans, rice, sausages etc.

Young Cecilia O. offers corn grinding services to most of the people in her village since she owns the only mill in her community.  Every day, she gets up at 5 in the morning to meet the needs of the people who require her service.  Cecilia works very hard since her mother depends on her.  She will use her loan to buy spare parts for her mill.

Santos A. is a decent and responsible woman who makes and sells tortillas.  She distributes her products to people in her village.  Demand for her products is very high and this means that her business makes good profits.  She gets up very early every day to start making her tortillas.  She will use her loan to buy corn, firewood, lime and water.

loans.use: To buy pork, beef, chicken, rice, beans, tortillas, water, juice, sausages, soft drinks, firewood, corn and lime.  To buy spare parts for a mill: bands, sandpaper and disks

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to open another business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of cooking flour, cooking oil and soaps. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, cooking oil and soaps

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a 62-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a general store, a sugarcane plantation and a mini-pharmacy business.  She lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.  Felisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 25 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Felisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 19,800, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 26th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 to buy stock for her store and mini-pharmacy and fertilizers for her sugarcane plantation so that she can continue to save up for the future needs of her family. Felisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rosita Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosita del Carmen se dedica a la venta de comida. Tiene más 10 años con este negocio. Sus dos hijos están a su cargo, inicio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos necesarios. Ella siempre ha sido una persona luchadora y que disfruta de actividad, siempre ha sido responsable y goza de comunicarse con sus clientes que disfrutan de los diferentes platillos que elabora. Este crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, plátanos, maduro, azúcar, platos desechables, vasos y verduras.
texts.en: Rosita del Carmen's business is selling meals.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years and has two children in her care.  She started out in her business in order to cover her expenses.  Rosita has always been a determined person and she enjoys her business.  She has always been responsible and likes communicating with her customers who enjoy the different dishes that she prepares.  She will use this loan to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, bananas, plantain, sugar, disposable plates, glasses and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, bananas, plantain, sugar, disposable plates, glasses and vegetables

loans.name: Felix Arnaldo

texts.es:
Felix tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo dependiente. Viven en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande. Ésta es una zona agrícola que se encuentra en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Actualmente, no cuentan con servicios básicos como luz o agua potable.

Desde hace más de 15 años, Feliz se dedica a la crianza de ganado caprino y vacuno, el cual cría de edades menores y cuando los animales alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo, los vende en el mercado local. En adición, siembra y cosecha maíz que comercializa también en el mercado local. Realiza estas actividades en su parcela propia ubicada cerca de su casa. 

Desea invertir su crédito en alimentos balanceados para el engorde de su ganado. Espera lograr un buen peso y tamaño de sus animales para venderlos a un mejor precio y  seguir creciendo en su actividad. También, planea hacer unos arreglos a sus corrales para proteger su ganado de las fuertes lluvias que se avecinan. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Felix es muy trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar sus ingresos para lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Felix is 53 years old, married, and has one dependent child. He lives in his own home in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande. This farming district is located in Piura Province, which is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. At the moment, Felix and his family do not receive basic services such as electricity and potable water.

For more than fifteen years, Felix has been raising goats and cattle. He raises the animals from a young age and when they have reached the proper level of development, he sells them at the local market. In addition, he grows corn to sell at the market. These activities are conducted on a parcel of land that he owns and is located near his house.

Felix wants to invest this loan in balanced feed so that he can fatten his cattle. He hopes that his animals will reach a good weight and size so that he can sell them at a good price and continue growing his business. Felix also plans to make a few repairs to the animal pens in order to protect his livestock from the strong rains that are expected. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

Felix is a very hard worker. His greatest wish is to increase his income so that he can provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and pay for repairs to his animal pens.

loans.name: Roció Lizette

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Roció Lizette, le está haciendo falta reparar las paredes y pintarlas, además de colocar piso en el interior de la casa. 
Solicita un préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejorar y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de las reparaciones. 
Doña Roció Lizette es madre soltera ya que quedó viuda  y  tiene tres hijo de mediana edad, bajo su responsabilidad a quienes les quiere dar un patrimonio seguro y una mejor vida.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo y que los gastos de su familia los cubrirá con la pensión que recibe.
texts.en:
Roció Lizette's home needs some walls repairing and painting.  It also needs flooring to be laid inside.  Roció Lizette is requesting a loan since she doesn't currently have the money she needs to make these improvements and pay the workman who will carry out the repairs.  

Roció Lizette is a single mother as she is widowed.  She has three children in her care who she would like to provide with a safe patrimony and a better life.  She plans to repay her loan with the income that she makes from her job.  She will cover her family expenses with the pension that she receives.

loans.use: to carry out some work inside her home

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelida; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de vestidos y ternos, ella vende vestidos y ternos en alquiler, ella tiene una tienda desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de vestidos y ternos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar vestidos y ternos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelida belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Angeles” (The Angels) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old, single, and has one child. Nelida divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling dresses and suits from a rented location. She manages her shop from 9am to 9pm. This business enables her to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand her dress and suit business, so she is requesting a loan to buy these items in bulk.

Nelida is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase dresses and suits in bulk.

loans.name: Dos De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DOS DE FEBRERO” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Fanny. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de enaguas, mercadería de golosinas, costura de deportivos, negocio de papa, tienda de barrio, venta de CD’s veta de comida.

La señora Fanny,  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas por mayor, que inicio conjuntamente su esposo. Nos cuenta que un día estaban paseando por la Ceja y decidieron comprar golosinas y poco a poco fue aumentando su negocio; ahora lo reparten por mayor y pedido.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (de golosinas), que compraran por mayor de la ceja y los venderán todos los días por las mañanas y por las tardes con la ayuda de su esposo.. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud.
texts.en:
The “Dos de Febrero” (February 2) communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Center.  It has 10 members and is led by a governing board headed by Fanny.  The businesses the members carry out are varied.  Among them are: dressmaking, snack sales, sportswear making, potato sales, neighborhood store, CD sales and food sales.

Fanny indicates that this is the first cycle she’s worked with Pro Mujer; a girl friend invited her to join.  She currently has a wholesale snack sales business that she started with her husband.  She tells us that one day they were passing through Ceja and decided to buy snacks gradually increasing their business.  Now, they sell wholesale and on order.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital (snacks) that they will buy at wholesale in Ceja and then sell very day during the morning and afternoon with her husband.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family in whatever way is possible; she is married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy snacks.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret, a 30-year-old widowed mother of seven children, all of them attending school, sells clothes. Margret has requested a loan to stock more clothes to sell and hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
Bahrom is a hardworking man. He is married and has one daughter. His wife is a housewife and she always supports her husband. Bahrom produces  ice-cream at home. He has several freezers for production of ice-cream. He delivers ice-cream to markets for selling. He started his business with the service of playing on computers. He has 10 sets of computers for playing and for providing computer services for his clients. Bahrom would like to get a loan of 6,500 Somoni for purchasing five sets of tables and four freezers to expand his businesses. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy five sets of tables and four freezers

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana mujer emprendedora, casada, sus proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa poco a poco, cambiando parte por parte de la casa que están en mala condiciones. Siendo su esposo persona de edad ella es la que aporta la mayor parte económica de los gasto del hogar trabaja como cocinera desde hace unos años. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloque, piedra cantera, hierro para la construcción de la pared lateral de la casa. Obteniendo seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is an enterprising woman. She is married and has plans to improve the infrastructure of her home a little bit at a time. Juana will replace the parts of her house that are in bad condition a piece at a time. Since her husband is elderly, she has the major responsibility of providing for the household expenses. Juana has worked as a cook for the past few years.

With this loan, she will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, blocks, quarry stone, and iron for building a wall to the side of her house. This will give her family security.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a security wall to the side of her house.

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en:
Truphena is 61 years old and a mother five children ages 25, 23, 21,19 and 15 years old. She keeps dairy cows in their farm and has been in operation for a period of 10 years making a monthly income of KES. 6,000.

She has requested a loan from KADET LTD of KES. 30,000. This is her third loan and she hopes to use this amount to purchase a dairy cow.  The profits will be used to educate her children and also improve the farming activity.

Her dream is to live a bright future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas tiene 45 años y tiene cuatro hijas, ella nació en la ciudad de Echarate provincia de la Convención (Cusco, Perú), vive en la comunidad de Chogona a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Quillabamba. Ella se dedica al cultivo de cafe, cacao y frutas. Ella también se dedica a la venta de comida. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. (Quillabamba es ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.)
texts.en:
Felicitas, 45, has 4 children. She was born in the city of Echarate in the province of Convencion (Cusco, Peru). She lives in Chogonga, 45 minutes from the city of Quillabamba. She grows cafe, cacao and fruit. She also sells food. On this occasion she needs a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, noodles and other things. 

Quillabamba is the provincial capital of La Convencion and is an important commercial center for the valleys of Lares and La Convencion. The primary activities there are chocolate, coffee, cacao and fruits.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, noodles and other things.

loans.name: Mycel

texts.en:
Mycel is a determined individual who aims to become a successful entrepreneur in the future. She is now 34 years old and has no children since she is separated from her husband due to family conflicts. She lives with her parents and she helps them to earn a living. Rice farming is the main source of her income. Therefore, Mycel is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 from Kiva lenders to pay for land preparation and to purchase seedlings to grow on her farm. She has been in this business for almost 12 years, earning PHP 30,000 per cropping. 

In the future, Mycel hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn a higher income to have more savings to start another source of income. She is thankful that ASKI and Kiva lenders offer financial assistance to improve their business and gain more profits.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and to purchase seedlings

location.town: Brgy. Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en:
Hamadi is a married man with three children, aged 10 yrs, 6 yrs and a year old. Two of his children attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a fuel (diesel and petrol) selling business, selling retail to car operators and motorcycle operators. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting fuel to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding his business to sell wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase fuel for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for resale.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.
 
Linda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks like breads and beverages like fruit juices . She has had this business for 3 years and has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, like  breads  and beverages like fruit juices intended for selling.

Linda became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks like breads, and beverages like fruit juices to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is divorced and has two adult children who live separately. She sells clothing at the central market in Zaporozhye city. Maria has been in this business for 13 years. During this time she has established two business locations, many repeat clients and has a large sales experience. 

Maria enjoys her business and wants to develop it further. Maria would like to borrow 15,000 Gryvnas. The loan will help her to purchase winter goods and coats at good price. Since this business is the only source of income for Maria, she wants to minimize the expenses and maximize her net income.

loans.use: to purchase winter coats at good price

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con educación secundaria.
Desde hace un ciclo trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales como ovejas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles,  comprará tres unidades de ovejas, la señora cuenta que las compra y vende al instante, buscando siempre una ganancia.  Ella trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja como obrero.
La señora desea tener más ganados y así mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of “Central Vaquería”, a Communal Bank of Vaquería, a neighborhood located in Ilave, a district of the El Collao province in the Puno department. She is 27 years old, she lives with her life partner and she has a child. She has a secondary level education.
She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one cycle already. She buys and sells animals such as sheep, and she has invested her previous loan of 500.00 PEN in her activity.
She is requesting a new loan of 500.00 PEN, and she will invest it in the purchase of three sheep. She says she buys them and she sells them immediately, always making a profit. She runs her activity alone, as her husband is a worker.
She would like to have more animals to sell in order to increase her earnings.
What she likes about her Communal Bank is the easy access to the loans.

loans.use: To buy three heads of sheep

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ricardo nació en la ciudad del Cusco en el departamento del Cusco y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Salvación de la provincia de Manu del departamento de Madre de Dios.     

El señor Juan Ricardo es un padre trabajador que saca adelante a su familia y trabaja en el Gobierno de la Provincia de Madre de Dios de la ciudad de Salvación como jefe de la unidad de personal y en sus horas libres se dedica a brindar servicio mecánico. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Juan Ricardo requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para implementar su pequeño taller mecánico. 

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación.
