La selva de Madre de Dios guarda en su fondo muchas riquezas naturales. Los bosques de Madre de Dios son pródigos en entregar singular belleza. En los bosques grandes y misteriosos de Madre de Dios la caza es abundante. La selva de Madre de Dios es cortada por majestuosos ríos sobre los que se puede navegar en canoas o lanchas.
texts.en:
Juan Ricardo was born in the city of Cusco in the Cusco department.  He currently lives in the city of Salvación, Manu province, Madre de Dios department.

Juan Ricardo is a hard-working father who gets his family ahead.  He works as the head of the personnel unit for the government of Madre de Dios in the city of Salvación.  In his free time he works as a mechanic.  He has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for him.  Juan Ricardo now needs a loan to buy materials to set up a small mechanic’s shop.

The “Nueva Generación” (New Generation) communal bank meets once a month in the city of Salvación.  

The Madre de Dios jungle has a lot of natural resources at its core.  The Madre de Dios forests are lavish in presenting extraordinary beauty.  Hunting is abundant in the large and mysterious jungles in Madre de Dios.  Majestic rivers, which one is able to navigate in canoes or small boats, cut through the Madre de Dios jungle.

loans.use: to buy materials like brakes, pistons, and others.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is married and her husband is 41 years of age. She is the mother of two daughters. All of them, including Rukhsana, her children, and her husband operate a paper envelope making business. This is their family business and they have been operating it for the past 15 years. 
Her husband collects orders from different shops and Rukhsana and her family complete them on time. 
These days, her husband has a large number of orders to fulfill, and he needs money for buying paper and glue in bulk quantity. That’s why Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. Rukhsana is very hopeful that her family business will be improved a lot after investing the loan into it. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Rukhsana.

loans.use: To buy paper and glue for paper envelope making & selling business

loans.name: Maredel

texts.en:
Maredel, age 39, is married with two children. She resides in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Maredel farms her own rice fields to make a living.  She has been this business for more than 15 years. Each month she earns Php 35,000.00. doing this type of work. Maredel has requested a loan amount of Php 50,000.00 which will be to used buy more seedlings and fertilizers for the next planting. 

Maredel has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year and this is her first loan. Maredel's future plan is for the education of her two children until  college and for their daily needs everyday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Ruth Mercedes

texts.es: Ruth Mercedes tiene 37 años su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio. Ruth es responsable, puntual y a manejar su negocio. Agradece esta oportunidad que se le está otorgando porque gracias a los préstamos que le otorgaron ha podido incrementar su inventario. Así mejorar su negocio, ahora ella trabaja juntamente con su hijo que la apoya. El préstamo que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general y sabanas.
texts.en: Ruth Mercedes is 37 years old and sells general merchandise. She has had this business for more than 7 years. Ruth is responsible and punctual and manages her business. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given as thanks to the loans granted she has been able to expand her inventory and so improve her business. She now works together with her child who is helping her. The loan she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of footwear, cosmetics, clothes in general and sheets.

loans.use: to buy footwear, cosmetics, clothes in general and sheets.

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka is 27 years old, married to Tabitha, and has one child. For the last two years he has done decoration, painting, and drawing, and sold African curios. He makes an income of 15,000 KES per month.
Baraka had never borrowed from any other microfinance institution (MFI) before he took his first loan with Kiva partner KADET. He has applied for his second loan after successfully repaying his previous loan well and in good time. He plans to buy paints and curios for resale. With his anticipated profits, Baraka plans to support his family, grow his business, and become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy paints and curios for resale.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en: Jean Pierre is 26 years old and single. He runs a hair salon which he has owned for two years. He would like a loan to buy more razors for his salon.  Jean Pierre would like to use any profits to build a house and create savings. He hopes to see his business expand and prosper.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment for use in his salon.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”REYNITA DE BELEN DE CCORAO;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Hermelinda;  La socia tiene 24 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 1 hijo; de 4 año; La socia tiene un par de automóviles los cuales los hace trabajar con su conyugue y el otro lo alquila para prestar el servicio de taxi, la socia  requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de repuestos para uno de los automóviles y el mantenimientos de ambos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento y compra de repuestos para uno de los automóviles.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Reynita de Belen de Ccorao communal bank.  The bank is located in the Ccorao district, Calca province, Cusco department.  Hermelinda is 24 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  She has one child, a four year old son.

She has a pair of cars.  She and her husband work with one of the cars, and they rent the other one out for taxi service.  She needs the loan to buy replacement parts for one of the cars and for maintenance on both of them.  Hermelinda is requesting the loan for maintenance and to buy replacement parts for one of the cars.

She is grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for one car and for maintenance of both of them.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married to a driver and has one child. She sells maize at Brasi near Abura. She adds her income to that of her husband’s to pay utility bills. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase additional bags of maize for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old, and has two children who are in school.  Alona has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Alona has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Alona would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients.

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.en: Crecencia, a 57-year-old married mother of four children, lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Crecencia used her last loan to purchase more crabs to sell. But now, she's operating another business in nipa hut making (materials from the nipa palm). She's taking a new loan to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. Crecencia hopes to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace Osakpaumwan is 47 years old, married with three (3) children. She got the experience of her business from her mother and she started her own in 1985. The above amount is to help her improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more provision and drinks for sale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Madame D. is a licensed chemist in her community. She has customers to attend to almost every minute but she has no capital to buy drugs to stock her shop. She is unable to provide some drugs requested by customers. She is seeking a Kiva loan of $1100.00 to enable her to purchase drugs for her shop.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his Farming Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Supriyati

texts.id:
Supriyati is a seamstress. Her husband works in a motorcycle repair shop, however his earnings is not sufficient to cover all of their family expenses. So Supriyati works as a seamstress to help her husband support the family. She needs $50 funds to purchase supplies like cloth, threads, button, yarn, etc. On a 9 am to 5 pm workday, she can work on 2 pieces of clothing and earn $8 profit that is used to supplement their family income. Most of her money is used to buy milk for her 1 year old infant child. During the Moslem's holiday season, Supriyati feels blessed because usually she gets many more orders than usual, considering that on some regular days she doesn't get any orders at all.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Supriyati adalah seorang penjahit pakaian. Suaminya bekerja di bengkel sepeda motor. Namun hasilnya tidak mencukupi biaya hidupnya sehari-hari. Oleh sebab itu Supriyati membantunya dengan bekerja sebagai penjahit pakaian. Dengan modal Rp. 500.000,- untuk membeli kain, benang, jarum, dan sebagainya, dan mulai menjahit dari jam 09.00 sampai jam 17.00 dan dapat menyelesaikan 2 potong baju.Dari 2 potong baju yang diselesaikan Supriyati mendapat keuntungan Rp. 80.000,- yang dipakai untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari dan membeli susu untuk anaknya yang masih berumur 1 tahun. Setiap kali hari raya datang itu merupakan berkah tersendiri buat Supriyati karena secara otomattis orderan jahitan bertambah banyak, berbeda dengan hari-hari biasa terkadang tidak ada orderan jahitan.

loans.use: To Purchase Supplies Like Buttons, Thread, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose P. is a 46 year old widow who lives with her three children in Rongo, Kenya. Rose trained as a nurse in the year 1986. After her training she worked with the government  for 8 years. She opened her own clinic in 1994 in Rongo town .She offers general curative services, family planning, counseling, and maternal and child health care services, and also has integrated a pharmacy and laboratory. Rose attributes her success to hard work, perseverance and assistance from KMET’s microfinance loan.  She has been able to renovate her facility, purchase stock of drugs and improves the quality of care she provides.  Rose plans to purchase stock drugs for her pharmacy, move the facility to a more spacious place with the US $1200 she is applying for.

loans.use: Purchase stock of drugs for her community pharmacy and pay rent for a more spacious place.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Frocks and socks plus Lee’s and tees, Rehema’s clothing stall is a colourful and interesting place. She established the business in 2006 and requires a loan of $425 to expand her business by purchasing additional stock at wholesale rates. Rehema is a single mother and hopes to increase her profits in order to support her two children, Kassiba and Anze.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback arrangement as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are therefore termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing stocks.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: Florence is 45 years old. Her current business is poultry farming. She plans to use the loan to buy corrugated iron sheeting for a poultry house, which is under comstruction.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for a chicken coop

loans.name: Carmen Del Pilar

texts.es:
Carmen has a business selling fish and various other products. She got the idea for this business a year ago, when she saw a need in her neighborhood. Now she has become one of the main providers of fish in her area, converting a space especially for the business, and stocking it with popular vegetables as well. She starts early in the mornings and buys the fish wholesale. Thanks to this work, she is improving the economic situation for her family. Carmen has 5 children, but one of them is already independent, so Carmen works to take care of and educate the others. She is requesting a loan to expand her work space and increase the quantity and variety of the products she offers. This hardworking mother needs your support to continue improving the quality of life for her family.

Carmen, es una microempresaria de carne de pescado y helados de crema. La idea de involucrarse le surgió hace un año cuando vio que las vecinas de su barrio necesitaban comprar en una zona cercana el pescado; ahora ella se ha convertido en una de las proveedoras de carne de pescado de su barrio en un espacio de ventas que acondicionó para este fin y a la cual inteligentemente ha surtido de verduras de preferencia sale en las mañanas y muy temprano se dirige a los camiones de reparto de carne de pescado para comprar al por mayor. Gracias a esta actividad puede ser no solo la proveedora de carne de pescado en su barrio sino también una de las proveedoras de recursos para mejorar la economía de su hogar, ella es madre de cinco hijos pero uno de ellos ya puede sostenerse por si solo; ahora trabaja para poder cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos.Carmen quiere ampliar su espacio de ventas e incrementar la cantidad y variedad de artículos de primera necesidad que ofrece, con este fin solicita un préstamo. Recuerda que una mujer responsable es una madre que lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos y en este caso Carmen necesita de tu apoyo para seguir haciéndolo.

loans.use: TO INCREASE HER WORK SPACE AND PURCHASE A GREATER QUANTITY AND VARIETY OF PRODUCTS TO SELL.

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Luong Thi T., 37 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2003. Besides farming, her family also makes sedge mats. Her products has good quality so everything that is produced is sold out pretty quickly. There are also many customers who sign contracts with her. Since Mrs. T. became a member of TYM Fund, she has an extra source of fund to buy sedge, so as she can satisfy the demand. Mrs. T.'s children are still in school; all of them are in good care. This loan cycle, Mrs. T. would love to borrow 400USD to buy sedge. Right now, selling sedge mats brings her family an income of 150USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lương Thị Thảo, 37 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003. Gia đình nhà chị ngoài làm ruộng còn có nghề phụ làm chiếu. Sản phẩm của nhà chị Thảo rất có uy tín làm đến đâu xuất hết đến đó. Bên cạnh đó cũng có rất nhiều khách đến đặt hàng. Từ khi tham gia vào Quỹ, chị đã có thêm nguồn vốn để mua thêm đay, cói nên sản xuất ngày càng thuận tiện, đáp ứng được nhu cầu của khách hàng. Các con chị đang trong độ tuổi đi học, đều được quan tâm chăm sóc. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 400USD mua đay, cói. Thu nhập từ nghề làm chiếu của gia đình là 150USD/tháng

loans.use: Buy sedge to make sedge mat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy material to improve school uniforms

loans.name: Mwanaidi's Bustani Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 37 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 5 years old. Mwanaidi owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Mwanaidi has taken out and successfully repaid two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Zena, Elizabeth, and Zaina, who sell cosmetics and food and operate a kiosk.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Ismatoi

texts.en: Ismatoi R. was born in 1979 in the Asht region of Tajikistan where she still lives today. She is married and has a child. Her husband is in the Russian Federation, so she is raising her child herself. She is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work to ensure her child a good future. She works at the school but the family income depends on their livestock business. Mrs. R. has10 years’ experience in the livestock business. She has a cow and some rams and she dreams of purchasing one more milk cow to start a business selling and producing milk. So she is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $825.00 US to purchase a milk cow..

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Epi

texts.en: Epi P., 35, is married with three children. She has 5 years of experience in the handicrafts business and her husband helps her. She sells to the village and general public 2 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~$250 USD). SPBD loans are Epi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Epi's earnings will be used to improve her business and help out with her family's expenses.

loans.use: Epi would like to upgrade her crafts business and help repair her house, as well as pay for her kids' school fees.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 45 years old, married, and has 7 children, all between 15 and 30 years old. She became a handbag seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$25.

In the past, Asha has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for another loan to expand it even further by buying more handbags for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of hangbags for sale

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela is mother of 7 children, all of whom are now independent and are the reason why she is working so hard to make something of herself now. She has been selling cold drinks (beer and fizzy drinks) for 6 years. Her business has made her feel useful again, given that she has always been so busy being an active mother. She has sold a variety of products ever since she was a much younger girl and it makes her very happy to now have her own business. Furthermore, she is owner of a tuk-tuk (motocarro), which is run by her partner. She sells cold drinks all day and enjoys her job and the satisfaction of generating an income. With the money she is requesting, she hopes to build a kiosk and offer a greater range of drinks, given that she has so many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Ángela es madre de 7 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes y son quienes la incentivan a seguir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas), desde hace 6 años. Su negocio la hace sentir una persona útil, ya que siempre se identifica como una mujer activa. Anteriormente, y desde muy joven se dedicó a la venta de distintos productos, ahora se siente muy feliz al tener un negocio propio. Además es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que es manejado por su conviviente, la venta de sus bebidas heladas la realiza todo el día, le gusta de su trabajo y la satisfacción de ver sus ingresos diarios. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a construir un kiosco e implementarse de más bebidas, ya que tiene muchos clientes.

loans.use: To increase the amount of drinks she sells and build a kiosk for her business.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe inició el negocio por la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia ya que el desea darle a sus hijos estudio para que se superen y en un futuro tenga un buen trabajo y una mejor calidad de vida. Empezó vendiendo huevo, leche y tortillas y poco a poco ha ido incrementando los productos de la tiendita.

El necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 4 meses para la inversión de mas productos para que sus clientes le sigan comprando los productos que el ofrece.
texts.en:
Guadalupe started his business because of the need to help his family get ahead. He wishes to provide his children with an education so that they can better themselves, get a good job, and have a better quality of life. Guadalupe started out selling eggs, milk, and tortillas, but little by little, he has been filling his little shop with more products.

He needs a loan of $325.00 USD, which will be repaid in 4 months, in order to invest it in purchasing more products so that her customers can keep buying the goods that he offers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 54, is married and lives with her husband and one child in the Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works together with her husband, Tom Vun, 60, in a rice field and also sells fish at the market to earn a living. She is able to make US$2 each day. She says her farming is just to support her family members and she never sells rice for extra profit. Farming is hard and makes less output now because the weather conditions are bad. The price of fertilizers has increased by double over the past year. Most of the farmers cannot afford the high price of fertilizers. Bun S. would like to take out a loan of US$200 to build a cage for her cow and to purchase fishing nets for her husband to catch more fish.

loans.use: To build a cage for her cow and to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Гаюрова Анзурат жительница Гисарского района. Замужем , имеет одного ребенк. Возрас 35 лет. Уже пять лет занимается торговлей детской одежды. Товар привозит из города Душанбе. Продает  по очень низким ценам , поэтому у нее очень много клиентов. Планирует увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Торговая точка на которой она работает арендуемая .После получения кредит , если дела развернуться она планирует купить собственное место.
texts.en:
Nazokat G. lives in the Gissar District. She is married and has one child. She is 35 years old. For the past five years she has been selling children's clothing. The goods are transported from the city of Dushanbe. She has many customers because she sells at such low prices. She decided to use a loan to increase sales. The loan will be repaid over 12 months. She currently rents her market stall, but if the business develops well after she receives the loan, she plans to buy her own space.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Rolan

texts.en:
Rolan L., a 25-year-old, lives in Binarzang Quirino, Isabela with his parents. He believes that there is cooperation between leaders and its constituents to work for the development of their community. Moreover, he said that there is a systematic way of living since most of the residents in the community are involved in farming.

“Patience is the key to success," is a phrase Rolan always puts in mind to be motivated to work harder in order to be successful in life. 

He operates a passenger tricycle in their village and through this, Rolan is able to earn an average daily income of PHP 200. Since, he wants to have another business aside from operating a tricycle, Rolan would like a loan of at least PHP 4,000 to purchase at least two piglets to start a hog raising business. With that, he can have an additional income after three to four months. He plans to use the profit to improve his business until he gets married and has his own family. Rolan will then have enough earnings and a stable business to support them. 

“But before that, I still want to enroll in a vocational course (electrician) to widen my knowledge because I don’t want to be a tricycle driver forever,” Rolan said.

loans.use: Buy piglets to start a hog raising business

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is a member of the Nueva Vida (“New Life”) Village Bank. Modesta is 45 years old and lives with her common-law husband and five children. Modesta has a stand in the Basilio Auqui Market, where she sells fruit, both in bulk and by the kilo. She works every day, and her daughter helps her run the stand. Modesta needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy bananas.  Modesta dreams that her children will finish their studies and of launching additional businesses. 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Modesta es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida. 
Modesta es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Modesta tiene un puesto en el mercado Basilio Auqui en donde vende frutas al por mayor y menor, actividad que realiza todos los dias con la ayuda de su hija. 
Modesta necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátanos. 
Los sueños de Modesta son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, implementar otros negocios.

loans.use: Buy bananas

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthorn M. lives in the Chhoer Teal Phlos village in Takeo province. She is 33 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. She is pig breeder, and her husband, Mr. Sor Chea, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to purchase a pump machine, fuel, fertilizer, and pesticides to support the field. Thus, Mrs. Chanthorn M. decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s plantation. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy pump machine, fuel, fertilizer, and pesticides to support the field.

loans.name: Oscar William

texts.es: El señor Oscar William L. habita en el Kilómetro. 16 carretera hacia ticuantepe junto a su esposa y hijos, el es comerciante de lácteos, la esposa trabaja como domestica en una casa privada para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones del negocio para obtener mejores ganancia. Los sueños del Sr. Oscar es llegar ser distribuidor de la empresa de Parmalat. El solicito un financiamiento  para poder comprar más productos ya que tiene una demanda y a la vez la entrega en pulperías cercanas.
texts.en:
Señor Oscar William L. lives with his wife and children at kilometre 16 on the Ticuantepe highway. He sells dairy products, and his wife works as a maid in a private house to help with their household expenses. Sr. Oscar’s plan is to improve his business and thus earn more money for his family. His dream is to become a distributor for the company Parmalat. He is asking for a loan to buy more products that are in demand, and as well, deliver them to nearby stores.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products such as cheese, cream, milk etc.

loans.name: Reyna Lorena

texts.es: La Señora Reyna Lorena Q. López tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Reyna tiene 5 hijos todos sus hijos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Reyna es una pulpería. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio y ha logrado extenderse por los financiamientos y anteriormente ofrecía productos como pan, refrescos naturales y golosinas. Es por eso que los propósitos de Doña Reyna son de mantener activo su negocio y así proporcionarle a su familia ingresos. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y comprar productos como granos básicos, golosinas y productos de consumo diario. Los sueños de Doña Reyna son de seguir luchando en la vida para darle a su familia todo lo necesario. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 22.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna Lorena Q. López is 45 years old and married. Mrs. Reyna has 5 children, all of whom study. Mrs. Reyna has run a local store for more than 17 years and has managed to expand her business through financing. Previously she offered products such as bread, natural beverages and candies. Mrs. Reyna’s intentions are to maintain her store and in turn provide her family with income. Her reason for the loan is to purchase working capital to satisfy the demand of her customers and buy products like basic grains, candies and everyday products. The dreams of Mrs. Reyna are to continue fighting in life to give her family all that it needs. The quantity that she solicits is C$ 22.000 córdobas.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Horolgarav

texts.en:
Horolgarav S. is 43, married and has two sons. Her family lives in a ger (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her eldest son married and lives apart from his parents. The youngest son, Ganbayar, is 19 and is attending high school. Horolgarav's family proudly owns the plot of land where they live.

Together with her husband Batmunh, Horolgarav has been running a butcher stall at the local market. In 1996 they bought and opened their first butcher stall at the market, giving them 13 years of experience in the industry. Both she and her husband are well respected by their community and have many repeat customers. At the start, their business working capital was 200,000 tugrik (roughly $US140). Because of Horolgarav's 13 years of hard work, her inventory has increased to 2,500,000 tugrik.

With this loan Horolgarav will buy more sheep and cows from local herders. She is planning to buy another stall soon to expand her family business.

loans.use: To buy sheep and cows from local herders.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer de 31 años, vive con su pequeño hijo de manera independiente en la casa de sus padres, y lo que más desea es salir adelante para poder brindarles una vejez tranquila a sus progenitores. Para Maria su tienda de abarrotes es un negocio muy rentable, ya que son varios los clientes que concurren a su tienda a comprar lo que necesitan, trabaja desde muy temprano y se queda prácticamente todo el día dentro de su negocio, puesto que sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizar las tareas del hogar al mismo tiempo que atiende su negocio, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir a la calle. Para más adelante espera mejorar su tienda y convertirla en una de las más grandes de su barrio y así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el segundo préstamo de Maria con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más activas. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old, financially independent, and lives with her young son in her parents' home. More than anything, she wants to get ahead economically so that she can provide her parents a peaceful old age.

For five years, Maria has had a small grocery store. Her store is very profitable, as she has many regular customers who come to her to purchase what they need. She works from the very early morning hours and stays at the store almost all day, as she knows she must work hard to achieve her goals. What she likes most about her job is that she can accomplish household tasks at the same time that she tends the store. What she likes least is that she has to stay in the store all day and cannot go outside. In the future, Maria would like to make improvements to her store and to develop it into one of the biggest in her neighborhood. In this way, she will be able to increase her income.

This is Maria's second loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she understands the importance of making her payments on time, as she would like to be eligible for more loans in the future. She is one of the most active members of her community bank. She will invest the 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles from this loan in the purchase of more merchandise to improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more mercandise

loans.name: Soraida Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Soraida Sánchez tiene 37 años, habitante del Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, casada tiene cinco hijos, su esposo le ayuda se desempeña como camionero, su hijo mayor le ayuda también. Los planes es terminar de construir su vivienda. Tiene una pequeña pulpería donde vende granos básicos y otros productos. Inicio vendiendo leñas, frutas y verduras. El fin del préstamo en Afodenic es para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación para esto comprara  los siguientes materiales: cemento, hierro, bloques, perlines y otros materiales que va  utilizar ante que venga la lluvia ya que se necesita para brindar mejor comodidad y protección a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Soraida Sanchez is 37 years old and lives in Sandino Memorial in the city of Managua. She is married with five children. She helps her husband who works as a lorry driver; her eldest son also helps. The plan is to finish building their house. She has a small shop where she sells basic grains and other products. She has begun selling firewood, fruit and vegetables. The aim of the loan from Afodenic is to build a room in the house, for which the following materials will be bought: cement, iron, blocks, rafters and other materials that will be used before the rains come as she needs to provide better comfort and protection for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana and her husband George L. live harmoniously with their seven children in a rural community of Barangay Abinganan Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. According to them, “Kung may pagsisikap may magandang kinabukasan” ("when you persevere, there will be a good future"), has served as the guiding principle for their marriage. With some difficulty, they have been able to continue sending their children to school so they may have a good education and eventually a good job. 

Juliana is a vendor in their village. She is hoping to borrow PHP 6,000 as additional business capital. She hopes to generate a higher income by stocking more products, which she can purchase with the loan. She also hopes that her business will be successful so that she can provide more for her family.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Degoo De Carabane Group

texts.fr:
Nous sommes un groupe de jeunes femmes, accompagnées d'un homme, qui travaillent dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires, d'ustensiles de cuisine, et la transformation de produits halieutiques pêchés dans notre écovillage. Nous sommes constitués en groupe qui fait chacune une activité différente de l'autre. Le prêt va nous servir chacun dans son domaine de travailler et de créer  des revenus qui va nous aider à subvenir aux besoins de nos familles et à payer la scolarité et les soins de nos enfants.
Nous habitons une zone enclavée où nous n'avons pas la possibilité d'accéder aux crédits conventionnels. C'est pour cette raison que nous sommes venus solliciter Kiva pour l'octroi d'un prêt afin que nous puissions travailler comme beaucoup de nos sœurs.
texts.en:
We are a group of young women, along with a man, who are working in the commerce of food items, kitchen utensils, and the processing of seafood harvested from our eco-village. We compose one group in which each of us has a business that is different from the next. Each of us will use the loan in our respective domains to work and create revenues, which are going to help us to provide for our families and to pay for the schooling and the care of our children. We live in an isolated area where we lack access to conventional loans. For this reason, we've come to requesting the granting of a loan from Kiva, so that we may work, as do many of our sisters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils, seafood products, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Joseline's Group

texts.en:
N. Joseline is a hard-working and principled mother, divorced with 5 children aged 16 – 6 years, in primary and secondary schools. Joseline has a general merchandise shop where she sells mostly home-use and home-consumption commodities in Butatare trading centre in Bushenyi. It is a big market area and she is able to make a weekly profit of 100,000/=. She has a business experience of 6 years and her good customer care has kept her business intact.

Joseline has a hope of opening up another shop in Mbarara to grow her business as well as seeing all her children educated up to university level. This is her 4th loan with the group and she needs this loan to help purchase more merchandise for sale in her shop since all her loans have been helping in increasing her capital.

loans.use: Buying more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
el sr. JOSE MANUEL ORDOÑEZ FLORES de dedica a la venta de verduras, cuenta con un negocio que esta ubicado en el Barrio Pueblo Nuevo de la ciudad de Danli, vende al por mayor y menor, cabe destacar que con el esfuerzo diario que el hace a logrado salir adelante y poder generar mas ingresos para su negocio y su familia, mejorando asi su nivel de vida.
Don Jose es casado y tiene el apoyo de su esposa,  tienen una buena clientela porque su negocio 
luce muy surtido y lo mantienen muy higienco.
gracias a este negocio a podido manejar bien sus ingresos de capital y adquirir una mejor fuente de desarollo para su vida. el tiene 48 años de edad.
en estos momentos en necesita el credito para poder comprar mas verduras.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel O. Flores sells vegetables. He has a store located in the Pueblo Nuevo neighborhood in the city of Danli, and he sells wholesale and retail. He stands out because his daily efforts have caused him to succeed and generate a higher income for his business and his family, improving their quality of life.

Jose is married and has the support of his wife. They have a good clientele because their store has a good assortment, and they keep it very clean. Thanks to this business, he has been able to increase his income and create a better source of development for his life. He is 48 years old.

At this time, he needs a loan to be able to buy more vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a member of the Idunda East borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 21 and 17 years.

 Rhoda started her own grocery business selling soft drinks like soda,beer 17 years ago,she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 260,000 Tsh.

 This is Rhoda first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more drinks.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Rhoda hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Evelyn is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting cassava for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: La Orquidia 1 Group

texts.en:
Patria C. ia an associate with Esperanza International who has successfully completed three loan cycles and is currently starting her fourth as the group coordinator of her Bank of Hope. Patria lives in Los Alcarrizos, an area north of Santo Domingo, where running water and electricty are unreliable. She lives in a wooden house with a tin roof, with her husband and two young children. 

Patria sells clothing in the street and also owns a small restaurant where she sells food to the community. She is planning to use this loan to buy more sweaters, pants, shirts, sheets, and other clothing merchandise. With her increased income, she is hoping to be able to buy her own house to have more space and security for her family. Her dream for the future is to expand her restaurant and have her kids grow up well educated and with a promising future. She would like to thank all of the donors for helping her to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To purchase clothing merchandise

loans.name: Mohubbat

texts.en: Mohubbat lives in Baku city. He was born in 1955. He has been in the cattle-breeding business for 10 years. He is married, has 4 children. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 calves to improve his cattle-breeding business.

loans.use: to buy 5 calves

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 33 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is engaged in a hog-raising business. She is 57 years of age and single. She has been blessed with one child. Maria Eleonor, 16 years old, is now a high school graduate. As father and mother to her only child, Milagros is doing everything she can to sustain her needs. Milagros is praying and hoping that she can provide for all their needs through the income that she generates from her hog-raising business. Milagros would like to ask for additional capital from the KIVA lenders for the maintenance of her pigs. In this regard, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan amount will be utilized to buy feed for the pigs. She hopes that her loan request will be granted.

loans.use: additional capital to buy feed for pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Mrs. Maria S. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old, is married, and is blessed with five adult children. Maria owns and operates a specialized retail store selling dried goods and grocery items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than seven years, earning Php 6,000 monthly net income. In 2000, Maria joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 12th loan in the amount of Php 50,000 which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Аhhoyan

texts.en:
Ahhoyon R. is 57 yeas old and lives with her husband and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Her oldest daughter is 20 years old and goes to a local university and the other three children are all high school students.

Ahhoyon has been active in her meat retail business since 2002, selling mutton and beef at the local market with her husband. She mostly purchases cattle and sheep carcasses from herder families in the countryside at discount and then sells them in small pieces at the local food market. As she has been in the business for quite some time, she has got a number of customers who always purchase meat from her.

Ahhoyon says that she would like to expand her business as much as possible. She requests a loan to purchase more mutton and beef for her business.


About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
 To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
 To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more mutton and beef

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 28-year-old married father of two. He operates a bread distribution business in Nairobi’s country bus station and a retail shop in the same location. He describes his business environment as stable and employs three people.

Amos has requested a loan of Kes 60,000 to add to his stock of bread for distribution. He hopes to buy a pick-up truck for bread distribution and to own a wholesale shop. He describes himself as hardworking, faithful and customer friendly.

loans.use: To add to his stock of bread

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Placida, elabora mantas, polleras y centros para polleras, trabaja a pedido.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en villa concepción de la zona de Bolognia de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, Forro, Hilos y otros).
Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito ya que se gano la confianza financiera.
texts.en:
Placida makes shawls,”polleras” (a traditional long skirt worn by women in some regions of Bolivia), and pollera underskirts. She works by order. Her home is located in the Villa Concepción area of Bolognia in the city of La Paz. The loan is to buy raw material (fabric, lining, thread, and others). This is the fourth time she has asked for a loan with Impro. Her history qualifies her as client 1, which means good completion of her payments. This allows her to access this loan because she has won the confidence of the financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
Magali tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el caserío Punto Cuatro del distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola, al igual que la mayoría de hombres de la zona, y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Por ello empezó un negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos. Ella cría sus animales frente a su domicilio para luego venderlos a los comerciantes que eventualmente visitan el lugar en donde vive.

Magali de sea adquirir alimento balanceado para cerdos, ya que una de sus cerdas ha parido recientemente y el numero de animales que tiene que criar va a aumentar en los próximos meses. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Magali es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y muy entregada a su familia.
texts.en:
Magali, 27, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Punto Cuatro, Mochumí district, which is half-an-hour away from Chiclayo. Her husband works as a field hand, like most of the men in this area; his income is not sufficient to meet household expenses. For this reason, she went into pig farming. She raises her animals in her front yard and later sells them to merchants that come by her neighborhood to buy. Magali wants to get nutritionally balanced feed for pigs because one of her sows recently gave birth and Magali will have more pigs to feed in a few months. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1500 new sol, loan. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman so that she can give her children a better standard of living. Magali is a responsible, hard-working woman who is very dedicated to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced pig feed.

loans.name: Glenda Guadalupe

texts.es: Glenda Guadalupe C. V. de 30 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo, quien es empleado de una empresa privada, y sus dos hijos de 10 y cinco años de edad, los cuales asisten a la escuela de Lourdes Colón. Glenda con el deseo de poder ayudarle a su esposo con lo gastos del hogar, inicio una venta de perfumes para hombres y mujeres, así mismo vende cosméticos de diferentes marcas, dicho negocio esta ubicado en su casa, lugar en el cual tiene mucho clientes quien acuden a ella para comprar sus productos, ya sea para uso personal y para dar como regalo a otras personas. Glenda solicita un préstamo, ya que desea aumentar su inventario, comprando más productos de belleza y de esta manera ofrecerle mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes. Es así como de  esta forma ella desea aprovechar esta época del año en la cual las personas tienen por costumbre dar obsequios a sus seres queridos y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Glenda Guadalupe C. V. is 30 years old and lives in Lourdes Colón, in the department of La Libertad, El Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works at a privately-owned company, and with her two children who are 10 and 5 years old. They attend the public school in Lourdes Colón. Glenda, wanting to help her husband with the household expenses, began to sell men's and women's perfumes. She now sells various types and brand of cosmetics. Glenda runs this business from home, where her many customers go to purchase what she sells, either for their own use or as gifts for others. Glenda is asking for a loan because she wants to increase her inventory and buy more beauty products. This will let her offer a greater number of products to her clients. She wants to take advantage of the Valentine's Day season, when many people are thinking of giving gifts to their loved ones. She believes she can increase sales this way.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda S., 54, makes sure that her family has enough food for their daily needs. She has been managing her own barbeque stall for some time and has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source to buy the raw ingredients needed for her barbeque stall. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her family’s everyday needs.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying raw ingredients needed to continue production of her barbeques.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang K. (pictured above), age 54, has been married since 1978 and has four children: three sons and one daughter. The eldest son is a security guard, the second daughter weaves silk at home and the other two attend school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  

Heang has been a silk weaver for 30 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband used to be a primary school teacher. Because he is old, he is now retired. Heang is requesting her first loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Cinthia Raquel

texts.es:
Cinthia Raquel B. E., quien  Labora como EDUCADORA en el Mercado Oriental de Managua, ella tiene un hijo a su cargo,  y  este  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL durante este  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines para su casa de habitación .
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cinthia, who works with ECUADORA, in the Eastern Market of Managua, is married and has a school-aged son. This is her first loan through CEPRODEL this year and she will use the money to improve her home. She will use the money to buy building materials such as zinc metal sheeting and gutters for her home. She wants to provide greater security and better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis N. is 32 years old and lives in Ijevan city. He is married and has a son. For several years Sargis worked as a crane driver, after which he worked as head of security at one of the Ijevan companies.

Since 1993, Sargis and his parents have established their own business: fruit and vegetable trading at the Ijevan food market. With the profit from his business, Sargis has been able to start building his own shop and to support his family. He is asking for a 400,000 AMD loan to buy fruit and vegetables to resell. He intends to use his future income to finish building his own shop.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 54 años, es natural de la ciudad Urubamba, tiene 6 hijos y es viuda. Ya es un año que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender chicha los días miércoles, viernes y domingos en su domicilio y le va muy bien. Su actividad complementaria es vender verduras como por ejemplo lechugas, zanahorias, papas, cebollas china, repollos y zapallos en el mercado de “Sidrachayoc” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar fertilizante, insecticida y semillas.
 
Celestina es una mujer trabajadora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario dar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos. 

Celestina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celestina belongs to the communal bank “Sayhua” in the Asociación Arariwa. She is 54 years old, is a native of the city of Urubamba, has 6 children and is a widow. Already, she has been participating in the communal bank for a year.

Her main work is selling chicha (a fermented beverage) on Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays in her home and this is going very well. Her side job is selling vegetables such as lettuces, carrots, potatoes, onions, cabbages and pumpkins in the Sidrachayos market in the city of Urubamba. She needs a loan to purchase fertilizer, insecticide and seeds.

Celestina is a working woman who takes each moment to search for opportunities to get ahead and with daily work give a better future to her children. The goal of this member is to see her children find careers. Celestina is thankful for the opportunity offered through these means and also she promises to complete the payments corresponding to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticide and seed

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina tiene 42 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una panadería. Hace más de 7 años, que se dedica a esta actividad pues con la ayuda de su esposo han salido adelante y han mantenenido a sus 3 hijos que están a su cargo. Ella dio inicio a esta actividad porque necesitaba un medio de ingreso para sus hijos, además que no tenía un trabajo estable por lo que con sus propios ahorros logro comprar ciertas cosas pero logro comprar más herramientas hasta que solicito financiamiento pues para ella fueron muy importantes ya que fueron la clave para salir adelante.  Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de insumos necesarios para su negocio. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a 42-year-old woman who owns a bakery. She has been in business for over 7 years. She and her husband have been able to get ahead in life and support their 3 children. She started this business because she needed a source of income to raise her children. Furthermore, she did not have a steady job. With her savings, she was able to purchase certain things, but she was not able to buy more tools until she obtained some microloans, which have been the key to her success. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase the necessary supplies. Her wish is to be able to expand her business and meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan G. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Joan is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Joan runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Joan has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Joan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Joan from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina runs her boutique at her home. She uses a room for this work because she can’t pay the high rent for a shop. She takes orders from nearby areas and fulfills them to earn an income. She lives in a city called Multan which is famous for its sweetmeats and clothes in Pakistan. 

Zarina has always wanted to promote her talent of making embroidered clothes. God has given her the opportunity to display her work to people in her boutique. Her work has become the major source of generating income for her family.  

Zarina is looking to expand her business to generate even more income. Therefore, she has applied for a loan to buy more embroidery materials and to buy more variety of clothes.  She hopes that in this way she can help her family to have a better life, financially speaking.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery materials and clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Kenjebai

texts.en:
Kenjebai K. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own "ger," a traditional housing tent in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. His son is four years old and attends a local kindergarten. Since January 2010, Kenjebai has been renting a car repair center, a venture he undertook based on his three years of experience repairing cars and machines. 

Kenjebai is modest and hardworking, He is hopeful about the future and is looking to expand the scope of his work. He tells us that he has been planning to open his own car repair service center.  

He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary tools and equipment for his new business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary tools and equipment for his new business

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto P. de 45 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Jayaque, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa y sus cinco hijos de 17, 15, 10, 9 y 6 años de edad. Dagoberto se dedica a hacer viajes a personas particulares, las cuales deseen dirigirse a diferentes puntos del país, el es una persona muy respetada en su lugar de habitación y así mismo es muy responsable, también muy conocido en la zona ya que cuenta con 10 años de trabajar de esta manera. Dagoberto solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su automóvil y de esta manera brindarle el mantenimiento para este, así también para comprarle todos los repuestos necesario, ya que el desea poder brindar un mejor servicio, con toda la seguridad necesaria para sus clientes, de esta forma el podrá seguir contando con la confianza de las personas y las recomendaciones de ellos y así obtener más clientes. Esto último es de mucha importancia para Dagoberto ya que es el único que trabaja en su hogar, por lo que es necesario poseer trabaja diario para llevar el sustento a su casa.
texts.en:
Dagoberto P. is 45 years old and resides in Jayaque, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife and five children (ages 17, 15, 10, 9, and 6). Dagoberto provides chauffeur services to individuals who want to travel to different parts of the country. He is a highly respected person in his hometown and is very responsible. Dagoberto is well-known in other parts of the area since he has been in this business for ten years.

He is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can have the necessary funds to perform maintenance on his vehicle. Dagoberto also plans to buy all the spare parts that are needed so that he can provide the best service and safest conditions for his customers. He wants to continue earning their trust so that he can generate more recommendations and attract new customers. Since Dagoberto is the only member of his household who is working, it is necessary for him to have the means to earn a daily income so that he can support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Cabañitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Cabañitas tiene como presidenta a la señora Rosmery M. T., la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal D. Senkata. 
La señora Rosmery, con veinticuatro años D. edad, cumple responsablemente con sus diferentes tareas, como esposa, madre D. tres niños, presidenta D. su asociación comunal, además D. llevar adelante su propio negocio.  DesD. hace un año ella ha decidido ingresar en el negocio D. venta D. papa, vio que su capital no era suficiente, por lo que ahora trabaja con créditos D. Pro Mujer.
Su primer crédito fue por Bs 2000,  ahora solicita Bs 4000.- para invertir en la compra D. papa.
Las integrantes D. la asociación comunal, son ocho mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta D. verduras, tienda D. barrio, venta D. comida, venta D. papa, venta D. celulares, instalación D. gas. Por este ciclo la asociación tendrá pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
The Cabañitas communal bank has Rosmery M. T. as its president. This communal association belongs to the Senkata Regional Center. Rosmery is twenty-four years old. She fulfills her numerous roles very responsibly: as a wife, the mother of three children, and president of her communal bank, in addition to advancing her own business. One year ago, she decided to enter the business of selling potatoes. She found that her own capital was not sufficient, so she is now working with loans from Pro Mujer. Her first loan was for 2000 bolivianos, and now she is requesting 4000 bolivianos to invest in buying potatoes. The members of this communal association are eight women and one men. They have varied businesses, such as selling vegetables, running a neighborhood store, selling food, selling potatoes, selling cell phones, and installing gas lines. For this loan cycle, the association will make monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying potatoes to sell

loans.name: Rosa Violeta

texts.es:
Rosa de 55 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado),  tiene una tienda de vivieres en la parte delantera de su casa.  

Su esposo le ayuda en la tienda y tienen un hijos. Debido a los pocos ingresos que tenían, ellos decidieron invertir sus ahorros hace 4 años y comprar víveres y legumbres para vender a sus conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo, a podido tener una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 06h45am hasta las 21h00pm. 

El quiere el préstamo para poder mejorar la casa cemento, blosques, pinturas y así ampliar la tienda, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y comprar mas mercadería para cubrir con las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 55 years old, lives in the Perimetral de Guayaquil (suburban area bordered by a salt water stream). She has a general store on the front of her house. Her husband helps her with the store. They have one son. Due to their small income, four years ago they decided to invest their savings and purchase groceries and vegetables to sell to their acquaintances. Little by little their efforts made it possible for them to open a small store on the front of their house. She works from 6:45am to 9pm. She requests the loan to improve their home (cement, blocks and paint) and so be able to increase the size of the store. In the future, she want to finish her house and purchase more inventory to meet her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, blocks, paint

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Tamemsu” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are women with small-scale businesses who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, in order to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Aminata F. who was born in Makeni, thirty years ago. She is married to a police officer and has three children: one of her children is attending primary school and the others are not of school-going age.

For two years now, Aminata has been selling Magi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), salt, fish, oil, etc. She will use her share of this loan to buy the above mentioned goods in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy Magi, salt, fish and oil in large quantities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport fish to sell

loans.name: Nevisia

texts.en:
Nevesia D. is from the village of Bitibot, Sapang Dalaga. She is 45 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Nevesia runs a grocery store selling household items such as canned goods and other basic items. Nevesia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nevesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional capital for her business, and is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to be used for its expansion. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Nevesia from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely S. is from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Fely is married and has three school-aged children. To make a andliving, Fely owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services of computers, television set, and also DVD components and players. She is also continuing the buying and selling a variety of fish and other sea products in the market. Fely has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Fely is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fely from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Handhuu

texts.en:
Handhuu S. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in  Hovd province,  Mongolia. She and her family live in an apartment which was purchased from her previous loan profit. Her son attends a local secondary school while her daughter is in kindergarten. 

Handhuu operates a clothing retail trading business with help of her husband in their town. They started this business in 2001 and have built up a stable operation. Over the years she has gained much business experience and has built a positive reputation amongst her customers and suppliers. She attributes her business success to her good accounting skills. 

Handhuu is a hardworking and well-esteemed woman and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to import winter clothing items from China.

loans.use: To import winter clothing items

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn A. is 44 years old, married and supports her family by operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She lives in Sotio Quary, Barangay Rafaela, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Jonalyn is now borrowing PHP 22,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jonalyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more product to sell

loans.name: Aasia's Group

texts.en:
Aasia M. W. is a widow. She lost her husband as a result of a heart attack. This was a time of shock and great difficulties, but she overcame those difficulties with her courage and hard work. 

Aasia is the mother of three sons. She knew that, with her husband gone, she remained the only person to take care of her children. So she recovered herself and started a sewing business by taking orders from her neighbors. She worked day and night to impress her customers and she successfully did it through her good quality work.
  
She couldn’t educate her children due to poor financial conditions, but she helped them to establish their own work. Her eldest son is a plumber. The next runs a PCO (public call office), and the youngest operates his own business. They all contribute financially from their earning.
 
Aasia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because her old machine doesn’t produce a good quality of work and takes much time to sew one dress. With the new machine, Aasia will be able to sew more dresses in less time and double her income.
 
She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Aasia.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a food-vending business for the past three years, selling at the market, from home and door-to-door. Millicent faces a major challenges in transportation and seasonality in her business. She hopes to establish a cafe in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to start a retail shop purchase 40 pieces of Kikoi (a piece of colored cloth used as clothing and wrapped around the waist and legs or shoulders) and kitchen utensils (plates, jugs and glasses) for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To start a retail shop, purchase 40 pieces of kikois (a colorful wrap) and kitchen utensils (plates, jugs and glasses) for sale.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Sta. Rosa, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling charcoal, pig fattening and vegetable vending. Her husband, Federico B., who is 50 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are 9 to 25 years old. Thelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Thelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loans from NWTF helped her earn a monthly profit of 11,500 Philippines pesos (PHP), uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to fund her various business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for the expansion of her pig-fattening business. Thelma B. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
