Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for business operations

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia C. is from the village of Tuburan. She is 48 years old, married, and has four adult children. Nelia operates a family member's business in the food sector, selling fresh fish in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Nelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Nelia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fresh fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Nelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish

loans.name: Maritza Noemy

texts.es: Maritza: tiene 36 años D. edad es separada vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia tiene 10 años D. experiensia en vender productos Mexicanos,venD. en su domicillio y tambien es ambulante, ella tambien tiene una empresa D. miltiservicios (limpieza electricidad y construccion)ella tambien trabaja en la municipalidad D. el Puerto D. San Jose, su meta es ampliar su negocio D. productos mexicanos es por eso que solicita este credito para comprar productos comestibles Mexicanos, su sueño es sacar adelante a su hijos y verlos unos profecionales,
texts.en: Maritza is 36 years old, is separated, and lives with her two children in a house she owns. She has ten years of experience selling Mexican products which she sells in her home and as a street vendor. Martiza also has a cleaning a multi-services business (cleaning, electricity, and construction) and works at city hall in Puerto D. San Jose. Her goal is to expand her business of Mexican products which is why she is asking for this loan as she would like to buy groceries. Her dream is to give her children a good education and be able to see them become professionals.

loans.use: Compra de productos comestibles

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia is the resident of Gujranwala which is a famous industrial city of Pakistan. She has lived there in a 3 room brick house with her family in the area of Kalar abadi for over many years.  She is 53 years old and married to Y. M.. They have 5 children. 

Her husband works in a government organization for a low income.  H is income is quite low because he is illiterate, so sofia works in people houses doing their domestic work like dish washing etc to financially support her husband and family. 

Due to poor their financial conditions, she couldn’t provide education expenses for her children. Her eldest son works in the government sector and her eldest daughter works with her doing domestic work in people houses. Her remaining children stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband to start a transport business. With the loan, he will buy a donkey and a donkey cart and start providing transport services to his customers.   

Sofia is hopeful that this investment will give her husband’s business a good start and will increase her household income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. She is a very responsible client and has established a good credit record.

loans.use: To buy a donkey and a donkey cart to start a transport business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  pig fattening, buy & sell and frozen foods businesses.  She lives in Manapla, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her three businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,400.  Theresa is borrowing PHP 12,000 to fund her business operations.  This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 11,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Theresa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.
"

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Carla Ivonne

texts.es: La Señora Carla es una cliente que antes ya trabajo con nosotros en el Banco rayito de sol, la Sra.  Carla vive en la casa de sus suegros desde hace cuatro años trabaja con su esposo Ismael ya que el costura las faldas que  vende ella tiene un puesto el la  zona de la Uyustus además viaja al desaguadero a traer mercadería ellos tienen un pequeño hijo de una añito de edad Doña Carla y su esposo Ismael estudian por las noches tienen la intención de a un corto tiempo instalar un taller de costura y comenzar con su propia empresa el crédito que están solicitando es para la construcción de un cuarto en la casa de sus papas y así poder brindar mas comodidad a su familia, es una joven muy trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Carla is a client who used to work with us as part of the 'Rayito de Sol' bank.  She lives in her in-laws' house.  For four years she has been working with her husband Ismael.  He sews skirts and she sells them from a sales location in Uyustus.  She also travels to Desaguadero to bring back merchandise.  Carla and her husband have a little boy who is 1 year old.  They also study at night.  They intend, within a short period of time, to set up a sewing workshop and start their own company.  They are requesting this loan to build a room in his parents' home so that their family can be more comfortable.  Carla is a very hard-working young woman who is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy building supplies so that she can finish off a room in her home

loans.name: Aroub

texts.en:
Aroub and her husband are parents of two sons. Aroub's husband is a nurse. She took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home furniture.

Aroub needs kitchen equipment, a kitchen table and couches for the sitting room which she will buy with the loan she received.

Aroub is a conservative woman, therefore her husband is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: to purchase home furnishings.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio M. Z. y su esposa son una pareja muy trabajadora dispuesta a ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Anteriormente donde el vive no pasaba la tubería del drenaje por lo que tuvo que construir una fosa atrás de su vivienda para que todos los desperdicios cayeran  ahí, la colonia donde el vive ya cuenta con drenaje, por lo que ahora requiere tapar la fosa para instalar su propia tubería y realizar sus conexiones con el drenaje de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sergio M. Z. and his wife are a hard-working couple who want to provide the best they can for their children. 

Before, there was no sewage system where he lives so he had to put in a septic tank behind his house.  Now that the residential area has installed a sewage system he must cover the septic tank and install a drain pipe to connect to the city sewage system.

loans.use: To cover the septic tank and install a drain pipe

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. N. is a 39-year-old married man with three children.  

He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for the past six years. 

Through Faulu Kenya, he has stocked his shop, and hence he has more income. He has also been trained on business management and this has helped him to run his business well. 

He hopes that one day he will expand his shop into wholesale.  

He has requested 50,000 KES to buy cereals, sugar, cooking fat and shoes to resell.

loans.use: To buy cereals, sugar, cooking fat and shoes.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is married with two teenage children. She is a farmer from Vodyanoye, where she grows early spring vegetables in her garden and greenhouses. Nadezhda owns 2 land lots and 6 big arched greenhouses. She has been running her farming business for 9 years and has invested about 90,000 UAH in her business. Her annual expenses on seeds and polyethylene film amount to 45,000 UAH.  

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 7,000 UAH to purchase an irrigation unit for her garden, which will ensure reasonable and efficient water management. One of her long-term plans is to construct a new greenhouse on her land and continue expanding her business as a result. Note: This is a seasonal loan that will be repaid in 3 months.

loans.use: to purchase an irrigation unit for her garden.

loans.name: Idite Ginoca Jorge

texts.pt:
Idite Ginoca nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 30 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, fez a 7ª classe nao concluiu devido a sua gravidez. Vive na casa dos sogros é mãe de 2 filhos de 5 e 12 anos  ambos vão a Escola. Responsabiliza se pelo pai e pelos sogros que vivem com ela na mesma casa.

Após a gravidez passa a viver com seu marido, consegue aranjar um emprego no Hotel Libombos como cozinheira. Trabalha a mais de 11 anos das 7h as 15h no periodo da manhã e das 15h as 22h no periodo da noite auferindo mensalmente 2500.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Consegue poupar mensalmente 1.500.00mt porque conta com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha na Africa do Sul e envia lhe mensalmente 5.000.00mt.

Nunca trabalhou com outros Bancos para alem da Hluvuku, teve conhecimento atraves dos seus colegas que sao clientes da Instituição. Este e seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro com kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com  o qual pretende comprar material de construção( chapas de zinco, cimento, blocos, areia e outros) para dar continuidade da sua obra.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir um novo credito para iniciar com a Construção do murro de vedação e sair da casa dos sogros para a sua própria casa.
texts.en:
Idite Ginoca was born in the district of Namaacha.  She is 30-years-old and is married.  She finished through 7th grade and didn’t finish school because she became pregnant.  She lives in her in-laws’ home and is the mother of 2 children, who are 5 and 12.  Both of them go to school.  She is financially responsible for her father and her in-laws.

After she became pregnant, she moved in with her husband and found a job at the Hotel Libombos as a cook.  She has worked there for more than 11 years from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. and from 3 p.m. to 10 p.m.  She makes 2,500 meticals a month, which she puts towards her household’s expenses.  She saves 1,500 meticals a month because she has help from her husband who works in South Africa and sends her 5,000 meticals a months.

She has never worked with other banks besides Hluvuku.  She became familiar with them through her colleagues, who are clients of the institution.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva in the amount of 15,000 meticals.  She will use it to buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, bricks, sand, etc.) to continue working on her home.

She is confident that she will make her payments on time so she can request another loan to begin construction on a boundary wall so she can move from her in-laws’ home to her own home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, bricks, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Mere

texts.en:
Mere is a 58-year-old married woman and mother of three children living and working in Qana, South Lebanon. She has been baking saj bread (a type of flatbread baked on a domed or convex metal griddle) for many years in order to improve her family's poor financial situation and cover some of their expenses. Mere has been an Al Majmoua borrower for six loan cycles. She is a good standing borrower and all her previous loans have greatly helped in increasing and expanding her business and in improving her family's situation.

Saj bread is much requested by most villagers, tourists and friends and Mere hopes to stay active and capable of meeting her customer's needs. All she asks for is to stay healthy and to open a larger bakery for her children, in order to expand her business more in the future.

loans.use: To buy saj flour and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en: Jenilyn is married and has two children. She is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she works as a farmer and also raises goats and cows. She is just starting her businesses and is applying for this loan to buy livestock feed and other supplies. She has been a member of PMPC for about a year.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Sevada

texts.en: Sevada keeps livestock and cultivates land. He has been engaged in agriculture for the past five years. Sevada needs some financial means to finish cultivating the land. With the loan’s help, Sevada will cultivate the land successfully and develop agriculture. Agricultural development will help Sevada increase his income and support his son in starting a new family. Besides, Sevada wants his daughter to get a high education, so additional income will help him to pay for her education in the future. Sevada lives together with his wife, son and daughter.

loans.use: to finish cultivating his land

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Esteban. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad los  mismos que  estudian en  escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Ella lleva seis años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe al ser socia del banco.

Ella comparte su tiempo entre su hogar y su negocio ya que se dedica también a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus conocidos cuando necesitan alguna prenda de vestir. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas, ella aprovecha que sus hijos a esta hora están en la escuela para realizar su trabajo fuera de su casa, deja a crédito sus productos   y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil una vez al mes. Tiene diez  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Sus sueños es seguir trabajando y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'San Esteban' community bank meet in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet 39 year-old Martha who is married and has two children, aged 10 and 8, who are attending school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  Martha has been a member of her community bank for six years and she likes it for the benefits that she receives from being a member.

Martha divides her time between her home and her business.  She sells all types of clothes door to door.  She also sells from her home where her acquaintances come when they need to buy clothes.  She works every morning.  She makes the most of the fact that her children are in school in the morning and uses that time to carry out her work outside of her home.  She leaves her goods on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil once a month.  Martha has been in this business for ten years now and it is doing quite well.

Martha will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

Martha's dreams are to continue working and to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes

loans.name: Braulia Teresa

texts.es: La señora Braulia Teresa se dedica a la venta de comestibles conjuntamente con su esposo lo cual ambos se ayudan en los ingresos y gastos familiares ya que tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, la solicitante vive en un Asentamiento Humano en casa de esteras con su familia por el cual está solicitando el crédito para ampliar su negocio para la comprando de mercadería de ropa temporada  primavera otoño de esta forma le va permitir a la solicitante tener mayor ingreso económico y tener mejor calidad de vida para su familia.Se propone otorgarle el crédito ya que cuenta con buenas referencias personales y tiene aptitud para asumir una nueva responsabilidad crediticia.
texts.en:
Sra. Braulia Teresa sells food products with her husband. They help one other with generating income and paying the family expenses. They have three children who are of school age. Braulia Teresa lives in the settlement of Casa de Esteras with her family.

She is requesting this loan so that she can expand her business. Braulia Teresa plans to buy seasonal clothing for the spring and autumn seasons so that she can generate more income and provide a better quality of life for her family. Upon applying for this loan, she presented good personal references and indicated her ability to assume this new credit responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase clothing so that she can expand the range of products that she sells.

loans.name: Nefisa

texts.en:
Nefisa is 40 years old. She has three children. One of her children is in school. She is a widow. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator branch. She has been running this business for five years.

Nefisa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says the profit will help her build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Leah Group

texts.en:
Leah is 34 years old and lives in Mahayag. She is married with 2 children. 

Leah has a mango retail business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14000 to  purchase a wide-meshed basket of mango for her business.  Leah has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase a wide-meshed basket of mango for her retail mango business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca making.

loans.name: Duo Solidario La Cumbre Group

texts.es:
DUO LA CUMBRE
Este dúo está formado por don Francisco de 55 años de edad casado, tiene 5 hijos que ya están grandes y casados,el es el lider de este duo vende churrascos en su casa desde hace mas de 25 años,  y también tiene una mini tienda, y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas productos comestibles para surtir mas su tienda, también esta doña María Estefana de 45 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos, casada, y se dedica a la venta de tortilla desde hace 15 años y está solicitando este crédito porque necesita comprar maíz, y leña que necesita para hacer las tortillas y venderlas, ya que comprando bastante le sale a buen precio y así puede obtener ganancias, ella ha sido socia de fape anteriormente y ahora solicita este nuevo crédito mensual esperando no quedar mal y seguir trabajando para superarse y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
DUO LA CUMBRE: This partnership was formed by Francisco who is 55 years old and married. He has five children who are grown and married. He is the leader of this partnership. He has been selling barbequed steak in his home for 25 years. He also has a mini-market. He is asking for this loan to buy more foodstuffs to stock his store. 

Also, there is María Estefana who is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She has been selling tortillas for 15 years. She is asking for this loan because she needs to buy corn and wood, which she needs to make and sell tortillas, since by buying a lot she gets a good price and can make more money.  She has been a borrower with FAPE previously and now she asks for this new loan, each month hoping to be successful and continue working to benefit and support her family.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.en: Danilo is in his third year running a small convenience store. His last loan enabled him to diversify his inventory and grow his customer base. His business has been doing really well in the last year and he is ready to again expand his inventory. He will use the new loan to buy bulk quantities of basic grains, sodas, drinks and snacks. This loan enables Danilo to buy his products in bulk and at lower prices so that his returns are greater. Danilo hopes to continue growing and reinvesting in his business so he can provide a stable future for his wife and 8-year-old son. Danilo's son is in third grade and he is proud that he can afford to have his son continue his education.

loans.use: To invest in buying products to increase his sales

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 71 years old and lives in Mitazan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. 

To earn a living, Isabel has a business selling dried fish. She earns about PHP 1,5000 each month doing this type of work. Isabel has a requested a loan of  PHP 14,900 to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Isabel has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Isabel would like to have a space in the market.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, who is 46 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eladio, a worker, and is the mother of four children. Together with her husband and children, Yolanda manages the household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Yolanda operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines such as bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells papaya and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community and she earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Yolanda is requesting a 21,000 PHP loan to help continue to operate her business. She will use her loan to buy more quantities of fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Yolanda dreams of being able to give her all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell

loans.name: Maria Isaura

texts.es: María, nuevamente adquirirá otro crédito, porque necesita invertir  en su negocio y comprara  frutas como: guineos, uvas, papaya, manzanas, a si podrá incrementar más sus ventas y tener más variedad para sus clientes. El anterior crédito le ayudo a mejorar en sus ventas y a obtener mejores ingresos, con eso logro que su familia este mejor económicamente.
texts.en:
María will be getting another loan, because she needs to invest in her business and buy fruit such as bananas, grapes, papayas, and apples. 

This will enable her to increase her sales and have more variety for her clients. The previous loan helped her to improve her sales and obtain better income. With that, she managed to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: To buy fruit such as bananas, grapes, papayas and apples.

loans.name: José Eligio

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 51 años de edad, es casado con tres hijos.

Él se ha dedicado toda su vida a realizar actividades agrícolas,  y fue su papá quien le enseño este trabajo. Se desplaza largas distancias todos los días, a cuidar a su ganado para obtener ingresos para su familia. Los insumos que necesita para realizar su trabajo los adquiere en una ciudad que se encuentra a 40 kilómetros de distancia.

José solicita un préstamo para comprar de dos a tres vacas lecheras, para sacarles leche y procesarla y vender queso, de esta forma tendrá una fuente de ingresos y las alimentara de lo que él cosecha.

José desea brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, y cuidar de su papá ya que esta muy enfermo y él quiere darle todo lo que pueda mientras lo tenga a su lado.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old and is married with three children.

He has spent his whole life performing agricultural work and it was his father who taught him about this work. He travels long distances every day to care for his livestock and to earn an income for his family. He acquires the supplies he needs to complete his work in a city that is 40 kilometers away. 

José seeks a loan to buy 2-3 milk cows, to collect and process milk from and to sell cheese. This way he will have a source of income and he will feed them what he grows.

José wants to provide a better quality of life for his family and to care for his father who is very sick. He wants to give him all that he can while he has him by his side.

loans.use: to buy 2-3 milk cows

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua  is a widow and sells "banku" (maize dumplings) and saucepans at Besease near Elmina.  She has been in this business for the past 15 years now. She has three children. Ekua is responsible for the upkeep of her children. She will use her loan to purchase more saucepans and maize for sale.  She plans to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more saucepans and maize for sale.

loans.name: Karina Viviana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo De Mujeres.

En este lugar vive la señora Karina, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y  aun no tienen hijos  pero espera en un futuro cercano poder tener sus hijos para que alegren su hogar. Su esposo es comerciante. Esta desde el inicio en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los crédito ella puede financiar su negocio.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Trabaja tres días de la semana a cualquier hora que pueda o que sus clientes necesiten,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Lleva más de tres años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The members of the “Desarrollo de Mujeres” communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Karina, 23, here.  She’s married but does not have children yet although she expects to be able to have children in the future so that they will bring joy to the home.  Her husband’s a merchant.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because thanks to the loans she’s able to finance her business.

She is a very good housewife who also sells all types of clothes door to door and also at home where her best known customers come by to buy.  She works three days a week at whatever time she can or when her customers need her. She sells on credit and collects payments weekly or every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise whenever she needs to.  She’s been in this business for over three years and she does very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  Her dream is to have a car to do her sales.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a farmer who lives in Likoni, Kenya. He started the farming business eight years ago by planting maize. He learned of Milango through her friends and joined to access credit.
George is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase a water pump. Despite the challenge of seasonal weather, George intends to purchase a maize/”posho” mill in future. 
He will use the extra income to plant maize and purchase pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Marana

texts.en:
Marana is 49 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling fruits and vegetables. Marana aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Perla has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Perla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Perla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a hardworking 47-year-old living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the last twenty years, and his major hardships have been price fluctuations, inflation, and seasonal weather variations. He has a vision of venturing into mechanized agriculture and hiring employees to help expand his farm. Charles needs the loan to hire tractors for digging.

loans.use: to hire tractors for digging.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth  es una persona joven trabajadora,  tiene 19  años de edad, viven en  una  comunidad  alejado del pueblo por  la lejanía no pudo terminar sus estudios de secundaria otro de los factores fue para la culminación de sus estudios no abandonar a sus hermanitos menores ya que por el abandono de su madre tuvo que hacerse cargo ella como hermana mayor cumpliendo la labor de madre.  
Esta época por el desastre natural de la sequía su pequeña parcela de cebolla no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que ella esperaba es el único ingreso que tiene para mantenerse y a mantener a sus pequeños hermanitos ya que el padre se dedicó a buscar su vida propia. 
 Lizbeth   es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a sus pequeños hermanitos y su trabajo que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a sus hermanitos, ella está solicitando el crédito para compra semilla de zanahoria y   abono orgánico. Para producir más y de esta manera aumentar su producción para mejorar sus ingreso económico y  darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hermanitos y de esta manera pueda enviarles  a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a Lizbeth y a sus hermanitos  en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Lizbeth  is a hard working 19 year old. She lives in a community outside of a remote village. She was not able to finnish high school. 

One of the reasons was because she did not want to abandon her small siblings. Her mother has abandoned them so she takes care of them as the oldest sister and mother. 

This season due to the drought her small plot of onions did not mature well. This natural disaster caused her to lose the income she was expecting. 

This is the only income she had to take care of herself and her small siblings since their father left them. 

Lizbeth is very loved and respected person where she lives. She is very dedicated to her small siblings and her work. Sometimes she has to do day work in the farms in order to earn a few pesos so she can take care of her small siblings.

She is asking for a loan to buy carrot seeds and organic fertilizer. This will allow her to produce more, increase her production and improve her income. 
She can then give her siblings a better quality of life and send them to school under better conditions. 

The loan will help Lizbeth and her siblings a lot in the hard work that she does.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nyuma

texts.en:
Nyuma is grateful that he was able to secure his first loan from Kiva, and he was able to repay the loan. His business that has been running for more than ten years is growing, and he has decided to open another branch of her business in Mombasa town. 

The challenges in the business have been high fuel and transportation costs, and this has made him decide to open another shop closer to where the demand is. The extra income that he will raise will help him to introduce new product lines into his business.

loans.use: to open another branch of his business in Mombasa.

texts.es:
Carmita es una mujer de 42 años, soltera, no tiene hijos. Vive en Santo Domingo de los Colorados en casa de un hermano allí tiene su local.
 Carmita hace 4 años cuenta con un bazar, además realiza manualidades para vender y por esto es muy conocida en el barrio. Cuenta con su propia casa pero como no cuenta con el espacio para su negocio no ha podido ir a habitarla y ahora la tiene arrendada. Su sueño es con sus ingresos poco a poco ir mejorándola para ponerse su propio local.  Carmita acudió a Fundación Alternativa para para nuevamente ser favorecida con un crédito, ahora necesita comprar materia prima para realizar sus manualidades por la temporada navideña ya desea surtir su negocio, ella agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por la ayuda que le brindan para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmita is 42 years old, single and has no children. She lives in Santo Domingo de los Colorados in the house of a brother. She has her store here. For four years she has run her shop. Besides this she makes handicrafts for sale and is well known in the neighborhood for this activity. She has her own house but doesn't have the room there for her shop so she does not live there and it is leased out. With her income increasing little by little her dream is to own her own shop.

Carmita has come to Fundación Alternativa to once again ask for a loan. She needs to buy raw material to make her handicrafts for the Christmas season as she wants to stock her store. She is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support they offer her to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make more decorative items for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Mrs. Rose O. is a 50 years old woman married with two (2) children; she lives in semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She started her trade in the year 1990 after under going training for one year. She solicits for the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sales

loans.name: Docia

texts.en: Docia's dream is to have her own shop where she can sell her goods. She has done all she can to make this dream a reality. She is in need of a Kiva loan of $900.00 to enable her to open her own shop.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel sells music CD's and videos. She buys them wholesale for retail sale. She lives in the Villa Mayor neighborhood in La Paz and sells in fairs like the July 16th fair in El Alto. Her track record with our institution qualifies her as a class 2 borrower, which is to say she has a record of regular repayment. This loan will pay for merchadise. Her experience recommends her for this loan and she will have income to repay it.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Isabel es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de Videos y Cds musicales , compra por mayor para venderlo al detalle. Vive en la zona de villa victoria de la Ciudad de La Paz, y su puesto esta ubicado en las ferias como la 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 2, es decir con cumplimiento regular en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra mercaderia (Cds, Vds. Musicales y videos) Su trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
ESTER is 25 years old, married, and has one son. Her husband is dedicated to renting movies. She has a little business in her home where she sells clothes and linens. WIth the loan she hopes to increase her merchandise and begin selling from house to house in her community. She is a member of the group "Aries 2" along with doña Hermelinda Encina Pérez (who sells bread from house to house), doña Julia Gómez Álvarez (who sells clothes), and Ángela López Pérez (who makes crafts with amber). With the loan they hope to invest in their businesses by acquiring more merchandise and increasing sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

ESTER, tiene 25 años, casada, 1 hijo, su esposo se dedica a la renta de películas. Ella tiene en su casa un pequeño negocio en donde vende ropa y lencería, con el préstamo espera aumentar su mercadería y comenzar a vender casa por casa en su comunidad. Pertenece al grupo Aries 2 junto con doña Hermelinda Encina Pérez (venta de pan casa por casa) y doña Julia Gómez Álvarez (vende ropa) y Ángela López Pérez (artesanía en ámbar). Con el préstamo esperan invertir en sus negocios aumentando las ventas al adquirir más mercancía.

loans.use: Selling clothes and linens

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng N., 44, lives with her husband and 4 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. She earns $5 a day selling the vegetables that her husband grows on their land. She has applied for this loan in order to dig a well and buy a water pumping machine to irrigate their land and increase the amount of crops that will grow. This hardworking couple intend to continuously expand their business in the future.

loans.use: To dig a well and buy a water pumping machine for irrigation purposes

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Lân, 34 years old, was a member in a difficult situation: unmarried and had no money. With the loans from the fund, she invested in retails business. She opened a general store selling footwear and beauty accessories among other things. She is now the owner of a spacious store. Her revenue is about 125 USD a month. She's applying for a loan of 500 USD to buy more stock for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lân, 34 tuổi là một thành viên có hoàn cảnh đơn thân hết sức khó khăn, không có vốn để chăn nuôi buôn bán. Từ khi có Quỹ chị đã vay tối đa các vòng vốn và đầu tư vào buôn bán. Chị đã mở quầy hàng buôn bán giày dép mỹ phẩm với mức thu nhập 125 USD/tháng chị đã có một quầy hàng khang trang. Dự tính hết vòng vốn này chị sẽ vay mức vốn 500 USD để mở rộng các mặt hàng kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the community bank "Teresa Ramos" and lives in the district of Yarina Cocha, department of Ucayali. She is 41 years old and the mother of 2 children, one who goes to university and the other who is of legal age. She is married and her husband sells lubricants. His income was not enough to cover their household expenses so Rosa, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos, decided to put a small restaurant in her home.

She currently opens the restaurant only for breakfast and lunch; at night she rests up for the following day´s tasks. She starts her activities at 4:00 in the morning while, at the same time, she takes care of her children.

With a loan from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 3 kilos of rice, 1 kilo of sugar, vegetables, 2 sets of dishes, and a dozen spoons. In addition, she will also invest in maintenance of the kitchen, which needs repair. She will also expand and improve her establishment, for which she will need 5 sacks of cement, 4 meters of rubble, and 5 iron rods.

Rosa is very content because she sees that more and more people come to her restaurant. This gives her greater desire to get ahead in her business, which allows her to cover the expenses of her daughter´s university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Teresa Ramos”, vive en Jr. Ruperto Pérez S/N, del distrito de Yarina Cocha del departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años y es madre de 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta en la universidad y el otro es mayor de edad. Está casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta de lubricantes, pero el ingreso que tiene no les alcanza para los gastos del hogar, es así que Rosa, con el primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos, decide poner un pequeño restaurante en su misma casa.

En la actualidad atiende en su restaurante solo con desayunos y almuerzos, ya que en la noche descansa temprano para la faena del día siguiente. Inicia sus actividades a partir de las 4.00 de la mañana, paralelamente atiende a sus hijos.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 3 kilos de arroz, 1 kilo de azucar, S/. 50.00 de verduras, 2 juegos de Platos, 1 docena de cucharas. Además invertirá en el mantenimiento de su cocina la cual necesita reparacipon. También ampliará y mejorara su establecimiento, para ello necesitará 5 bolsas de cemento, 4 metros de ripio y 5 varillas de fierro.

Rosa esta muy contenta porque ve que su restaurante es cada vez mas concurrido, esto le da mayores ganas de salir adelante en su negocio, el cual le permite cubrir los gastos de los estudios universitarios de su hija.

loans.use: Purchase of food supplies and kitchen utensils. Repair and maintenance of commercial premises.

loans.name: Kholiknazarova

texts.en:
Kholiknazarova V. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has a child.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and she recommended herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. 

She is engaged in the business of food products selling.  She has a wide assortment (milk-sour products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products and etc) and repeat customers.  

But working in the trade sphere she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers.  It permits her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business.  Mrs. Kholiknazarova requests a loan of $1200 for business development and widening of assortment.

loans.use: For business development and widening assortment.

loans.name: Lazaro Bernardo

texts.es:
Lazarus was born in Jinotepe February 8, 1954. He is married and has 3 male children aged 12, 13 and 15 years. His wife is 48 years old and she is dedicated to taking care of her home and family. At present they reside in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. Lazarus act as a security guard and has 4 years experience in this profession. He requests the loan to buy a wooden door for the front door of his house, since the one that is in use has become very deteriorated, and does not provide security for them, since the old thing that it is could break at any moment.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Lázaro nació en Jinotepe el 8 de Febrero de 1954. Es casado y tiene 3 hijos varones de 12, 13 y 15 años. Su esposa tiene 48 años y se dedica al cuido del hogar y de su familia. Actualmente habitan en el barrio Hialeah de Managua. Lázaro se desemP. como guarda de seguridad, tiene 4 años dedicandose a esta profesión. Solicita el crédito para comprar una puerta de madera para la puerta principal de su casa, ya que la que está en uso se encuentra muy deteriorada, y no les brinda seguridad, ya que por lo vieja que está se rompería en cualquier momento.

loans.use: To replace the wooden door on the front of his house

loans.name: Hermanas De Pantoja Group

texts.en:
Beata is a 27-year-old woman who lives with her husband and five children in the suburb of Los Alcarrizzos on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She has a small business where she prepares and sells fried foods to her community members; she has named her business Friatura Beata. She is asking for this loan so that she can buy a wider variety of vegetables and meats to sell her community members—without more capital she is restricted to buying the same, lower-priced meats and vegetables.

Her dream is to see her business grow so one day she can have her own building. For her children, she hopes to see them continue studying so that they can be professionals one day. For herself, she wants to become something and be someone important in her community—she hopes that through her hard work she can achieve this.

Her biggest challenge in life is to never give up—she has to make herself always fight to arrive at the place that she envisions for herself and her family. In the little free time that Beata has she says that she loves to read the Bible.

On behalf of Beata and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support of her loan!

loans.use: Purchase meat and vegetables to cook

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Verón is a shopkeeper with the San Geronimo company in the town of Santa María Misiones. She is married and has two sons and two daughters. She and her husband Sr. Luis Ayala and the children live in their own house.

She is the owner of a business that sells general foodstuffs, clothing, shoes, and bazaar antiques that are at least 8 years old—things of that nature. She runs the business herself and is helped by her children. Her husband grows sugar cane, cassava, corn, green beans etc. on a 6-hectare piece of land that they own. The sugar cane is sold commercially, and the family consumes the rest. All their children are in either primary or secondary school. As the business and farm are well-managed, the children can attend school and the family are making improvements to their home.

Sra. Isabel is asking for a loan that she will use to buy sugar, dairy products, baked goods, flour, pasta, t-shirts, jeans, sports shoes etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La emprendedora Isabel Verón, comerciante de la compañía San Geronimo de la ciudad de Santa María Misiones, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, 2 varones y 2 mujeres, viven en casa propia junto con sus hijos y su esposo el Sr. Luis Ayala.

Es propietaria de un comercio donde posee venta de comestibles en general, ropería, zapatería y venta de artículos de bazar con una antigüedad de 8 años en el ramo. Su negocio es atendido por ella misma y sus hijas que la ayudan, su esposo posee cultivos de caña dulce, mandioca, maíz, poroto, entre otros de los cuales comercializa la caña dulce y el resto lo utilizan para autoconsumo en un campo de su propiedad de 6 hectáreas.

Sus hijos todos se encuentran cursando sus estudios primarios y secundarios, gracias al buen manejo del negocio y sus cultivos sus hijos pueden acceder a recibir educación como así también realizan mejoras en su vivienda.

Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de mercaderías azúcar, lácteos, panificados, harina, pasta, remeras, jeans, calzados deportivos, entre otros.

loans.use: Purchase of items such as sugar, dairy products, baked goods, flour, pasta, t-shirts, jeans, sports shoes etc.

loans.name: Rehema's Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 30 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 5 and 10 years old. Rehema sells rice. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Rehema has taken out and repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more rice for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Maimuna and Zainabu, who sell charcoal and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Theodora is a widow with two children. She has been selling sewing machine parts for almost 38 years in the local market. Business has been sturdy and therefore she wants to use the loan to buy more parts and also to add on sewing materials like polyester, buttons, threads, linen and also polythene bags to increase her income.

Theodora is a member of the group called Sons of God. Members agree in common to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine parts

loans.name: Bisolima

texts.en:
Bisolima K., 44, is a widow and has two children. She has almost never had anyone's assistance in helping her children get ahead, so for 21 years, she has been working sewing dresses in a tailor shop. This has been her only income to support and educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to have the entire responsibility for her family. But her love for her children is what drives her forward from day to day.

Bisolima’s work is specialized: sewing European-style dresses for women as well as dresses in the national style. During her long years of activity, she has gained a rich experience in tailoring.

Bisolima herself purchases the fabrics required for sewing in the local market of “Korvon”. On average she sews four dresses and makes an income of 100-120 Somoni (about US$ 30-35) a day.

Bisolima always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else. She believes that someday her dream will come true and she will open her own tailor shop. Today she is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni (US$ 1000), which she will repay over 6 months, in order to purchase modern fabrics for sewing dresses.

Bisolima is counting on your help. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dream become reality.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children. She became a food seller in 1995. She works every day, earning a monthly profit of about US$140 from the sales.

Mauwa now hopes to receive a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas to increase the inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of food items to increase store inventory
